* All specified visual elements are updated according to the latest branding guidelines.
* Animations are refined for smoother transitions and better visual appeal.
* Feedback from the marketing team is fully incorporated.

* Final video is delivered in the required formats and resolutions for all distribution channels.

data.title: Friday Crypto Newsletter
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Friday Crypto Newsletter

**Description:** Develop and distribute the weekly Friday Crypto Newsletter, featuring the latest cryptocurrency news, market analysis, upcoming events, and expert insights to engage our subscriber base.

**Business Rationale:** Providing a consistent and informative newsletter helps maintain and grow our community, establishes our authority in the crypto space, and drives user engagement and retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Content includes at least five relevant crypto news items, two market analysis sections, and one expert opinion piece.
* Newsletter design adheres to brand guidelines and is mobile-responsive.
* Content is reviewed and approved by the editorial team by Thursday 2 PM.
* Scheduled for distribution to the entire subscriber list by Friday 9 AM.
* Confirmation of successful delivery and initial engagement metrics tracked.

data.title: Social Channels Auditing Report
data.description:
Goal: To do detailed analysis of the social media channels to define/enhance existing marketing strategy

Note: We have decided to put Reddit and Quora on hold as the idea was to engage Caleb but it is not possible now. 

1. Reddit and Quora need a lot of work and effort to build community especially when Quora is absolute zero at the moment
2. Caleb is not familiar with the platforms and with NL starting, we will not have enough resources.
3. We can concentrate on X, Telegram, YouTube and Tiktok.

comments.body: [https://messari.io/news](https://messari.io/news) this news section is very good. Looks fully automated.
Added updates in the document. They talk about their products and services. Arkham tag the signup page in each and every posts in thread.

if these are auto-generated reports then they are very good. It seems they have automated just we have for research site. 

team or guest writers are giving their analysis on the website and they are auto-posted on the telegram channel.

We are doing this with code reviews, deep dives etc

@talha from reviewing the document, it seems we might need to either hire individual staff for each channel or automate it. I believe companies like Crypto Quant should also be studied.

[https://t.me/cryptoquant_official](https://t.me/cryptoquant_official)
@talha thanks, it's a good start. Please also add our direct competition like Gmgn, Photon, Bulls X, Dexscreener, Nansen, Messari, Bubble Maps, Arkham Intelligence, and Dextools.

3. We can concentrate on X, Telegram, YouTube and Tiktok.

data.title: Wednesday Crypto Newsletter
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Wednesday Crypto Newsletter

**Description:**
Create and distribute a weekly Wednesday Crypto Newsletter to deliver the latest cryptocurrency news, market trends, and expert insights to our subscribers.

**Business Rationale:**
A consistent crypto newsletter will engage our audience, establish our brand as a leader in the cryptocurrency space, and drive subscriber growth and retention by providing valuable and timely information.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Content is curated and approved by Caleb Nnamani by Tuesday 5 PM each week.
2. Newsletter includes at least 5 relevant news articles, market updates, and expert analyses.
3. Follows the approved newsletter template and is optimized for all devices.
4. Successfully sent to the entire subscriber list every Wednesday at 9 AM.
5. Post-distribution metrics (open rates, click-through rates) are tracked and reported.

data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Research Content Strategy Enhancements

**Description:**
Conduct comprehensive research on current content trends, audience preferences, and competitor strategies to identify opportunities for enhancing our content strategy. Analyze findings to provide actionable recommendations that align with our business objectives.

**Business Rationale:**
Staying updated with the latest content trends and understanding our audience's needs are essential for maintaining engagement, increasing reach, and outperforming competitors. This research will help optimize our content strategy, driving better results and supporting overall business growth.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Completed research report detailing current content trends, audience insights, and competitor analysis.
2. Identification of at least three key opportunities for content strategy improvement.
3. Actionable recommendations presented to the content team for implementation.
4. Documentation of sources and methodologies used in the research.

**Assignee:** Talha Ahmad

data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Improve Meetings Management

**Description:**
Enhance the meetings management system to streamline scheduling, tracking, and follow-up processes. This includes integrating calendar functionalities, automating reminders, and providing tools for recording meeting minutes and action items.

**Business Rationale:**
Efficient meetings management reduces scheduling conflicts, ensures timely attendance, and facilitates clear communication of decisions and responsibilities. This leads to increased productivity and better project outcomes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Integrate with major calendar services (e.g., Google Calendar, Outlook) for seamless scheduling.
* Implement automated email and in-app reminders for upcoming meetings.
* Provide a feature to record and share meeting minutes and action items.
* Allow users to track attendance and follow up on assigned tasks.
* Ensure the system is user-friendly and has been validated through user testing.

**Title:** Create and Publish The Daily Crypto Podcast

**Description:** Develop a daily podcast focused on cryptocurrency by utilizing the newsletter and additional research to write engaging scripts. Produce and publish the podcast every weekday (Monday through Friday) to provide consistent and valuable insights to our audience.

**Business Rationale:** Launching a daily crypto podcast will enhance our content portfolio, increase audience engagement, and position our brand as a leading authority in the cryptocurrency space.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Scripts are written daily using the newsletter and relevant research.
2. Podcast episodes are recorded, edited, and finalized each weekday.
3. Episodes are published to all designated platforms by end of each workday, Monday through Friday.
4. Each episode meets quality standards for audio clarity and content accuracy.
5. Initial listener metrics meet predefined targets within the first month of launch.

data.title: Engage Reddit Users - Improve SEO
data.description:
Drive attention to Token Metrics through strategic engagements in the crypto subreddits.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Engage Reddit Users to Enhance SEO

**Description:** Implement strategic engagements within targeted crypto subreddits to increase visibility and drive traffic to Token Metrics.

**Business Rationale:** Leveraging active Reddit communities can boost SEO by generating backlinks, increasing brand awareness, and driving organic traffic. This will enhance Token Metrics' online presence, attract potential users, and support overall growth objectives.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Identify and target at least five relevant crypto-focused subreddits.
2. Develop and execute a content engagement plan, including regular posts and interactions, over a three-month period.
3. Achieve a minimum of 10,000 new website visitors from Reddit referrals.
4. Demonstrate improvements in SEO metrics, such as increased domain authority and higher search rankings for key keywords.
5. Maintain positive community feedback and adhere to subreddit guidelines, ensuring no negative responses or bans.

Description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Increase Blog Postings to Achieve 250K Monthly Traffic

**Description:**
Enhance the quantity and quality of blog posts managed by Roshan Ganesh to reach a target of 250,000 monthly website visitors.

**Business Rationale:**
Achieving 250K monthly traffic will boost brand visibility, generate more leads, improve SEO rankings, and drive revenue growth.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Monthly website traffic consistently reaches or exceeds 250,000 visitors.
* Publish a minimum of \[X\] high-quality blog posts each month.
* Achieve an average engagement rate of \[Y\]% on blog content.
* Improve SEO rankings for targeted keywords by \[Z\] positions.

data.title: Memes and GIFs for SM
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Develop Memes and GIFs Strategy for Social Media to Achieve 250K Monthly Traffic

**Description:**
Create a series of engaging memes and GIFs tailored for our social media channels to increase user interaction and drive website traffic. These visual assets should reflect our brand identity and resonate with our target audience.

**Business Rationale:**
Utilizing memes and GIFs can enhance our social media presence by making content more relatable and shareable. This approach aims to boost user engagement and contribute to achieving the goal of 250K monthly website visitors, thereby increasing brand visibility and potential conversions.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Design and produce at least 20 unique memes and 15 GIFs aligned with the brand voice.
* Schedule and publish the assets across all relevant social media platforms.
* Achieve a minimum 10% increase in social media engagement metrics (likes, shares, comments) within two months.
* Reach or exceed 250K monthly website visitors originating from social media channels.

data.title: Captions AI Video Generation
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Captions AI Video Generation

**Description:**
Implement an AI-driven system to automatically generate accurate and synchronized captions for all video content on the platform, enhancing accessibility and user experience.

**Business Rationale:**
Automated captions improve accessibility for users with hearing impairments, comply with accessibility regulations, and enhance SEO, which can drive increased monthly traffic towards the target of 250K visitors.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Captions are generated with at least 95% accuracy.
2. Captions synchronize with video playback within a 1-second margin.
3. The system supports multiple languages as required.
4. Users can easily enable or disable captions through the video player interface.
5. Implementation does not degrade video loading times by more than 10%.

data.title: booth designs ASAP for the Token Metrics API
data.description:
Please create these booth designs ASAP for the Token Metrics API.
[https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1154QhTVgqVapvtxERltwSSq_0KYBHtqS](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1154QhTVgqVapvtxERltwSSq_0KYBHtqS)
**1. Standing Desk + Banner (Personalized)**
Your dedicated space will serve as a key engagement point for attendees to interact with your team and learn about Tokenmetrics.

 Personalized standing desk setup

 Branded banner placement

Electrical outlets & Wi-Fi access
Action Required:

 Booth Design Submission: Please provide booth designs ASAP.
**2. Digital Roll-Ups (10+ Screens in High-Traffic Areas)**
Your branding will appear across a minimum of **10 digital screens**, strategically placed throughout the venue, with a **30 second looping slot**.
[@Talha](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/team/U07C30N5623) [@Olaitan Akintunde](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/team/U07LLFZ0094) do we have any videos or animations on the API? If not, let’s use the images [@Agustín Gamoneda](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/team/U08ELTDV8CA) made.
**Action Required:**
 Submit digital roll-up assets (9:16 format - portrait, 1080p resolution minimum).
Content can be video, animation, or static images—please confirm your preferred format.

**3. Print & Digital Visibility**
Your brand logo will be featured across:

 **ETH Bucharest Website**

 **Official Social Media Channels**

 **Event Print Materials**

 **Hackathon Room**
**Action Required:**

 **Provide your official brand guidelines, logo files, and any key messaging/taglines** to be used for marketing and promotional purposes.
[@Agustín Gamoneda](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/team/U08ELTDV8CA) please share the final version of this.
**Final Deliverables & Deadlines**
Please share the **required materials** (logos, designs, digital roll-ups, and swag confirmation) by **18th of March 2025** to ensure seamless execution.

data.description:
Goal: Create teaser and pre-launch graphics for SMM, BLOG and Emails. We'll also need post launch posts for SMM and email

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Create Promotional Graphics for Token Metrics AI API Launch

**Description:** Design teaser and pre-launch graphics for social media marketing (SMM), blog posts, and email campaigns to generate excitement for the Token Metrics AI API. Additionally, create post-launch graphics to sustain engagement through SMM and email channels.

**Business Rationale:** High-quality visual content is crucial for effectively promoting the Token Metrics AI API, increasing brand visibility, and driving user engagement across multiple marketing platforms.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Produce teaser graphics for SMM, blog, and email campaigns.
2. Develop pre-launch graphics aligned with the marketing schedule.
3. Create post-launch graphics for ongoing SMM and email promotions.
4. Ensure all graphics adhere to Token Metrics branding guidelines.
5. Obtain approval from the marketing team for all final graphics.

data.title: Indices launch video
data.description:
Blocker: We need full details on the features from the Product team

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Develop Indices Launch Video

**Description:** Create a concise launch video that highlights the functionalities and benefits of the new Indices feature to drive user engagement and adoption.

**Business Rationale:** A professional launch video will effectively communicate the value of the Indices feature, facilitating its successful rollout and enhancing user understanding.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Receive comprehensive feature details from the Product team
* Script and storyboard approved by stakeholders
* Professionally produced video between 2-3 minutes
* Clear demonstration of key features and benefits
* Final review and approval by all relevant parties
* Video published on designated platforms

**Blocker:** Awaiting full feature details from the Product team.

**Assignee:** Olaitan Akintunde

comments.body: @faith  @ayo

1. Maybe animations with numbers going up? Like showing how you can scale your portfolio
2. Show files for rebalancing
3. add more slides on different indices

its not syncing well.. may we show more indices .. 

@olaitan "lets show different indices, treemap, one-click buy, data, AI signals, etc" before we connect the wallet to trade.. so the voice over syncs well

The VO is saying the core utilities of our Indices, as captured in our previous messaging.

Do you want us to mention "Login and generate your Ethereum wallet," as that is what is showing from 0:30 to 0:44

I think we should be showing the different indices, treemap, one-click buy, data, AI signals, etc 

@talha
@caleb can we enhance this voice over script so it syncs more with the video?

@talha @caleb 

[Indices Launch_1.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/32b14995-0a9a-46c4-890a-5ebda6cb4051/902e334b-b239-435b-962b-ff823ba7824f)

@olaitan show clearly how we can use the tool We can merge the previous video you made with and we can have single launch video.. but the images in this are like slide shows whereas it should actually show how indices work!

Solid stuff, bro 👏🏽

A few notes here

1. 0:16 frame was quite long (6 seconds). The countdown can start a second earlier and the visuals can cut to the interior to avoid a static shot of that length
2. After the explosion, can the first on-screen text be a bold, animated "TOKEN METRICS AI INDICES is LIVE"
3. Why did we not use the narration for the demo? That'd give more users the chance to know what the product is since they've not heard of it before. It is better to engage both eyes and ears for memory.

Overall, it's good stuff!

[Indices Launch.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/db0dbf94-4e5a-4e51-96c3-c4b7a32c476b/2471a8fd-83aa-4c15-9375-2c19e5af10ed)

@roshan1 @talha @caleb  @agustin

**Description:** Create and publish engaging YouTube Shorts every Tuesday featuring Olaitan Akintunde. These short-form videos should align with our content strategy to attract and retain viewers.

2. Each Short features Olaitan Akintunde and adheres to the approved content themes.
3. Videos comply with YouTube Shorts specifications (vertical format, under 60 seconds).

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Promote Token Metrics AI API by Creating AI Clips for Pre-Launch and Launch Videos

**Description:** Develop AI-generated clips to be integrated into both pre-launch and launch promotional videos for the Token Metrics AI API. These clips should effectively highlight the features and benefits of the API, enhancing overall video engagement and appeal.

**Business Rationale:** Utilizing AI-generated clips will streamline the video production process, ensure high-quality and consistent content, and effectively showcase the capabilities of the Token Metrics AI API. This promotion aims to increase awareness, attract potential users, and drive adoption during critical launch phases.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Two sets of AI-generated clips created—one for the pre-launch video and one for the launch video.
2. Clips effectively highlight key features and benefits of the Token Metrics AI API.
3. All clips meet the established quality and branding guidelines.
4. Final clips are reviewed and approved by stakeholders.
5. Integrated clips enhance the overall engagement and clarity of the promotional videos.

data.title: Main Homepage Slider – Finalizing Copy & Visuals
data.description:
Define and finalize the four key insights for the main slider on the Token Metrics homepage.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Main Homepage Slider – Finalizing Copy & Visuals

**Description:**  
Define and finalize the four key insights for the main slider on the Token Metrics homepage, ensuring that both the copy and visuals effectively communicate our value propositions and engage visitors.

**Business Rationale:**  
A well-crafted homepage slider is essential for capturing user attention, conveying critical messages succinctly, and driving user engagement. Finalizing the copy and visuals will enhance the overall user experience, reinforce our brand identity, and support business objectives such as increasing conversions and user retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Key Insights Defined:** Four key insights are clearly identified and approved by relevant stakeholders.
2. **Copy Completion:** Engaging and concise copy for each of the four slides is written, reviewed, and finalized.
3. **Visual Assets:** High-quality visuals corresponding to each key insight are designed, reviewed, and approved.
4. **Integration:** Finalized copy and visuals are successfully integrated into the homepage slider without technical issues.
5. **Validation:** The updated slider is tested for responsiveness and functionality across all major browsers and devices.
6. **Stakeholder Approval:** Final implementation receives sign-off from the project lead and marketing team.

The Trader Grade for this section should be next to the tokens. So the viewer can see we grade tokens.

[https://www.figma.com/proto/zxr2UjSXkUc9zyhyxHkL1V/Landing-Page-Token-Metrics?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=194-358&viewport=-724%2C233%2C0.25&t=aDOAU3IzH03ba96Q-1&scaling=min-zoom&content-scaling=fixed](https://www.figma.com/proto/zxr2UjSXkUc9zyhyxHkL1V/Landing-Page-Token-Metrics?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=194-358&viewport=-724%2C233%2C0.25&t=aDOAU3IzH03ba96Q-1&scaling=min-zoom&content-scaling=fixed)

Title: Main Homepage Slider – Finalizing Copy & Visuals

Description:
Define and finalize the four key insights for the main slider on the Token Metrics homepage.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Main Homepage Slider – Finalizing Copy & Visuals

**Description:**  
Define and finalize the four key insights for the main slider on the Token Metrics homepage, ensuring that both the copy and visuals effectively communicate our value propositions and engage visitors.

**Business Rationale:**  
A well-crafted homepage slider is essential for capturing user attention, conveying critical messages succinctly, and driving user engagement. Finalizing the copy and visuals will enhance the overall user experience, reinforce our brand identity, and support business objectives such as increasing conversions and user retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Key Insights Defined:** Four key insights are clearly identified and approved by relevant stakeholders.
2. **Copy Completion:** Engaging and concise copy for each of the four slides is written, reviewed, and finalized.
3. **Visual Assets:** High-quality visuals corresponding to each key insight are designed, reviewed, and approved.
4. **Integration:** Finalized copy and visuals are successfully integrated into the homepage slider without technical issues.
5. **Validation:** The updated slider is tested for responsiveness and functionality across all major browsers and devices.
6. **Stakeholder Approval:** Final implementation receives sign-off from the project lead and marketing team.

data.title: Support Team <> Israr Ulhaq <> Difficulty staking
data.description:
In the recent Technical Support Meeting between Token Metrics and Israr Ulhaq, the key discussion centered around Israr's inability to stake TMI tokens due to an error message stating 'TMI not approved', which occurred across both Metamask and Phantom wallets. Williams guided Israr through a debugging process, examining console errors and the Metamask setup, prompting Israr to provide screenshots of the issues encountered. Despite attempts to resolve the problem by changing RPC URLs and reconfiguring the Metamask extension, the error persisted, leading Bartosz to suggest creating a new Metamask wallet in a different browser. Israr agreed to this resolution and is expected to test the new wallet setup and provide feedback to the team, with action items assigned for follow-up.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/7aeb79f3-dee8-4fc8-8167-cc7a7c573e1e/7bcf1fb3-4b44-4faf-9044-5288f63667df)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/56a1b59a-cfdc-4222-abc0-cd3d627e0662/2e246a8f-6792-4ec2-997d-f763c728f40e)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/ce16aad3-593b-466b-9e31-f3fc8482fb9a/5453a8b9-0032-47af-a763-341e69c651d7)

data.title: Customer Interview-Active Users that signed up last 30 days
data.description:
The aim of this task is to organize and conduct interviews with active users who signed up within the last 30 days. The goal is to gather insights on their experience, pain points, and suggestions for improvement in our platform. These insights will help refine our product features and enhance user satisfaction. A segment of active users with more than 10 web sessions in the last 30 days should be targeted.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. A segment of active users who signed up in the last 30 days and have had more than 10 web sessions is created and verified.
2. Interview invitations are sent to the selected users via email, offering an incentive (e.g., a free month of Token Metrics).
3. At least 5 customer interviews are scheduled, conducted, and recorded.
4. Key insights from the interviews are documented and shared with the product team.
5. Follow-up actions or next steps are defined based on user feedback.

   1. [https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=9340-19961&p=f&t=fHH0BTD5pUl161gq-0](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=9340-19961&p=f&t=fHH0BTD5pUl161gq-0)

   1. [https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=12376-45206&p=f&t=fHH0BTD5pUl161gq-0](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=12376-45206&p=f&t=fHH0BTD5pUl161gq-0)

1. Portfolio 

* **Core Functions**
  * Add/remove assets, confirm calculations (holdings, gains/losses).
  * Ensure input fields and data updates work reliably.
* **User Interface**
  * Evaluate layout clarity (key data visibility, chart readability).
  * Check for consistent design, error messaging, and intuitiveness.
* **Performance**
  * Time the load and refresh speeds.
  * Test both stable data feeds and simulated outages.
* **Edge Cases**
  * Enter invalid or extreme values (e.g., very large asset holdings).
  * Verify graceful handling of missing or delayed data.
* **Team Feedback & Iterations**
  * Collect feedback in a shared doc (common pain points, usability issues).
  * Prioritize fixes and redeploy for retesting promptly.

2. Indices - 

**Description**
We’ve rolled out an updated design and functionality for our trading agents. We need a thorough review to confirm the experience is intuitive, reliable, and aligns with our product standards.

**Tasks**

1. **Assess Visual & UI Elements**
   * Check layout consistency, visual hierarchy, and branding alignment.
   * Ensure key data points (entry/exit signals, performance metrics) are clearly displayed.
2. **Validate Core User Flows**
   * Confirm setup steps (selecting strategies, configuring parameters) are intuitive.
   * Simulate end-to-end trades to verify accuracy and responsiveness of the agent.
3. **Stakeholder Feedback**
   * Gather input on any missing features or metrics.
   * Document any confusion or friction points in the flow.
4. **Recommended Improvements**
   * Consolidate feedback and identify top priority enhancements or bug fixes.
   * Propose next steps or iterations to refine the trading agent experience.

3. Trading Agents 
   1. **Description**
      We’ve rolled out an updated design and functionality for our trading agents. We need a thorough review to confirm the experience is intuitive, reliable, and aligns with our product standards.

      **Tasks**
      1. **Assess Visual & UI Elements**
         * Check layout consistency, visual hierarchy, and branding alignment.
         * Ensure key data points (entry/exit signals, performance metrics) are clearly displayed.
      2. **Validate Core User Flows**
         * Confirm setup steps (selecting strategies, configuring parameters) are intuitive.
         * Simulate end-to-end trades to verify accuracy and responsiveness of the agent.
      3. **Stakeholder Feedback**
         * Gather input on any missing features or metrics.
         * Document any confusion or friction points in the flow.
      4. **Recommended Improvements**
         * Consolidate feedback and identify top priority enhancements or bug fixes.
         * Propose next steps or iterations to refine the trading agent experience.

1. Portfolio 

* **Core Functions**
  * Add/remove assets, confirm calculations (holdings, gains/losses).
  * Ensure input fields and data updates work reliably.
* **User Interface**
  * Evaluate layout clarity (key data visibility, chart readability).
  * Check for consistent design, error messaging, and intuitiveness.
* **Performance**
  * Time the load and refresh speeds.
  * Test both stable data feeds and simulated outages.
* **Edge Cases**
  * Enter invalid or extreme values (e.g., very large asset holdings).
  * Verify graceful handling of missing or delayed data.
* **Team Feedback & Iterations**
  * Collect feedback in a shared doc (common pain points, usability issues).
  * Prioritize fixes and redeploy for retesting promptly.

2. Indices - 

**Description**
We’ve rolled out an updated design and functionality for our trading agents. We need a thorough review to confirm the experience is intuitive, reliable, and aligns with our product standards.

**Tasks**

1. **Assess Visual & UI Elements**
   * Check layout consistency, visual hierarchy, and branding alignment.
   * Ensure key data points (entry/exit signals, performance metrics) are clearly displayed.
2. **Validate Core User Flows**
   * Confirm setup steps (selecting strategies, configuring parameters) are intuitive.
   * Simulate end-to-end trades to verify accuracy and responsiveness of the agent.
3. **Stakeholder Feedback**
   * Gather input on any missing features or metrics.
   * Document any confusion or friction points in the flow.
4. **Recommended Improvements**
   * Consolidate feedback and identify top priority enhancements or bug fixes.
   * Propose next steps or iterations to refine the trading agent experience.

3. Trading Agents 
   1. **Description**
      We’ve rolled out an updated design and functionality for our trading agents. We need a thorough review to confirm the experience is intuitive, reliable, and aligns with our product standards.

      **Tasks**
      1. **Assess Visual & UI Elements**
         * Check layout consistency, visual hierarchy, and branding alignment.
         * Ensure key data points (entry/exit signals, performance metrics) are clearly displayed.
      2. **Validate Core User Flows**
         * Confirm setup steps (selecting strategies, configuring parameters) are intuitive.
         * Simulate end-to-end trades to verify accuracy and responsiveness of the agent.
      3. **Stakeholder Feedback**
         * Gather input on any missing features or metrics.
         * Document any confusion or friction points in the flow.
      4. **Recommended Improvements**
         * Consolidate feedback and identify top priority enhancements or bug fixes.
         * Propose next steps or iterations to refine the trading agent experience.

data.title: Establishing a Baseline for Community Engagement Metrics - Telegram
data.description:
#### **Objective:**

Create a **comprehensive snapshot** of current engagement metrics across all community channels. This will serve as a **benchmark** for measuring the impact of future engagement strategies.

---

### **Steps to Complete This Task:**

#### **1. Identify Community Channels to Track**

List all the community platforms where engagement occurs, such as:

* Discord
* Telegram

#### **2. Define Key Engagement Metrics**

For each channel, document **quantitative and qualitative** engagement metrics, such as:

* **General Community Stats:**
  * Total number of members/followers/subscribers
  * Growth rate over the past month/quarter
* **Activity & Interaction Metrics:**
  * Number of daily/weekly active users
  * Post frequency (how often we post)
  * Average likes, shares, retweets, or comments per post
  * Poll participation rates
  * Number of direct messages or support queries received
* **User-Generated Content & Engagement:**
  * Number of user-initiated posts or discussions
  * Mentions of our brand or products
  * Most common discussion topics
* **Sentiment Analysis:**
  * General sentiment from comments/discussions (positive, neutral, negative)
  * Frequently asked questions or recurring complaints

#### **3. Gather Data & Organize Findings**

* Use **platform analytics tools** to extract relevant data (e.g., Discord Insights, Telegram Metrics, etc.).
* If necessary, manually track engagement trends where platform analytics aren’t available.
* Compile the data in a structured format (spreadsheet).

#### **4. Create a Visual Report**

* Present findings in a **Google Sheet** and Google Doc with:
  * Key engagement metrics per platform
  * Graphs or tables for easy comparison
  * Screenshots of relevant analytics dashboards

#### **5. Share for Review & Discussion**

* Submit the document for review.
* Use this as the **baseline for tracking improvements** as we roll out new engagement strategies.

---

### **Expected Deliverables:**

✔ A **detailed snapshot** of current engagement metrics across all community channels.
✔ A **spreadsheet or dashboard** compiling key metrics.
✔ A **document or slide deck** summarizing insights with visuals.

data.title: Research & Ideate Ways to Improve Customer Engagement on Community Channels (Drich)
data.description:
#### **Objective:**

Analyze provided materials (audio, text, and video) to gain insights and generate actionable ideas to enhance engagement in our community channels.

* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SJi469BuU6g](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SJi469BuU6g)
* [https://kk.org/thetechnium/1000-true-fans/](https://kk.org/thetechnium/1000-true-fans/)
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IV5aSAM7G2E](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IV5aSAM7G2E)
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ZVpufakwfk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ZVpufakwfk)
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8MWh4LJDIM0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8MWh4LJDIM0)

---

---

### **Steps to Complete This Task:**

#### **1. Consume Provided Materials**

* **Listen** – If there are podcasts, recorded meetings, or voice notes, take notes on key themes and engagement strategies.
* **Read** – Go through any articles, reports, or customer feedback provided, identifying trends, pain points, and best practices.
* **Watch** – Analyze any videos (webinars, YouTube, or tutorials) to extract insights on engagement tactics used successfully.

#### **2. Identify Key Engagement Strategies**

* Note **patterns and successful engagement tactics** used in the materials.
* Highlight **recurring challenges** and gaps in our current community interactions.
* Document any **case studies or examples** of brands successfully engaging their communities.

#### **3. Brainstorm & List Implementation Ideas**

* Based on insights gathered, compile a **list of actionable engagement ideas** tailored to our community channels.
* Ensure each idea is:
  * **Relevant** – Addresses the needs and behaviors of our community.
  * **Practical** – Feasible to implement with available resources.
  * **Impactful** – Likely to drive higher interaction and retention.

Examples of engagement ideas could include:

* **Interactive Polls & Challenges** – Encourage participation through community-driven content.
* **AMA (Ask Me Anything) Sessions** – Host live Q&A sessions with team members or industry experts.
* **Exclusive Content Drops** – Reward engaged members with early access to insights or product updates.
* **Gamification** – Introduce leaderboards, badges, or rewards for participation.
* **Themed Weekly Discussions** – Create recurring events like ‘Tech Tuesdays’ or ‘Feature Feedback Fridays.’
* **User-Generated Content Initiatives** – Encourage members to share their own experiences, ideas, or success stories.

#### **4. Organize Findings in a Document**

* Structure the document with:
  * **Summary of key insights** from the materials.
  * **List of engagement ideas**, each with a brief explanation of how it works.
  * **Potential impact assessment** (e.g., quick win vs. long-term strategy).

#### **5. Share for Review**

* Ensure all ideas are **clearly written, categorized, and visually easy to digest**.
* Share the document with me for feedback and refinement.

---

### **Expected Deliverables:**

✔ **Summary of key takeaways** from the provided materials.
✔ **A list of 5-10 engagement ideas** with explanations.
✔ **A well-structured document** for review.

data.description:
1. [https://linear.app/token-metrics/view/all-projects-0f8aaee0e48f](https://linear.app/token-metrics/view/all-projects-0f8aaee0e48f)
2. [All projects](https://linear.app/token-metrics/view/all-projects-0f8aaee0e48f) 
3. [Ditto/TM Connect and PR work](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ij4jPyGGLrjfFS0yN9qR2YFmNHo8tvonhOSBiBhE17g/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.awnrb2idh0lt)
4. Email Series
   1. [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uJadVXLuVZjE_Lfodk5mtIl8kAKkprOn0ZlxlxMmf04/edit?tab=t.0](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uJadVXLuVZjE_Lfodk5mtIl8kAKkprOn0ZlxlxMmf04/edit?tab=t.0)
   2. [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OMt9fQqjufFIiiYeYTz5j09cgsZJ1Eq-GOvfJ0wCCbk/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.prnc1vipvq4i](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OMt9fQqjufFIiiYeYTz5j09cgsZJ1Eq-GOvfJ0wCCbk/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.prnc1vipvq4i)
5. [https://feedback.tokenmetrics.com/?b=665ee85058d05497f54f6880&s=665ee85058d05497f54f6885](https://feedback.tokenmetrics.com/?b=665ee85058d05497f54f6880&s=665ee85058d05497f54f6885) 

**Description:**
We need to update our product roadmap across Featurebase and Linear, revise key dates, and communicate these changes to our user base via an email blast.

**Tasks:**

1. **Featurebase Update:**
   * Archive completed items.
   * Adjust statuses for ongoing tasks.
   * Add or revise timelines for new/revised features.
2. **Linear Update:**
   * Sync updated statuses, timelines, and priorities with Linear.
   * Ensure all team members have visibility into revised milestones.
3. **Email Communication:**
   * Draft and send an email to users with the updated roadmap link.
   * Include instructions on how to upvote or suggest new features.
   * Coordinate with marketing if needed for design or branding.
4. **Confirmation & Follow-Up:**
   * Confirm updates are live on both Featurebase and Linear.
   * Track user feedback and communicate any major input to the product team.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Featurebase reflects current roadmap items with accurate statuses and timelines.
* Linear tasks match Featurebase updates for transparency.
* Users receive an email outlining updated roadmap details and how to engage.
* Clear record of user feedback for subsequent roadmap adjustments.

**Description:**
We need to update our product roadmap across Featurebase and Linear, revise key dates, and communicate these changes to our user base via an email blast.

**Tasks:**

1. **Featurebase Update:**
   * Archive completed items.
   * Adjust statuses for ongoing tasks.
   * Add or revise timelines for new/revised features.
2. **Linear Update:**
   * Sync updated statuses, timelines, and priorities with Linear.
   * Ensure all team members have visibility into revised milestones.
3. **Email Communication:**
   * Draft and send an email to users with the updated roadmap link.
   * Include instructions on how to upvote or suggest new features.
   * Coordinate with marketing if needed for design or branding.
4. **Confirmation & Follow-Up:**
   * Confirm updates are live on both Featurebase and Linear.
   * Track user feedback and communicate any major input to the product team.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Featurebase reflects current roadmap items with accurate statuses and timelines.
* Linear tasks match Featurebase updates for transparency.
* Users receive an email outlining updated roadmap details and how to engage.
* Clear record of user feedback for subsequent roadmap adjustments.

data.title: Give Feedback for TMAI Agent (Val)
data.description:
We need to annotate (give feedback) our Token Metrics AI chatbot answers across both Twitter and our production/development environments. This will help us improve the chatbot's performance and gather valuable insights. The CS team should use the provided video tutorial to guide them through the annotation process.

## Objectives

1. Annotate AI chatbot responses on Twitter
2. Annotate AI chatbot responses on the production environment
3. Annotate AI chatbot responses on the development environment

## Steps

1. Review the attached video tutorial on LangSmith annotation

   [Jam | Console logs, network requests, and more](https://jam.dev/c/30d4cd6d-aa1c-4499-be2f-a166294f0f8e)
2. Access the LangSmith dashboard for Token Metrics using your TM email.
3. Identify and categorize chatbot interactions for annotation
4. Provide feedback and annotations for each interaction
5. Use LangSmith's built-in tools to rate response quality, accuracy, and relevance
6. Document any patterns or issues discovered during the annotation process

## Additional Notes

* Ensure consistency in annotation across all team members
* Focus on both positive and negative examples to provide a balanced dataset
* Pay special attention to edge cases and unique user queries
* Regularly discuss findings with the AI development team to inform improvements

## Success Criteria

* Complete annotation of at least 100 interactions each for Twitter, production, and development environments
* Identify at least 5 areas for improvement in chatbot responses
* Provide a summary report of annotation insights and recommendations

## Resources

* Video tutorial: [https://jam.dev/c/30d4cd6d-aa1c-4499-be2f-a166294f0f8e](https://jam.dev/c/30d4cd6d-aa1c-4499-be2f-a166294f0f8e)
* Access credentials for LangSmith dashboard: Use your TM email

Please update this issue with progress and any questions that arise during the annotation process.

data.title: Discord/Intercom Support Tickets
data.description:
### Description:

This ticket focuses on creating a structured process for responding to support tickets from Discord and Intercom. The goal is to enhance response efficiency and consistency, ensuring users receive timely and accurate assistance.

### Acceptance Criteria:

1. Establish a set of standardized responses for common queries to facilitate quicker replies.
2. Monitoring the status of the tickets. 
3. Train the support team on the new processes and ensure access to resources for effective ticket management.

### Additional Details:

* Collect user feedback post-interaction to assess satisfaction and identify areas for improvement.
* Document the workflow and best practices for future reference and onboarding of new team members.

data.title: Customer Interview-Active Users that signed up last 30 days
data.description:
The aim of this task is to organize and conduct interviews with active users who signed up within the last 30 days. The goal is to gather insights on their experience, pain points, and suggestions for improvement in our platform. These insights will help refine our product features and enhance user satisfaction. A segment of active users with more than 10 web sessions in the last 30 days should be targeted.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. A segment of active users who signed up in the last 30 days and have had more than 10 web sessions is created and verified.
2. Interview invitations are sent to the selected users via email, offering an incentive (e.g., a free month of Token Metrics).
3. At least 5 customer interviews are scheduled, conducted, and recorded.
4. Key insights from the interviews are documented and shared with the product team.
5. Follow-up actions or next steps are defined based on user feedback.

data.title: Monitor and Counter Dispute on Stripe
data.description:
Regularly monitor disputes raised on Stripe and develop a process to counter disputes effectively. This involves investigating each case, gathering the necessary evidence, and submitting timely responses to resolve disputes in favor of the company. The goal is to reduce the number of chargebacks and ensure compliance with Stripe’s dispute resolution process.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Regular monitoring of disputes on Stripe
* Investigation of each dispute, including gathering relevant evidence
* Timely submission of responses to counter disputes
* At least 80% of disputes successfully resolved in the company’s favor
* Report created monthly summarizing dispute outcomes and lessons learned
* Process improvements proposed to reduce future disputes
  Link - [https://dashboard.stripe.com/disputes?statuses\[0\]=needs_response&statuses\[1\]=warning_needs_response&evidence_due_by\[gt\]=1727046000&sort=evidence_due_by&order=asc](https://dashboard.stripe.com/disputes?statuses\[0\]=needs_response&statuses\[1\]=warning_needs_response&evidence_due_by\[gt\]=1727046000&sort=evidence_due_by&order=asc)

data.title: Track and Remove Duplicates of Free Trials on Stripe
data.description:
Investigate and identify duplicate free trial subscriptions on Stripe. Ensure all duplicate entries are removed and implement a process to prevent future occurrences. The issue arises when users sign up for multiple free trials, causing confusion and unnecessary duplicates in the system.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Identify all current duplicates of free trials on Stripe
* Remove all duplicate free trial entries
* Implement a process to prevent future duplicates from occurring
* Verify that no duplicate free trials exist after cleanup
* Report findings and resolution to the team

data.title: Collect Testimonials from Previous Customers for Marketing
data.description:
Gather authentic, high-quality video testimonials from previous customers to enhance the marketing efforts for Token Metrics. These testimonials will be used to showcase the positive impact of our services on users and help attract new customers.

---

### **Steps:**

1. **Identify Potential Customers for Testimonials**
   * Review customer history to select previous customers who have had positive experiences with Token Metrics.
   * Focus on customers who have used our services long-term or experienced tangible benefits.
2. **Outreach to Customers**
   * Draft a personalized email or message to each identified customer, explaining the purpose of the testimonial request and how their feedback can help others.
   * Offer an incentive (e.g., a discount on their next subscription, a free month of service, or a small token of appreciation).
   * Example message:
     "Hi \[Customer's Name\],
     We’d love to hear about your experience with Token Metrics. Would you be willing to share your thoughts in a short video? Your feedback helps others make informed decisions, and we’d be honored to feature your testimonial. As a thank you, we’d like to offer you \[incentive\].
     Looking forward to hearing from you!"
3. **Create a Simple Guide for Recording Testimonials**
   * Provide instructions for recording clear, engaging video testimonials.
     **Tips to include:**
     * Ensure good lighting and a quiet environment.
     * Keep the video around 1-2 minutes in length.
     * Talk about how Token Metrics has helped you, any specific features you love, and the results you’ve seen.
     * Avoid complex jargon, keep it natural and conversational.
4. **Provide a Testimonial Submission Platform**
   * Offer an easy way for customers to upload or send their videos (e.g., via a Google Drive link, Dropbox, or any other file-sharing platform).
   * Ensure clear instructions on how to submit the video.
5. **Follow-Up and Encourage Participation**
   * Send a polite reminder if customers have not submitted their videos after a week.
   * Thank customers who participate, regardless of whether their video is used. Acknowledge their contribution.
6. **Review and Select Testimonials**
   * Collect all submitted video testimonials and review them for quality and relevance.
   * Select the best testimonials that reflect the core values and benefits of Token Metrics.
7. **Edit and Optimize Videos**
   * Edit the selected testimonials for brevity, clarity, and visual appeal (e.g., trimming unnecessary parts, adding captions if necessary).
   * Ensure the videos are optimized for use across different platforms (website, social media, YouTube, etc.).
8. **Obtain Customer Approval**
   * Share the edited video with the customer for final approval.
   * Confirm that they are comfortable with the testimonial being used in marketing materials.
9. **Integrate into Marketing Strategy**
   * Share the approved video testimonials across marketing channels, including the website, email campaigns, social media, and any other marketing materials.
   * Consider creating a dedicated testimonial page or section on the website.

comments.body:
Still adding more feedback - [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MmVS6HDTb87EZ_W-pkpffB24-eRvjd0TflAWLo8-bRM/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MmVS6HDTb87EZ_W-pkpffB24-eRvjd0TflAWLo8-bRM/edit?usp=sharing)

Also, mentioning to customers to leave us a review on Trust Pilot.

data.title: Streamlined Moderation on Discord/Telegram: Minimizing Spam and Scams
data.description:
To ensure a safe and engaging environment in our Discord /Telegram community, we aim to focus on enhancing moderation efforts by reducing spam, banning scammers, and improving overall content quality. This will involve monitoring and identifying disruptive behavior, implementing stricter moderation practices, and setting up automated filters to reduce spam content. The end goal is a cleaner, safer, and more engaging community experience.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Current spam and scam occurrences in Discord are recorded and analyzed.
* A moderation strategy is created, focusing on spam control, scam prevention, and overall quality improvements.
* Initiatives to improve moderation are implemented, including stricter ban and warning protocols, automated spam filters, and clearer community guidelines.

data.title: Ad Hoc
data.description:
1. Create sprint plan for Cycle 40 
 2. Showcase sprint demo for Cycle 39
 3. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=\_6pl5GG8RQ4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=\_6pl5GG8RQ4) (Watch this video and come up with thoughts)
    1. Product Market Fit
       1. We need to find what customers want today by talking to many customers and really understanding their needs. While talking to customers we need to figure out what they really want/need.
       2. Having some sort of platform that other companies are building on is key (Salesforce/Amazon). This is why the Token Metrics API is so important as other companies can build on top of our grades/analytics/indicators.
       3. They created a landing page [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=\_6pl5GG8RQ4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=\_6pl5GG8RQ4) (26 min) put on hackernews pitch the product and see how many people upvote it. Huge win everyone really wanted it. (We could take some ideas here to figure out what is the essential feature that will get us to PMF) What we can see is our customers asking for the Trading Agent in Monteray as one of the most talked about things.
       4. Killing the bad ideas fast enough is what he said is key to finding PMF. We can definately do a better job with this.
 4. Watching the crypto native cool ideas videos. Come up with ideas and make Linear issues to implement.
 5. Watching marketing cool ideas videos from Ian.  Come up with ideas and make Linear issues to implement.
 6. Create a document to respond to Ians feedback. Share with him and come up with action plan. 
 7. Slack channel for async updates. 
 8. Idea Generation for Token Metrics Products
    1. [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ROTrc1r7fVw3RDdW_O--EggplHjFX6Ws6BjkQ67c7kQ/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.8fnygc5a47iz](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ROTrc1r7fVw3RDdW_O--EggplHjFX6Ws6BjkQ67c7kQ/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.8fnygc5a47iz)
 9. Extra time thinking through the refund policy document
10. Document to share updates from CPO 
11. Extra time on call with Ian
12. Other 
    1. Why pace is important

data.title: Users Frustrated by Lengthy Password Requirements
data.description:
**Description:** Our current password policy mandates extensive requirements, including a minimum length and the inclusion of various character types. While these measures aim to enhance security, they have led to user frustration, increased password reset requests, and the adoption of insecure practices such as writing down passwords.

[https://us.posthog.com/project/90552/replay/0195982e-6871-7744-991a-5d0203cc1894?t=126](https://us.posthog.com/project/90552/replay/0195982e-6871-7744-991a-5d0203cc1894?t=126)

data.title: Product Posthog Metrics
data.description:
## 1\. Page Comparison

* **Most Visited Pages**
  * Top pages by sessions this week
  * Changes week-over-week (notable increases/decreases)
* **Key Observations**
  * Possible reasons for changes
  * Action items or follow-ups

## 2\. Daily Active Users (DAU)

* **Metrics Overview**
  * Trend over the last week
  * Spike or drop explanations
* **Insights & Actions**
  * Potential optimizations or product decisions

## 3\. Retention Analysis

* **Retention Rate**
  * Breakdown by user segments (free vs. paid, new vs. returning)
  * Patterns or anomalies
* **Recommendations**
  * Focus areas to improve retention

## 4\. Feature Usage

* **Time Spent on Features**
  * Which features are most popular?
  * Any new or underused features?
* **User Feedback**
  * Qualitative insights (if available)
  * Next steps for enhancements

## 5\. Subscriptions

* **New vs. Renewed**
  * Number of new subscriptions
  * Renewal rates or churn
* **Conversion Insights**
  * Patterns in subscription upgrades/downgrades
  * Marketing or product implications

## 6\. User Time on Token Metrics

* **Average Session Duration**
  * Comparison to previous week
  * Possible reasons for increased or decreased session length
* **Opportunities**
  * Ways to keep users engaged longer

## 7\. Growth Accounting

* **Acquisition**
  * Where are new users coming from?
  * Overall growth rate
* **Activation & Retention**
  * Key bottlenecks
  * Next steps for improvement
* **Monetization**
  * Revenue analysis (tie back to subscriptions)
  * Forecast vs. actual

## 8\. Discussion & Next Steps

* **Summary of Key Takeaways**
* **Action Items & Owners**
* **Open Questions**

data.title: Marketing Posthog Metrics
data.description:
## **1. AARRR Funnel Overview**

### **A. Acquisition**

* **Traffic & Sources**
  * Unique visitors (weekly/monthly)
  * Entry paths (articles, YouTube, Twitter, etc.)
  * UTM tracking & referrals
* **Key Insights**
  * Organic vs. paid traffic
  * Top-performing channels

### **B. Activation**

* **Conversion from Free to Paid**
  * Sign-up metrics (free trials started)

### **C. Retention**

* **Retention Rates**
  * Week-on-week/month-on-month user return rate
  * Churn and user re-engagement strategies

### **D. Trial to Paid Conversion**

* **Trial Data**
  * Number of trials started vs. completed
  * Conversion rate trends
* **Action Items**
  * Tactics to boost trial completions

### **E. Paid Customers & Monthly Revenue**

* **Subscriber Analysis**
  * Total paid users
  * MRR (Monthly Recurring Revenue) or monthly revenue
* **Growth Opportunities**
  * Upsell/cross-sell strategies

---

## **2. Additional Web Analytics**

### **A. Traffic Analysis**

* **Unique Visitors**
  * Breakdown by time period (weekly/monthly)
  * Notable traffic spikes or dips
* **Entry Path Analysis**
  * How users find the platform (UTMs, organic search, referrals)
  * Engagement from each path

## **3. Discussion & Next Steps**

* **Summary of Key Takeaways**
* **Action Items & Owners**
  * (List who is responsible for specific tasks)
* **Open Questions**
  * (Any points needing clarification or further data)

Groomed Issue:

**Migrate Tables in** `TOKENMETRICS_PROD.GOVERNANCE` and `STAKING` as per William’s Request

**Description:**  
Execute the migration of all tables within the `TOKENMETRICS_PROD.GOVERNANCE` and `STAKING` databases according to the specifications provided by William. This includes transferring data, updating schemas, and ensuring compatibility with existing systems.

**Business Rationale:**  
Aligning the database structures with the latest governance and staking requirements will enhance data integrity, improve system performance, and support upcoming features. This migration is essential to maintain compliance, facilitate better data management, and provide a scalable foundation for future developments.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All tables in `TOKENMETRICS_PROD.GOVERNANCE` and `STAKING` are successfully migrated without data loss.
* Data integrity is verified post-migration through comprehensive testing.
* All dependent applications and services operate seamlessly with the migrated tables.
* Documentation of the migration process and any schema changes is completed.
* Relevant stakeholders, including William, have reviewed and approved the migration results.

data.title: Migration Blockers
data.description:
1. The `analytics.otp_logs` table in postgres doesn't have auto increment ID column.
2. in table `analytics.telegram_invite_links` we have `ID` column but it's not PK so prisma is not able to find any unique column.
3. Table `analytics.notification_watches` in postgres doesn't contain all the columns available in `ANALYTICS.NOTIFICATION_WATCHES` on snowflake. Please migrate all columns to postgres.

comments.body: There ate 6 fields added from last migration: SLACK, TECHNICAL_INDICATOR,  TM_INVESTOR_GRADE, TM_INVESTOR_GRADE_LAST_QUEUE_ID, TM_TRADER_GRADE, TM_TRADER_GRADE_LAST_QUEUE_ID of `NOTIFICATION_WATCHES`
ID was set as PK for this table `analytics.telegram_invite_links.`
The ID in table `analytics.otp_logs` has been set as auto incremental.

issues.full_context:
Title: Migration Blockers

Description:
1. The `analytics.otp_logs` table in postgres doesn't have auto increment ID column.
2. in table `analytics.telegram_invite_links` we have `ID` column but it's not PK so prisma is not able to find any unique column.
3. Table `analytics.notification_watches` in postgres doesn't contain all the columns available in `ANALYTICS.NOTIFICATION_WATCHES` on snowflake. Please migrate all columns to postgres.

data.title: Fetch balance of the web3 - contract.functions.balanceof
data.description:
[https://web3py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/web3.contract.html#properties](https://web3py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/web3.contract.html#properties)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Replace BitQuery with Web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py) for Balance Retrieval in V1 Trading AI Agents

**Description:**  
Update the V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways to fetch contract balances using `web3` and `solana.py` instead of the current BitQuery method. Utilize `contract.functions.balanceOf` from [Web3.py](http://Web3.py) to retrieve the necessary balance data.

**Business Rationale:**  
Transitioning to Web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py) provides a more direct and reliable approach to accessing blockchain data, reducing dependency on third-party services like BitQuery. This change aims to enhance data accuracy, improve system performance, and streamline the integration process for the trading AI agents.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Implement balance fetching using `contract.functions.balanceOf` via [Web3.py](http://Web3.py) and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py).
2. Ensure the retrieved balances match those previously obtained through BitQuery.
3. All existing tests pass with the new implementation, and new tests are added to cover the updated functionality.
4. Update relevant documentation to reflect the changes in the data retrieval method.
5. Deployment of the new balance fetching mechanism does not introduce any regressions or issues in the V1 Trading AI Agents system.

parent.title: Use the web3 and solona.py to fetch the data instead of the bitQuery

comments.body: Did the research on the web3 doc.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Chao - Solved the single view migration for TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.BOT_MINI_RETURNS_CHART_VIEW
data.description:
Database reference could be found here:

[AI-3971](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/AI-3971/issue-data-fetching)

**Task: Migration of TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.BOT_MINI_RETURNS_CHART_VIEW**

• **Objective:** Create a new view as part of the migration process.

• **Challenges Encountered:**

• The previous table relied on Snowflake-specific functions, which were unsupported after migration to Starrocks.

• Needed to rethink the query logic while maintaining data integrity.

• **Solution Implemented:**

• Instead of replicating the original structure exactly (which was not feasible), the view was split into three separate views.

• This restructuring ensures the required data is accessible efficiently over a six-month timeframe.

• Explained the new table structures and documented the changes for future reference.

---

**TODOs:**

1\. **Finalize Documentation**

• Ensure all documentation is clear and accessible for future maintenance.

2\. **Validate Data Accuracy**

• Run additional tests to confirm that the new views align with expected results.

3\. **Stakeholder Communication**

• Update relevant teams on the migration and its impact.

• Provide guidance on querying the new structure.

4\. **Monitor Performance**

• Track query performance in the new system and optimize if needed.

parent.title: Step 2.1 Migrated the current trading_Bot_DEX to the StarRocks

comments.body: [AI-4590](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/AI-4590/chao-solved-the-single-view-migration-for-trading-bot-dexappbot-mini) was assigned to the @jake. Create new one for myself work

See [doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PAlXbRxSgJcudUejIxLlN1eCQrr20r2ItIqGtUotxVM/edit?tab=t.0): 

Old: SELECT \* FROM TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.BOT_MINI_RETURNS_CHART_VIEW;

Reference [AI-3971](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/AI-3971/issue-data-fetching)

New:

Due to the different database structures (some functions can not be used in the star rock) I split the above table into three views:

TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP_BOT_MINI_RETURNS_CHART_6M_VIEW (save every week)

TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP_BOT_MINI_RETURNS_CHART_1M_VIEW (save every 6 hours)

TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP_BOT_MINI_RETURNS_CHART_OVERALL_VIEW (save every two weeks)

data.title: Validate Real Time Ingestion Services On DO K8s
data.description:
**Description:**   Ensure that all real-time ingestion services are properly deployed and functioning on the DigitalOcean Kubernetes platform. This includes verifying deployment configurations, network connectivity, service scalability, and performance under typical and peak load conditions.

**Business Rationale:**  
Reliable real-time ingestion is critical for maintaining the integrity and timeliness of our data processing pipeline. Validating these services on DO K8s guarantees that our infrastructure is scalable, resilient, and performs optimally, thereby supporting key business operations and enhancing overall system reliability.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Real-time ingestion services are successfully deployed on DO K8s without deployment errors.
2. Configuration settings align with predefined specifications and best practices.
3. Services demonstrate stable connectivity and operate seamlessly under both normal and peak load scenarios.
4. All relevant functionality tests pass, confirming service reliability and performance.
5. Deployment and validation documentation is updated and reviewed for accuracy.

data.title: Blockers for AI Indices migration
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Identify and Resolve Blockers for AI Indices Migration

**Description:**

**Description:**
Identify and address the current blockers preventing the migration of AI Indices Pages. This includes technical challenges, dependencies, and other obstacles that hinder the migration process.

**Business Rationale:**
Migrating AI Indices Pages will enhance system performance, reduce technical debt, and improve user experience. Addressing these blockers is critical to ensure a smooth transition and maintain the reliability of our AI services.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. All blockers for the AI Indices migration are documented.
2. Solutions for each identified blocker are implemented and verified.
3. Successful migration of AI Indices Pages is completed without disrupting existing functionalities.
4. Post-migration performance meets predefined benchmarks.

parent.title: AI Indices Pages

comments.body:
@andrew please check this 

```
SELECT 
    a."COIN", 
    a."TOKEN_NAME", 
    a."TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
    CAST(a."CG_ID" AS TEXT) AS "CG_ID", 
    CAST(a."MARKET_CAP" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "MARKET_CAP", 
    CAST(a."PRICE" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "PRICE", 
    CAST(a."CURRENT_ROI" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "CURRENT_ROI", 
    CAST(a."WEIGHT" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "WEIGHT", 
    a."ICON", 
    CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "TRADER_GRADE", 
    CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H", 
    CAST(b."TOTAL_ROWS" AS INTEGER) AS "TOTAL_COUNT" 
FROM INDICES_SECTORS.HOLDINGS_VIEW a 
CROSS JOIN (
    SELECT 
        CAST(COUNT(*) AS INTEGER) AS "TOTAL_ROWS" 
    FROM INDICES_SECTORS.HOLDINGS_VIEW 
    WHERE LOWER("SECTOR") = 'meme'
) b 
WHERE LOWER(a."SECTOR") = 'meme'
LIMIT 10
OFFSET 1;
```

data.title: Improved the API
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enhance API Error Handling for V1 Trading AI Agents

**Description:**
Improve the API's error handling mechanisms for V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy and Fiat gateways. This enhancement will ensure more robust and reliable operations by effectively managing and responding to potential errors during trading activities.

**Business Rationale:**
Robust error handling is essential to maintain the stability and reliability of trading operations. Enhancing the API's ability to handle errors will reduce downtime, increase user trust, and ensure seamless trading experiences, ultimately contributing to better business performance and customer satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Implement comprehensive error detection and logging for all API interactions related to trading agents.
2. Return clear and meaningful error messages to clients to facilitate easier debugging and resolution.
3. Establish retry mechanisms for transient errors to improve reliability.
4. Ensure error handling covers all critical API endpoints used by Privy and Fiat gateways.
5. Conduct thorough testing to validate that enhanced error handling functions correctly under various failure scenarios.

parent.title: [Data Team] Error Handling for Trading Agents

comments.body:
What did:

1. Adjusted the default fee to 0.0075
2. Dropped the weight of the rebalance
3. Solved the solana bugs by replacing the RPC and tested work.
Oh, just an example for that.
@chao any reason it's buying USDT or DAI? I thought the only stablecoins the indices could hold are USDC.

T1: 1000$ USDC on the base, use index_buy_portfolio to buy 20% ETH 80% DAI

T2: we hold 200$ ETH, 800$ DAI
T3: we need to rebalance, ETH , DAI -> UNI 30%, USDT 70%.

* sell 200 $ ETH to 200$ UNI
  Sell 100 $ DAI to 100 $ UNI
* sell 700 $ETH to 700$ USDT

T5: we hold AXBIT, ETH

* we want to check the current weight
* fetch the balance:
  * Fetch the real time holding weight:
    * AXBIT 400$, ETH WITH 400$:
      * 400/800 -> 50% OF THE AXBIT
      * 400/800 -> 50% OF THE ETH
  * Fetch the original weight (buying time point):
    * fetch the data from the database directly
    * Our website oportfolio is (AXBIT (40%), ETH(30%), SOL(30%) ❌ )
    * 40%/(70%) = 0.57%
    * 30%/(70%) = 0.42%

Tn: user wants to close the portfolio:

sold out everything they to USDC BASE

Sell 300 UNI to BASE USDC

Sell 700 USDT to BASE USDC.

now we hold 1000$ BASE USDC.
Change all the fee to 0.0075 where total will be 1%

Drop the weight of the old position (we sell defautly for all holding you had on that token)

Keep the weight of the new position (we need to decide the allocation over different assets.)
Get the rebalance quote

@ahmedhamdy Has this question
Check how soon data can be updated to the supabase

If possible, try to  save the data to the supabase directly.

**Title:** Enhance API Error Handling for V1 Trading AI Agents

**Description:**
Improve the API's error handling mechanisms for V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy and Fiat gateways. This enhancement will ensure more robust and reliable operations by effectively managing and responding to potential errors during trading activities.

**Business Rationale:**
Robust error handling is essential to maintain the stability and reliability of trading operations. Enhancing the API's ability to handle errors will reduce downtime, increase user trust, and ensure seamless trading experiences, ultimately contributing to better business performance and customer satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Implement comprehensive error detection and logging for all API interactions related to trading agents.
2. Return clear and meaningful error messages to clients to facilitate easier debugging and resolution.
3. Establish retry mechanisms for transient errors to improve reliability.
4. Ensure error handling covers all critical API endpoints used by Privy and Fiat gateways.
5. Conduct thorough testing to validate that enhanced error handling functions correctly under various failure scenarios.

data.title: Add Remaining Functionalities in the Controller
data.description:
* close bot
* swap

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Add Remaining Functionalities to Trading Agent Controller

**Description:**  
Implement the "close bot" and "swap" functionalities within the Trading Agent Controller to enhance its capabilities as an independent agent in the V1 0xTMAI Agents framework.

**Business Rationale:**  
Completing these functionalities will provide users with comprehensive control over their trading operations, allowing them to efficiently manage and adjust their automated trading strategies. This enhancement will improve user satisfaction and competitiveness of the Trading Agent Controller in the market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Close Bot Functionality:**
   * Users can successfully initiate a command to close the trading bot.
   * The system terminates all active trading operations and logs the closure event.
   * A confirmation message is displayed to the user upon successful closure.
2. **Swap Functionality:**
   * Users can execute a swap command to exchange specified assets.
   * The system accurately processes the swap and updates the user's portfolio accordingly.
   * Users receive a notification confirming the successful completion of the swap.
3. **General Requirements:**
   * Both functionalities are fully integrated and tested within the Trading Agent Controller.
   * No critical bugs are present, and all new features meet the specified requirements.
   * Documentation is updated to include instructions for the new functionalities.

parent.title: Trading Agent Controller as Independent Agent

2. Enhanced error handling correctly manages failed transaction confirmations.
3. Automated tests cover successful confirmations and various failure scenarios.
4. Monitoring dashboards reflect accurate transaction statuses post-fix.
5. No related functionalities are adversely impacted by the fix.

data.title: Enable Spill To Disk On StarRocks
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Enable Spill to Disk on StarRocks**

**Description:**  
Implement spill-to-disk functionality in StarRocks to allow the system to offload data from memory to disk during high-load operations, ensuring efficient memory management and preventing system crashes.

**Business Rationale:**  
Enabling spill-to-disk will enhance StarRocks' ability to handle large datasets and high concurrency without exhausting memory resources. This improvement will lead to increased system stability, better performance under heavy usage, and the capacity to support growing data processing demands, thereby boosting user satisfaction and scalability.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Spill-to-disk feature is successfully integrated into the StarRocks architecture.
2. The system automatically offloads excess data from memory to disk when predefined memory thresholds are exceeded.
3. Performance benchmarks confirm that spill operations do not cause significant latency or degradation in query response times.
4. The system remains stable and does not crash under high-load scenarios with spill-to-disk enabled.
5. Documentation is updated to include configuration settings and usage guidelines for the spill-to-disk feature.

data.title: Bug FIX in RSS Feed
data.description:
There was duplication in news items, as the Redis component wasn't working properly

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve RSS Feed Duplication Issue Caused by Redis Failure

**Description:**
The RSS feed is currently displaying duplicate news items because the Redis component is malfunctioning. This duplication undermines the user experience by presenting repetitive content and can erode trust in the platform’s reliability.

**Business Rationale:**
Maintaining a clean and accurate RSS feed is essential for user satisfaction and engagement. Eliminating duplicate news items ensures that users receive diverse and relevant content, thereby enhancing the overall credibility and attractiveness of the service.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* RSS feed no longer shows duplicate news items.
* Redis component is functioning correctly without errors.
* Comprehensive testing confirms the resolution across different scenarios.
* Monitoring is in place to detect any future Redis-related issues affecting the RSS feed.

**Prepare Tables and Views for Indices Feature in Supabase Production**

**Description:**
Configure and optimize all relevant tables and views in the Supabase production environment to support the new indices feature. This includes creating necessary indexes, ensuring efficient query performance, and maintaining data integrity.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing database indexing is crucial for improving application performance, reducing query latency, and ensuring a scalable infrastructure. Properly indexed tables and views will lead to a better user experience and support future growth.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All targeted tables and views have the appropriate indexes implemented in Supabase production.
* Query performance metrics show a measurable improvement compared to baseline.
* Data integrity is verified, ensuring no loss or corruption during the indexing process.
* Comprehensive documentation of the changes made to tables and views is completed.
* Successful deployment without any disruptions to existing functionalities.

data.title: Exploring Regressions to Implement Factor Model
data.description:
Returns = α + β₁(Market) + β₂(Momentum) + β₃(Size) + β₄(Liquidity) + β₅(ValuationGap) + β₆(Volatility) + ε

Use of regressions to build multi-factor-model in order to see if it works as expected.

All in all - we need to figure out two things:

1. How to hedge market risk without shorting
2. How to ensemble factors

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Multi-Factor Regression Model for Index Returns

**Description:**  
Develop and apply a multi-factor regression model to analyze index returns using the factors Market, Momentum, Size, Liquidity, Valuation Gap, and Volatility. The model will adhere to the equation:

\[ \\text{Returns} = \\alpha + \\beta_1(\\text{Market}) + \\beta_2(\\text{Momentum}) + \\beta_3(\\text{Size}) + \\beta_4(\\text{Liquidity}) + \\beta_5(\\text{ValuationGap}) + \\beta_6(\\text{Volatility}) + \\epsilon \]

**Business Rationale:**  
Implementing this factor model will enhance our ability to understand and predict index performance by quantifying the influence of key market factors. This insight supports more informed strategic decision-making and optimizes investment strategies, thereby driving better financial outcomes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Model Construction:** The regression model includes all specified factors: Market, Momentum, Size, Liquidity, Valuation Gap, and Volatility.
2. **Data Fit:** The model demonstrates a statistically significant fit to historical index return data.
3. **Validation:** The model is successfully validated with out-of-sample data, showing expected performance.
4. **Documentation:** Comprehensive documentation of the model methodology, assumptions, and results is completed and reviewed.
5. **Stakeholder Approval:** Key stakeholders approve the model based on its accuracy and usefulness in predicting index returns.

parent.title: Implement Factor Model for Indices

comments.body: This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
