data.title: Engagement Metrics Collection
data.description:
We need to implement a callback mechanism to collect engagement metrics for posts. This will allow us to track key metrics efficiently and use them for further analysis.

Groomed Issue:

**Engagement Metrics Collection**

**Description:**
Implement a callback mechanism to capture and collect engagement metrics (such as likes, shares, comments, and views) for each post. This system will integrate with the existing post infrastructure to ensure seamless data collection for ongoing and future analysis.

**Business Rationale:**
Tracking engagement metrics is crucial for understanding user interactions and the effectiveness of content. By efficiently collecting these metrics, we can make informed decisions to enhance content strategies, improve user engagement, and drive business growth through data-driven insights.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A callback mechanism is developed and integrated with the post system to collect engagement metrics.
* Metrics collected include, but are not limited to, likes, shares, comments, and views.
* Collected data is accurately stored in the engagement analysis pipeline for further processing.
* The implementation does not negatively impact system performance or user experience.
* Comprehensive documentation is provided, detailing the callback mechanism and data flow.
* Successful end-to-end testing verifies that metrics are correctly collected and stored.

parent.title: Engagement Analysis Pipeline for X Agent

comments.body: ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/f2352bc8-24d8-4953-870f-17e3f8d2cec0/90e8d30f-6bb9-48e2-861c-f5d1cc0820ed)
yes
Is this in StarRocks?

## UPDATE

I've a new table `post_engagement_metrics` with the following Schema & foreign key to the `twitter_posts` table that we already have for reserving what we post on X:

```sql
CREATE TABLE post_engagement_metrics (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    -- Reference to internal post ID
    internal_post_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    -- Actual X/Twitter post ID extracted from URL
    x_post_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    
    -- Core engagement metrics from X
    impression_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    like_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    retweet_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    reply_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    quote_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    bookmark_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- URL click metrics (if available via API)
    url_link_clicks INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    user_profile_clicks INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    
    -- Engagement rates (calculated fields)
    engagement_rate DECIMAL(7,4),  -- (likes+retweets+quotes+replies)/impressions
    click_through_rate DECIMAL(7,4), -- clicks/impressions
    
    -- Metadata
    collected_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    
    -- Constraints and foreign keys
    FOREIGN KEY(internal_post_id) REFERENCES twitter_posts(id)
);
```
Thanks @vasilis @grady, I will double check the PR and decide what need to be integrated

Certainly - I'd also suggest you guys sync in a 1-1 to discuss how to analyze these metrics and update the [parent ticket](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/AI-4476/engagement-analysis-pipeline-for-x-agent) accordingly

cc @ahmedhamdy

PR: [token-metrics/tm-ai-agent#92](https://linear.app/token-metrics/review/ai-4263-b467a901f453)

* utils/PromptRefiner.py --> get annotation runs from Langsmith and generate prompt improvement strategy


* utils/XAnalyzer.py --> get X engagement metrics and generate top 5 best post, top 5 worst-performing post, and generate insights

The files in the 'prompt_improvement_folder' is the result of running the above scripts. Can be omitted.

I think the most relevant file to this ticket is `utils/XAnalyzer.py` 
cc: @ahmedhamdy @vasilis
I have a working code already on how to retrieve the engagement metrics, but it hasn't been stored anywhere. Maybe @ahmedhamdy can use the code / script I've made and store it in database?

Is this similar to this ticket? 

[AI-4263](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/AI-4263/enhance-x-agent-to-self-improve-using-x-api-post-metrics-and-optimize)

cc @grady
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Develop Python Script to Migrate `coingeko_token_price_hourly` Table from Snowflake/StarRocks to Supabase
data.description:
### **Title:** Develop Python Script to Migrate coingeko_token_price_hourly Table from Snowflake/StarRocks to Supabase

### **Description:**

Create a standalone Python script to migrate the `coingeko_token_price_hourly` table from **Snowflake** or **StarRocks** to **Supabase**. The script should handle large datasets efficiently and ensure data integrity.

### **Scope & Requirements:**

✅ Extract data from **Snowflake** or **StarRocks** (source to be confirmed).
✅ Transform data if necessary (e.g., column renaming, type conversions).
✅ Load data into **Supabase** while maintaining integrity.
✅ Support incremental updates or full migrations (to be clarified).
✅ Optimize for large-scale data migration (batch processing, retries).
✅ Provide logging and error handling.

### **Tech Stack:**

* Python
* `snowflake-connector-python` (if pulling from Snowflake)
* `mysql-connector-python` or `starrocks-connector-python` (if pulling from StarRocks)
* `supabase-py` or direct PostgreSQL connection
* Pandas for transformation
* SQLAlchemy for database operations

comments.body:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a28526b4-8fc7-42f0-b4c9-1214c7086c84/28f0eae3-6548-40bb-8c0b-ff837b704fcd)

Successfully migrated 6months data to Supabase. 

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/3efde1fa-2bc3-442e-90ca-7f9fb47287b0/e3e19315-b1c3-4117-8ff6-8f25a956a166)

Trying new approach, load data as csv into gcs, then load those file to Supabase, the performance looks like better and more stable. 

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/89c4674e-0470-4c5e-a74d-3fa848281807/c0233a77-4afa-4bc7-ab13-3db590d9406d)

1M records in each 5 minutes.
The old strategy was too slow, it takes 3-5 minutes to pull data each day and totally 12 hours for just 6 months of this table.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/1f24d033-3a52-4031-8b89-f66f4e41fea6/7cbd0a6d-2eee-46b6-9b81-e597636a79cd)

The pipeline starting to slow ingestion,  finding a work around.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a58d2ed4-a8f1-4558-b515-9f44e3ebb6d1/6f30de5c-890c-4017-9030-417172e9f272)

Pipeline is running.

data.title: Create a new api for fetching the gas fee and slippage estimation
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title**: Develop API for Gas Fee and Slippage Estimation

**Description**: Implement a new API to fetch real-time gas fees and slippage estimates for trading transactions. This API will support the V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy/Fiat Gateways, enhancing transaction accuracy and efficiency.

**Business Rationale**: Providing accurate and timely gas fee and slippage information is essential for optimizing trading strategies and ensuring seamless transaction executions. This functionality will improve the reliability of our trading agents, enhance user experience, and reduce the risk of transaction failures.

**Acceptance Criteria**:

1. The API retrieves current gas fee data from relevant blockchain networks accurately.
2. Slippage estimates are calculated based on real-time market conditions.
3. Successful integration with V1 Trading AI Agents and Privy/Fiat Gateways without introducing errors.
4. Robust error handling is implemented to manage data retrieval and processing issues.
5. Comprehensive documentation is provided, including usage guidelines and integration instructions.
6. API performance meets predefined response time benchmarks under typical load conditions.

parent.title: [Data Team] Error Handling for Trading Agents

comments.body:
0.25% -> LIFI

2% -> I set

About how to use the api:

Now we have Four apis about the portfolio:

`/index_buy_portfolio`

* given the parameter and information, it will execute the trade directly.

`/index_buy_portfolio_get_quote`

* Same parameter input of the `/index_buy_portfolio`, However, it does not execute trade but return the transaction information, including the estimated fee and slippage, transaction path, possible transaction details.

`/index_buy_portfolio_execute_quote`

* the api is to execute the transaction request from response of `/index_buy_portfolio_get_quote`.
* Input will be:
  * res = `index_buy_portfolio_get_quote(....)`
  * `index_buy_portfolio_execute_quote(res['response']['data'])`
  * return will be the same to the `/index_buy_portfolio`

`index_rebalance_portfolio`

* the api will be used to calculate the path of the rebalance way and execute the trade automatically.

Today, significant progress was made in defining and planning the **Gas Fee & Slippage Estimation API**, a crucial enhancement to improve transaction efficiency for the **V1 Trading AI Agents**. The API will enable real-time fetching of gas fees and slippage, allowing for more accurate trade execution.

Additionally, work was scoped for the **Index Portfolio APIs**, which will streamline how users start and manage portfolios. By designing a **INDEX_BUY_PORTFOLIO_GET_QUOTE API** for transaction estimates and an **INDEX_BUY_PORTFOLIO_EXECUTE_QUOTE API** to allow direct transaction signing, we reduce redundant API calls and enhance execution speed.

[token-metrics/trading-bot#116](https://linear.app/token-metrics/review/quote-api-475983af3fc3)
[token-metrics/trading-bot#117](https://linear.app/token-metrics/review/added-the-api-of-the-quote-db5fd08fd96f)

Several performance enhancements were identified, focusing on optimizing transaction flow and refining existing APIs. These improvements aim to **reduce execution delays** and provide a more seamless experience for users.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Migrate COINGECKO_FUNDAMENTAL_TOKENS_VIEW to StarRocks
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title**: Migrate `COINGECKO_FUNDAMENTAL_TOKENS_VIEW` to StarRocks

**Description**: Transition the `COINGECKO_FUNDAMENTAL_TOKENS_VIEW` from its current database to StarRocks to leverage enhanced performance and scalability features.

**Business Rationale**: Migrating to StarRocks will improve query performance, handle larger datasets more efficiently, and provide better scalability. This ensures faster data retrieval and more reliable analytics for stakeholders relying on CoinGecko's fundamental token data.

**Acceptance Criteria**:

1. The `COINGECKO_FUNDAMENTAL_TOKENS_VIEW` is successfully recreated in the StarRocks environment.
2. All existing functionalities and queries using the view operate correctly without errors.
3. Performance metrics post-migration meet or exceed current benchmarks.
4. Comprehensive testing is completed, including validation of data integrity and query performance.
5. Documentation is updated to reflect the new StarRocks implementation.
6. Stakeholder approval is obtained following successful migration and testing.

parent.title: [Parent Ticket] Migrate All Remaining Views In CRYPTO_DB.COINGECKO To StarRocks.

comments.body:
```
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.COINGECKO_FUNDAMENTAL_TOKENS_VIEW AS
SELECT
    ID AS TOKEN_ID,
    NAME AS TOKEN_NAME,
    UPPER(SYMBOL) AS TOKEN_SYMBOL,
    T.CG_ID,
    IS_STABLECOIN,
    CASE
        WHEN WEBSITE = '' OR WEBSITE = 'null' OR (LOCATE('reddit', WEBSITE) > 0 AND LOCATE('reddit', LOWER(TOKEN_NAME)) = 0) THEN NULL
        ELSE WEBSITE
    END AS WEBSITE,
    CASE
        WHEN WHITEPAPER_URL = '' OR WHITEPAPER_URL = 'null' THEN NULL
        ELSE WHITEPAPER_URL
    END AS WHITEPAPER,
    CASE
        WHEN GITHUB_URL = '' OR GITHUB_URL = 'null' THEN NULL
        WHEN LOCATE('[', GITHUB_URL) = 0 THEN parse_json(CONCAT('["', GITHUB_URL, '"]'))
        ELSE parse_json(GITHUB_URL)
    END AS GITHUB,
    CASE
        WHEN TWITTER = '' OR TWITTER = 'null' THEN NULL
        ELSE TWITTER
    END AS TWITTER,
    CASE
        WHEN CG_SUBREDDIT_URL = '' OR CG_SUBREDDIT_URL = 'https://www.reddit.com' OR CG_SUBREDDIT_URL = 'null' THEN NULL
        ELSE CG_SUBREDDIT_URL
    END AS SUBREDDIT,
    CASE
        WHEN CG_TELEGRAM_CHANNEL = '' OR CG_TELEGRAM_CHANNEL = 'null' THEN NULL
        ELSE CG_TELEGRAM_CHANNEL
    END AS TELEGRAM,
    CASE
        WHEN DISCORD_GROUP_NAME = '' OR DISCORD_GROUP_NAME = 'null' THEN NULL
        ELSE DISCORD_GROUP_NAME
    END AS DISCORD,
    CASE
        WHEN RSS_URL = '' OR RSS_URL = 'null' THEN NULL
        ELSE RSS_URL
    END AS RSS_FEED,
    CASE
        WHEN PLATFORMS = parse_json('{ "": "" }') THEN parse_json('{}')
        WHEN PLATFORMS = parse_json('{ "": null }') THEN parse_json('{}')
        WHEN PLATFORMS IS NULL THEN parse_json('{}')
        ELSE PLATFORMS
    END AS PLATFORMS,
    UPDATED_AT
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_TOKENS T
INNER JOIN COINGECKO.DAILY_TRADING_VOLUME_MA_50K_VIEW V ON T.ID = V.TOKEN_ID
WHERE STATUS = 'ACTIVE'
    -- Removing wrapped tokens
    AND LOCATE('wrapped ', LOWER(TOKEN_NAME)) = 0
    -- Removing bridged tokens
    AND LOCATE('bridged ', LOWER(TOKEN_NAME)) = 0
    -- Removing wormhole tokens
    AND LOWER(TOKEN_NAME) NOT REGEXP '.*[[(]?wormhole[])]?.*'
    -- Removing old tokens
    AND LOWER(TOKEN_NAME) NOT REGEXP '.*[[(]?old[])]?.*'
    -- Removing orbit bridge tokens
    AND LOWER(TOKEN_NAME) NOT REGEXP '.*[[(]?orbit bridge[])]?.*'
    -- Removing plenty bridge tokens
    AND LOWER(TOKEN_NAME) NOT REGEXP '.*[[(]?plenty bridge[])]?.*'
    -- Removing index-based tokens
    AND LOWER(TOKEN_NAME) NOT REGEXP '.*[[(]?index[])]?.*'
    -- Removing leverage tokens
    AND LOWER(TOKEN_NAME) NOT REGEXP '.*[[(]?leveraged?[])]?.*'
    -- Removing stader protocol tokens
    AND LOCATE('stader ', LOWER(TOKEN_NAME)) = 0
    -- Removing liquid staked tokens
    AND LOCATE('staked ', LOWER(TOKEN_NAME)) = 0
    -- Removing dinari protocol tokens
    AND LOCATE('dinari ', LOWER(TOKEN_NAME)) = 0
    -- Removing all tokens with pattern xXXX (likely wrapped assets)
    AND TOKEN_NAME NOT REGEXP '.* [a-z]+[A-Z]{2,}.*';
```

COINGECKO_FUNDAMENTAL_TOKENS_VIEW Created.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/67d4d490-03cc-47f7-be97-a5fd656eb0bf/7266f68a-3a6e-40c7-9d4e-7d33be2a02ae)

```
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.DAILY_TRADING_VOLUME_MA_50K_VIEW AS
SELECT
    TOKEN_ID,
    CG_ID,
    TOKEN_NAME,
    TOKEN_SYMBOL,
    AVG(VOLUME) AS AVG_VOLUME
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_PRICE_DAILY_SUMMARY_VIEW_V2
WHERE DATE >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 10 DAY)
GROUP BY TOKEN_ID, CG_ID, TOKEN_NAME, TOKEN_SYMBOL
HAVING AVG_VOLUME > 50000
ORDER BY AVG_VOLUME DESC;
```

DAILY_TRADING_VOLUME_MA_50K_VIEW created.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/0ba387d4-89b1-4a5b-b132-1510f3c603d9/2fc5a59c-126c-4faf-b84c-ce8b2fa32452)

```
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.COINGECKO_PRICE_DAILY_SUMMARY_VIEW_V2 AS
SELECT
    TOKEN_ID,
    CG_ID,
    TOKEN_NAME,
    TOKEN_SYMBOL,
    DATE,
    CAST(OPEN AS DOUBLE) AS OPEN,
    CAST(HIGH AS DOUBLE) AS HIGH,
    CAST(LOW AS DOUBLE) AS LOW,
    CAST(CLOSE AS DOUBLE) AS CLOSE,
    CAST(VOLUME AS DOUBLE) AS VOLUME
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_PRICE_DAILY_SUMMARY;
```

COINGECKO_PRICE_DAILY_SUMMARY_VIEW_V2 created.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/3bc31fac-87ca-42c1-b3b0-d80041ecfcf2/4de213bd-0cb2-4da0-a050-4c1040007f06)
This view has dependency on view DAILY_TRADING_VOLUME_MA_50K_VIEW and COINGECKO_PRICE_DAILY_SUMMARY_VIEW_V2.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

parent.title: [Parent Ticket] Migrate All Remaining Views In CRYPTO_DB.COINGECKO To StarRocks.

comments.body:
```
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.COINGECKO_DAILY_PRICE_SUMMARY_VIEW AS
SELECT 
    TOKEN_ID,
    CG_ID,
    DATE,
    OPEN,
    HIGH,
    LOW,
    CLOSE,
    VOLUME 
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_PRICE_DAILY_SUMMARY

UNION ALL

SELECT
    TOKEN_ID,
    CG_ID,
    FROM_UNIXTIME(EPOCH / 1000, '%Y-%m-%d') AS DATE,
    MAX_BY(OPEN, EPOCH) AS OPEN,  -- Select OPEN price with the earliest EPOCH
    MAX(HIGH) AS HIGH,
    MIN(LOW) AS LOW,
    MAX_BY(CLOSE, EPOCH) AS CLOSE,  -- Select CLOSE price with the latest EPOCH
    MAX_BY(VOLUME, EPOCH) AS VOLUME  -- Select VOLUME with the latest EPOCH
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_OHLCV_DATA 
WHERE FROM_UNIXTIME(EPOCH / 1000, '%Y-%m-%d') = CURRENT_DATE()
GROUP BY TOKEN_ID, CG_ID, FROM_UNIXTIME(EPOCH / 1000, '%Y-%m-%d');
```

data.title: Develop Python Script to Migrate `performance_returns` Table from Snowflake/StarRocks to Supabase
data.description:
### **Title:** Develop Python Script to Migrate `performance_returns` Table from Snowflake/StarRocks to Supabase

### **Description:**

Create a standalone Python script to migrate the `trading_bot_dex.bots_data.performance_returns` table from **Snowflake** or **StarRocks** to **Supabase**. The script should handle large datasets efficiently and ensure data integrity.

### **Scope & Requirements:**

✅ Extract data from **Snowflake** or **StarRocks** (source to be confirmed).
✅ Transform data if necessary (e.g., column renaming, type conversions).
✅ Load data into **Supabase** while maintaining integrity.
✅ Support incremental updates or full migrations (to be clarified).
✅ Optimize for large-scale data migration (batch processing, retries).
✅ Provide logging and error handling.

### **Tech Stack:**

* Python
* `snowflake-connector-python` (if pulling from Snowflake)
* `mysql-connector-python` or `starrocks-connector-python` (if pulling from StarRocks)
* `supabase-py` or direct PostgreSQL connection
* Pandas for transformation
* SQLAlchemy for database operations

4. Both Jake Nguyen and Andrew consistently attend the meetings.
5. Progress updates and any blockers are effectively discussed and addressed in each session.

data.title: [Parent Ticket] Enable All Production DE Pipelines to Write Data into StarRocks
data.description:
### **Description:**

We need to enable all production **Data Engineering (DE) pipelines** to write data into **StarRocks** for improved performance, real-time analytics, and streamlined query execution.

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Identify all production DE pipelines that require integration with StarRocks.
* Define the data schema and transformations needed for compatibility with StarRocks.
* Implement and configure necessary connectors for data ingestion into StarRocks.
* Validate data correctness and consistency after writing to StarRocks.
* Optimize ingestion performance, ensuring it meets production SLAs.
* Update documentation and provide a guide for pipeline owners.

### **Technical Considerations:**

* **Connector:** Determine whether to use **StarRocks Kafka Connector, JDBC, or another ingestion method** based on pipeline needs.
* **Data Format:** Ensure that data formats align with StarRocks’ best practices (e.g., Parquet, JSON, or CSV).
* **Batch vs. Real-Time:** Decide whether data ingestion should be batch-based or real-time, depending on pipeline requirements.
* **Resource Utilization:** Monitor impact on existing pipeline performance and adjust configurations accordingly.
* **Security & Access:** Ensure **RBAC and access control** policies are in place for StarRocks integration.

### **Dependencies:**

* Access to **StarRocks cluster in GCP Kubernetes**
* Credentials & permissions setup (e.g., Cloud IAM, Kubernetes Secrets)
* Existing DE pipeline architecture review

data.title: [Parent Ticket] Migrate All Remaining Views In CRYPTO_DB.COINGECKO To StarRocks.
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Migrate Remaining Views in `CRYPTO_DB.COINGECKO` to StarRocks

**Description:**
Transition all remaining views within the `CRYPTO_DB.COINGECKO` database to the StarRocks analytics platform to enhance data processing efficiency and scalability.

**Business Rationale:**
Migrating to StarRocks will improve query performance, handle larger datasets more effectively, and provide greater scalability. This will enable faster and more reliable access to cryptocurrency data, supporting better decision-making and analytics.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All views in `CRYPTO_DB.COINGECKO` are successfully migrated to StarRocks.
* Migrated views are tested and verified for data accuracy and integrity.
* Performance benchmarks meet or exceed current standards.
* Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the migration.
* No disruptions occur to existing data workflows post-migration.

comments.body:
All the views have been migrated.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/f093f571-8734-4771-871f-3d137b3f753a/2923de40-43f0-4f22-a4c3-e7b1483d7915)

```sql
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.COINGECKO_LATEST_PRICE_FRONTEND_VIEW AS
SELECT 
    FROM_UNIXTIME(EPOCH, '%Y-%m-%d') AS DATE, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY MARKET_CAP DESC) AS ID,
    cltp.SYMBOL,
    cltp.NAME,
    cltp.COINGECKO_ID,
    cltp.TOKEN_ID,
    cltp.CURRENT_PRICE,
    cltp.HIGH_24H,
    cltp.LOW_24H,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_24H,
    cltp.PRICE_IN_BTC,
    cltp.EPOCH,
    FROM_UNIXTIME(cltp.EPOCH) AS CREATED_AT,
    cltp.LAST_UPDATED,
    cltp.TOTAL_VOLUME,
    cltp.MARKET_CAP,
    cltp.MARKET_CAP_RANK,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_1H_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_14D_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_24H_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_7D_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_1Y_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_200D_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_30D_IN_CURRENCY,
    cltp.IMAGE,
    cltp.FULLY_DILUTED_VALUATION,
    cltp.PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_24H,
    cltp.MARKET_CAP_CHANGE_24H,
    cltp.MARKET_CAP_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_24H,
    cltp.CIRCULATING_SUPPLY,
    cltp.MAX_SUPPLY,
    cltp.TOTAL_SUPPLY,
    cltp.SPARKLINE_DATA,
    cltp.ALL_TIME_HIGH,
    cltp.ALL_TIME_LOW
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_TOKENS_LIVE_PRICE_FRONT cltp;
```

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/9f9fb0be-65a3-4726-a20a-9bf6972a56b1/50a7c598-2a1f-4416-bd59-daf9f10016ea)

COINGECKO_LATEST_PRICE_FRONTEND_VIEW Created.

COINGECKO_EXCHANGES_VIEW

```
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.COINGECKO_EXCHANGES_VIEW AS
SELECT 
    ID,
    COINGECKO_EXCHANGE_ID,
    NAME,
    YEAR_ESTABLISHED,
    COUNTRY,
    DESCRIPTION,
    URL,
    IMAGE,
    HAS_TRADING_INCENTIVE,
    TRUST_SCORE,
    TRUST_SCORE_RANK,
    TRADE_VOLUME_24H_BTC,
    TRADE_VOLUME_24H_BTC_NORMALIZED
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_EXCHANGES;
```

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/3df199cd-2909-43b9-9692-2da60f0082e0/d5ee2709-0156-4faf-87f3-2855715dcf74)

COINGECKO_EXCHANGES_ORIGINAL_VIEW

```
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW COINGECKO.COINGECKO_EXCHANGES_ORIGINAL_VIEW AS
SELECT DISTINCT 
    TOKEN_ID, 
    NAME, 
    EXCHANGE 
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_TOKEN_EXCHANGES;
```

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/63441498-4039-4f99-bfba-6490073a6738/2b412cf1-8938-43a6-9602-100b25da9286)
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

* Documentation is updated to reflect the new balance fetching approach.

data.title: [StarRocks] Add static ip address for CN nodes service.
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue:** Add Static IP Addresses for CN Nodes Service in StarRocks

**Description:**
Configure static IP addresses for all Compute Node (CN) services within the StarRocks cluster to ensure consistent network connectivity and improve system reliability.

**Business Rationale:**
Assigning static IPs to CN nodes enhances the stability of service interactions, simplifies network management, and reduces the risk of connectivity issues. This leads to improved performance, easier troubleshooting, and a more reliable experience for users relying on the StarRocks infrastructure.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. All CN nodes are assigned unique static IP addresses.
2. Configuration changes are implemented without causing service interruptions.
3. Successful connectivity tests confirm that CN services are accessible via their new static IPs.
4. Documentation is updated to reflect the static IP assignments.
5. Monitoring systems are adjusted to track the static IPs, ensuring ongoing network stability.

data.title: Mitigate StarRocks Connection Timeout Spam to Prevent Blocking Other Processes
data.description:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/5741f9ba-26eb-4411-8ddc-f5d7e5ea9d3b/0e05e3aa-04b5-45ee-9b72-669f5f7b140b)

### **Description:**

Currently, when an automated process repeatedly spams connections that timeout, it causes **resource exhaustion**, leading to **blocked connections** for other processes trying to access StarRocks. This results in degraded database performance and potential service disruptions.

We need to implement a **mitigation strategy** to handle excessive connection timeouts and prevent them from impacting other workloads.

comments.body:
I initially misinterpreted the IP addresses shown in the session tab—they are not the source IPs. My session originates from a different IP, but after passing through the kube-proxy service, it appears as 10.0.0.67. I will investigate further to trace the actual source IP or identify any services generating excessive sessions.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/e2adef68-5b2c-42ef-a679-270e9f4a4f91/eb6996f9-6646-4d65-8ccc-f9b7416409c5)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/d8f085a7-524a-42a4-b518-fe9e7403d974/57a3a5c2-7203-4525-996d-50e167025552)

After active sessions were killed, the other pipelines run normally. However I couldn't detect which causing that yet.

data.title: Rebalancing DAG for Indices
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Rebalance DAG for Indices

**Description:** Implement a rebalancing mechanism within the Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) structure used for managing V1 Token Metrics AI Indices to ensure optimal distribution and performance.

Some further input on what we need to track :

* Index price 
* Value bought
* Current value 
* ROI
* PNL

**Business Rationale:** Rebalancing the DAG for indices is crucial to maintain the accuracy and efficiency of our AI-driven token metrics. This will enhance data reliability, improve decision-making processes, and ensure that our indices remain robust and responsive to market changes, thereby increasing client trust and satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The DAG automatically triggers rebalancing based on predefined performance thresholds.
2. Rebalancing operations do not interrupt ongoing processes or compromise data integrity.
3. Performance metrics demonstrate at least a 10% improvement in efficiency post-rebalancing.
4. All rebalancing activities are logged with timestamps and action details for auditing purposes.
5. Successful deployment is verified in a staging environment before production rollout.

comments.body: My part is done for calculation. After the necessary tables are created, I'll integrate my part to this.

data.title: Create Views for `trading_bot_dex` (or missing tables) Database in Supabase Prod
data.description:
### **Ticket: Create Views for** `trading_bot_dex` Database in Supabase Prod

#### **Context**

* The `trading_bot_dex` database in **Supabase Prod** needs views for better querying and analysis.
* Views should help with **trading bot analytics, performance tracking, and debugging**.

#### **Requirements**

1. **Identify Key Tables & Queries**
   * Determine which tables need views (e.g., `trades`, `orders`, `balances`, `strategies`).
   * Optimize queries that are frequently used in dashboards or analytics.
2. **Create Views for Common Use Cases**
   * **Trade History View**: Aggregate trades with relevant metadata (timestamp, price, volume).
   * **Order Book Snapshot**: Capture real-time order book state.
   * **Bot Performance Metrics**: Calculate P&L, win/loss ratio, and efficiency.
   * **Liquidity & Slippage Analysis**: Track liquidity depth and slippage on DEX trades.
3. **Performance Considerations**
   * Ensure the views are optimized for Supabase’s Postgres engine.
   * Consider **materialized views** if necessary to improve performance.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/99dfd60d-7a07-4b03-93b6-f217d2ed10a9/ee1eabaf-252b-42e4-8fea-404a9f08bb4e)

Title: Create Views for `trading_bot_dex` (or missing tables) Database in Supabase Prod

Description:
### **Ticket: Create Views for** `trading_bot_dex` Database in Supabase Prod

#### **Context**

* The `trading_bot_dex` database in **Supabase Prod** needs views for better querying and analysis.
* Views should help with **trading bot analytics, performance tracking, and debugging**.

#### **Requirements**

1. **Identify Key Tables & Queries**
   * Determine which tables need views (e.g., `trades`, `orders`, `balances`, `strategies`).
   * Optimize queries that are frequently used in dashboards or analytics.
2. **Create Views for Common Use Cases**
   * **Trade History View**: Aggregate trades with relevant metadata (timestamp, price, volume).
   * **Order Book Snapshot**: Capture real-time order book state.
   * **Bot Performance Metrics**: Calculate P&L, win/loss ratio, and efficiency.
   * **Liquidity & Slippage Analysis**: Track liquidity depth and slippage on DEX trades.
3. **Performance Considerations**
   * Ensure the views are optimized for Supabase’s Postgres engine.
   * Consider **materialized views** if necessary to improve performance.

data.title: enhance starrock_utils lib to avoid making to many connections to starrock
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Optimize `starrock_utils` Library to Reduce Excessive Starrock Connections

**Description:**
Enhance the `starrock_utils` library to minimize the number of connections made to Starrock. This optimization will improve performance and reduce resource consumption during data migration processes.

**Business Rationale:**
Reducing the number of connections to Starrock will lead to more efficient data migrations, lower latency, and decreased infrastructure costs. It ensures scalability and reliability as data volumes grow.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Implement a connection pool within `starrock_utils` to efficiently manage Starrock connections.
* Limit the number of simultaneous connections to Starrock to a configurable maximum.
* Ensure connections are reused appropriately to avoid unnecessary openings.
* Provide automated tests that verify the connection limits under typical data migration workloads.
* Update documentation to include details about the new connection management approach.

data.title: [Group] - AI Indices Platform Testing 9
data.description:
## **Title1:** Top Trending Indices Display Issue – Should Show 6 and Align with All Indices Table

**Description:**
In the **Top Trending Indices** section, only a limited number of indices are displayed, but it should show **6 indices** and be aligned with the **All Indices** table. The current display is misaligned with the expected design, and the number of indices is incorrect.

[https://jam.dev/c/b232ef47-7666-436d-87ae-4fe36f215c3c](https://jam.dev/c/b232ef47-7666-436d-87ae-4fe36f215c3c)

## **Title3:**  Incorrect Percentage Display in Treemap View – Both Tokens Show 25%

**Description:**
In the **Treemap View**, when there are **2 tokens**, both tokens are showing a percentage of **25%** each, which is incorrect.

[https://jam.dev/c/2f0c2cad-bc37-4600-9dec-9c5e8db795d8](https://jam.dev/c/2f0c2cad-bc37-4600-9dec-9c5e8db795d8)

## **Title4:** Index Should Appear in Treemap But Not in Table View

**Description:**
**USDC** represents the **cash balance** and should be included in the **Treemap View** to ensure that the weights sum up to **100%**. However, **USDC** should **not appear in the Table View**, as it is not relevant in that context. This behavior needs to be correctly implemented to ensure consistency and accuracy in the display of data.

## **Title5:** Index Icons Not Displaying Dynamically

**Description:**
The **index icons** are not displaying dynamically as expected. This issue prevents the icons from being shown correctly based on the data or user actions, affecting the visual presentation and overall functionality.

[https://jam.dev/c/6907e994-aac8-4918-96f5-22d60a5052f6](https://jam.dev/c/6907e994-aac8-4918-96f5-22d60a5052f6)

Please check: [ENG-5015](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-5015/update-the-index-icon-to-be-of-dynamic-length#comment-7de9a59f)

data.title: Integration of the Agent
data.description:
Enable the agent on a new endpoint for testing to be tested separately. Moreover, this will be a new branch in the intent routing.

Groomed Issue:

**Issue: Integrate Trading Agent Controller as an Independent Agent**

**Description:**
Enable the Trading Agent Controller on a new endpoint to allow separate testing. Implement this integration as a new branch within the intent routing system to ensure isolated and controlled testing environments.

**Business Rationale:**
Separating the Trading Agent Controller into an independent agent facilitates targeted testing and development. This isolation minimizes the risk of impacting existing functionalities, accelerates the identification and resolution of issues, and enhances the overall reliability and scalability of the trading platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. A new endpoint is created and configured to host the Trading Agent Controller.
2. The Trading Agent Controller operates independently within a separate branch of the intent routing system.
3. The new endpoint supports full functionality of the Trading Agent Controller without affecting existing endpoints.
4. Comprehensive tests are successfully conducted on the independent agent.
5. Documentation is updated to include details of the new endpoint and intent routing branch.

data.title: Trading Agent Controller as Independent Agent
data.description:
#### **Problem Statement:**

The current implementation relies heavily on prompt engineering, leading to two key bottlenecks:

1. **Fragility in Intent Routing:**
   * The solution consists of multiple layers of intent routing to determine function calls and construct API payloads.
   * If any intent router fails, subsequent steps will also fail, causing a cascading issue.
2. **Scalability Constraints:**
   * Adding a new REST API endpoint requires a customized solution.
   * This increases development complexity and results in high latency for production deployment.

#### **Proposed Solution:**

* **Adopt LangGraph** to build an agent with direct access to tools, including REST API endpoints and payload generation utilities.
* **Agent Responsibilities:**
  * Dynamically route and call the appropriate API endpoints.
  * Generate API payloads correctly, reducing dependence on predefined prompt templates.
  * Ensure modularity and fault tolerance by minimizing dependency on multi-layered intent routing.

#### **Expected Benefits:**

* **Improved Robustness** – Eliminates failure-prone intent routing layers.
* **Enhanced Scalability** – Simplifies the addition of new API endpoints.
* **Faster Time-to-Production** – Reduces latency in implementing new integrations.

* **Adopt LangGraph** to build an agent with direct access to tools, including REST API endpoints and payload generation utilities.

  * Dynamically route and call the appropriate API endpoints.
  * Generate API payloads correctly, reducing dependence on predefined prompt templates.
  * Ensure modularity and fault tolerance by minimizing dependency on multi-layered intent routing.

#### **Expected Benefits:**

* **Improved Robustness** – Eliminates failure-prone intent routing layers.
* **Enhanced Scalability** – Simplifies the addition of new API endpoints.
* **Faster Time-to-Production** – Reduces latency in implementing new integrations.

Replace the current bitQuery method with web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py) libraries to fetch user balances from Privy. This update targets the V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy/Fiat Gateways to enhance data retrieval processes.

**Business Rationale:**
Utilizing web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py) will improve the efficiency and reliability of balance fetching, ensuring more accurate and timely data for trading operations. This shift reduces dependency on bitQuery and leverages more robust, widely-supported technologies.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Balance data is successfully fetched from Privy using web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py).
2. Retrieved balances match those previously obtained via bitQuery.
3. Performance benchmarks show improved or comparable retrieval times.
4. All relevant documentation is updated to reflect the new implementation.
5. No existing functionalities are broken post-implementation.

data.title: [Parent] Transpile all hub tables from Snowflake to StarRocks
data.description:
### **Title:** Transpile all hub tables from Snowflake to StarRocks

### **Description:**

We need to migrate all hub tables from Snowflake to StarRocks to optimize query performance and reduce costs. This involves transpiling existing SQL queries and data models to be compatible with StarRocks.

### **Scope:**

* Identify all hub tables currently in Snowflake.
* Convert Snowflake-specific SQL to StarRocks-compatible SQL.
* Ensure that schema definitions, indexing strategies, and partitioning align with StarRocks best practices.
* Validate query performance and correctness post-migration.
* Update downstream dependencies and ensure compatibility.

**Title:** Fetch Raw Data from Web3 and Solana Using web3 and [solana.py](http://solana.py)

**Description:**  
Implement data retrieval for V1 Trading AI Agents by sourcing raw data directly from Web3 and Solana networks using the `web3` library and `solana.py`, replacing the current BitQuery dependency.

**Business Rationale:**  
Directly accessing Web3 and Solana ensures greater data reliability, reduces dependency on third-party services, and can lower operational costs. This enhancement supports more efficient and scalable Trading AI operations with Privy/Fiat Gateways.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Raw data is successfully fetched from Web3 using the `web3` library.
* Raw data is successfully fetched from the Solana network using `solana.py`.
* BitQuery is fully removed from the data fetching process.
* Data retrieval is tested and verified for accuracy and reliability.
* Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the new data sources and methods.

data.title: Step3: Migrating the data, script, pipeline from snowflake to the starrock
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Migrate Data, Scripts, and Pipelines from Snowflake to StarRocks

**Description:**  
Transition the existing data, scripts, and ETL pipelines from Snowflake to StarRocks to enhance performance and reduce operational costs. This involves migrating databases, adapting or rewriting scripts, and establishing equivalent data pipelines within the StarRocks environment.

**Business Rationale:**  
Migrating to StarRocks will provide improved query performance, greater scalability, and potential cost savings. This migration supports our goal to optimize the data infrastructure, ensuring more efficient data processing and better support for our growing analytics needs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All data is successfully migrated to StarRocks without loss or corruption.
* Scripts are adapted and function correctly within the StarRocks environment.
* ETL pipelines are reconfigured and validated for accurate data processing.
* Performance on StarRocks meets or exceeds benchmarks established with Snowflake.
* Comprehensive documentation is updated to reflect the new StarRocks setup.
* Migration is reviewed and approved by key stakeholders.

```
report_request = {
    'project_name': 'Render',
    'official_link': 'https://www.rendernetwork.com/',
```

We will be instantly returned with the 4 reports directly

```
import requests
import time

API_URL = 'https://reportwriter-dev.tokenmetrics.com'

# Step 1: Submit the report generation request
report_request = {
    'project_name': 'Render',
    'official_link': 'https://www.rendernetwork.com/',
    'token_symbol': '$RENDER',
    'relevant_links': 'https://twitter.com/rendernetwork, https://know.rendernetwork.com'
}

response = requests.post(f"{API_URL}/report", json=report_request)

if response.status_code == 200:
    task_data = response.json()
    task_id = task_data.get("task_id")
    print(f"Report generation started with task ID: {task_id}")
    
    # Step 2: Poll for status until complete
    completed = False
    max_attempts = 60
    attempts = 0
    
    while not completed and attempts < max_attempts:
        status_response = requests.get(f"{API_URL}/report/{task_id}")
        
        if status_response.status_code == 200:
            status_data = status_response.json()
            status = status_data.get("status")
            
            if status == "completed":
                completed = True
                print("Report generation completed!")
                
                # Step 3: Get the specific reports
                report_types = ["code_review", "deep_dive", "investment_analysis", "investment_analysis_pointer"]
                
                for report_type in report_types:
                    report_response = requests.get(f"{API_URL}/report/{task_id}/report/{report_type}?format=json")
                    
                    if report_response.status_code == 200:
                        report_data = report_response.json()
                        print(f"Retrieved {report_type} report")
                        # The Report is Report Data
                        # Process or save the report data here
                    else:
                        print(f"Failed to retrieve {report_type} report. Status code: {report_response.status_code}")
            
            elif status == "failed":
                print("Report generation failed")
                print(status_data.get("error", "No error details provided"))
                break
            else:
                print(f"Report status: {status}. Waiting...")
                time.sleep(10)  # Wait 10 seconds before checking again
        
        attempts += 1
    
    if not completed:
        print("Reached maximum polling attempts. Report may still be processing.")
else:
    print(f"Failed to start report generation. Status code: {response.status_code}")
    print(response.text)
```

data.title: Integrate Chatbot with Sentry LLM Monitoring and Set Up Alerts
data.description:
[AI Application Insights with Sentry LLM Monitoring](https://blog.sentry.io/ai-application-insights-with-sentry-llm-monitoring/)

[LLM Monitoring](https://sentry.io/for/llm-monitoring/)

We need to integrate our existing chatbot with Sentry's LLM Monitoring feature to track performance, errors, and costs (see [DAT-2091](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/DAT-2091/chatbot)). 

This will help us debug issues faster, optimize token usage, and monitor the overall health of our AI-powered chatbot.

## Objective:

Implement Sentry LLM Monitoring for our chatbot and set up relevant alerts to proactively identify and address issues.

Acceptance Criteria:

1. Sentry LLM Monitoring is successfully integrated with our chatbot
2. Token usage and costs are tracked and visible in Sentry dashboard
3. Error events related to the chatbot are aggregated and provide relevant metadata
4. Performance metrics for AI pipelines are available and traceable
5. Alerts are set up for critical issues (e.g., high error rates, excessive token usage)

Implementation Steps:

1. Update Sentry SDK:
   * Ensure the latest version of Sentry SDK for Python is installed
   * Install the Sentry Python SDK integration for our LLM provider (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic)
2. Instrument Chatbot Code:
   * Import the necessary Sentry modules in the chatbot code
   * Use the `@ai_track` decorator for AI pipelines if not using an LLM orchestrator
   * Ensure all LLM calls are properly wrapped with Sentry tracking
3. Configure LLM Monitoring:
   * Set up environment variables for Sentry LLM Monitoring
   * Configure any necessary settings in the Sentry dashboard for LLM tracking
4. Test Integration:
   * Run the chatbot with test scenarios to ensure events are being captured
   * Verify that token usage, errors, and performance metrics are visible in Sentry
5. Set Up Alerts:
   * Create alert rules for high error rates (e.g., >5% in 5 minutes)
   * Set up alerts for excessive token usage (e.g., >10,000 tokens in 1 minute)
   * Configure performance alerts for slow AI pipeline responses (e.g., >2 seconds)
6. Documentation:
   * Update internal documentation with details on the Sentry LLM Monitoring integration
   * Provide guidelines for the team on how to use and interpret the new monitoring data
7. Monitoring and Optimization:
   * Set up a dashboard in Sentry to visualize key metrics for the chatbot
   * Plan for regular reviews of the monitoring data to identify optimization opportunities

## Additional Notes:

* Coordinate with the DevOps team if any infrastructure changes are needed
* Consider setting up a staging environment to test the integration before deploying to production
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations when capturing and storing LLM-related data

comments.body: @ahmedhamdy great, thank you!

## UPDATE

Just set up a brand-new Sentry project for **tm-ai-agent** using the **Python SDK**! This means we can now supercharge our monitoring and keep a close eye on different parts of the codebase. I've also integrated the **Sentry SDK** into the **LLM module**, so if anything goes wrong (at the LLM side), we'll have full visibility to track and fix issues in less time.

Test cases:

```
Testing GPT-4o model...
The capital of France is Paris.

Testing o3-mini model...
The capital of France is Paris. Paris is not only the country's political center but also a major hub for art, fashion, and culture, making it one of the most recognized cities in the world.

Testing error handling with invalid model...
Caught exception during testing: Unsupported model: invalid-model
Sentry is attempting to send 2 pending events
Waiting up to 2 seconds 
Press Ctrl-Break to quit
```

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/c98e05df-aa1c-47bb-95a0-47bc08ceae74/b2f9f60c-74a7-495b-99fe-070c4d9455ee)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a6ca48df-4a01-4da2-896a-105ff5b370e7/b3272870-c42a-4f8e-ba6c-b0e407421b6d)

data.title: Create Domain Name for Research agent
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Create Domain Name for Research Agent

**Description:** Register and set up a professional domain name for the Research Agent platform to enhance online presence and ensure easy access for users.

**Business Rationale:** Establishing a dedicated domain name will improve brand credibility, increase visibility, and provide a reliable access point for users, thereby supporting the growth and trust in the Research Agent service.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A suitable and available domain name is selected and approved by stakeholders.
* The domain is successfully registered through a reputable domain registrar.
* DNS settings are configured correctly to point to the platform’s hosting services.
* The domain is integrated with the Research Agent’s website and tested for proper functionality and accessibility.

data.title: End to End Debugging during testing of newly created components
data.description:
* Review of every component and mapping it with figma dev mode specs
* Test of bridge functionality through burn and stake , from owning nft to buring and keeping track of bridge functionality on success modal.

Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** End-to-End Debugging for Burn-to-Stake Platform Components

**Description:**
Perform comprehensive debugging of newly developed components by reviewing each against Figma dev mode specifications and testing bridge functionality. This includes verifying the process from NFT ownership to burning and staking, and ensuring bridge operations are accurately tracked and displayed on the success modal.

**Business Rationale:**
Ensuring the reliability and alignment of new components with design specifications is crucial for the seamless functionality of the Burn-to-Stake platform. Reliable bridge operations enhance user trust and support the effectiveness of V1 DAO Governance and Staking mechanisms.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. All new components are reviewed and verified against Figma dev mode specifications.
2. Bridge functionality tests cover:
   * NFT ownership initiation
   * Burning and staking processes
   * Tracking and displaying bridge operations on the success modal
3. All identified issues are documented and resolved.
4. Successful testing is confirmed with no critical bugs remaining.

Revamp the transaction processing popup interface to incorporate the latest design updates, ensuring improved usability and visual consistency within the Burn-to-Stake platform.

Enhancing the popup design will provide users with a more intuitive and seamless transaction experience, reducing friction and increasing engagement on the Burn-to-Stake platform. This alignment with current design standards supports overall platform reliability and user satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The popup design matches the latest design specifications provided.
* Responsive layout ensuring compatibility across all supported devices and screen sizes.
* All existing functionalities (e.g., transaction initiation, status updates) operate correctly post-update.
* Successful completion of user acceptance testing with no critical issues identified.
* Deployment to production without affecting other platform components.

data.title: [AI Indices] Refactor and optimize investor/trader views
data.description:
We need to optimize these

```
      SELECT 
        a."COIN", 
        a."TOKEN_NAME", 
        a."TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
        a."CG_ID", 
        CAST(a."MARKET_CAP" as FLOAT) as "MARKET_CAP", 
        CAST(a."PRICE" as FLOAT) as "PRICE", 
        CAST(a."CURRENT_ROI" as FLOAT) as "CURRENT_ROI", 
        CAST(a."WEIGHT" as FLOAT) as "WEIGHT", 
        a."ICON", 
        CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE" as FLOAT) as "TRADER_GRADE", 
        CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H" as FLOAT) as "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H", 
        CAST(b."total_rows" as INTEGER) as "TOTAL_COUNT" 
      FROM INVESTOR_INDEX.HOLDINGS_VIEW a
      CROSS JOIN (
        SELECT COUNT(*) AS "total_rows" 
        FROM INVESTOR_INDEX.HOLDINGS_VIEW
      ) b
      LIMIT 10
      offset 1
```

```
      SELECT 
        a."COIN", 
        a."TOKEN_NAME", 
        a."TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
        a."CG_ID", 
        CAST(a."MARKET_CAP" as FLOAT) as "MARKET_CAP", 
        CAST(a."PRICE" as FLOAT) as "PRICE", 
        CAST(a."CURRENT_ROI" as FLOAT) as "CURRENT_ROI", 
        CAST(a."WEIGHT" as FLOAT) as "WEIGHT", 
        a."ICON", 
        CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE" as FLOAT) as "TRADER_GRADE", 
        CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H" as FLOAT) as "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H", 
        CAST(b."total_rows" as INTEGER) as "TOTAL_COUNT" 
      FROM TRADER_INDEX.HOLDINGS_VIEW a
      CROSS JOIN (
        SELECT COUNT(*) AS "total_rows" 
        FROM TRADER_INDEX.HOLDINGS_VIEW
      ) b
      LIMIT 10
      offset 1
```

parent.title: [Parent] Supabase Integration

comments.body: ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/beced3dd-99c6-4e67-be30-c4d691a29189/2dfae078-3081-40c6-b84f-13b5a4f208e2)
no need to care that @harshg, the results are same format with old, that name is alias on the sub-query

@ankit can you please update the queries to include the same column names that I was retrieving from the old queries? Also, I'm not sure about `ON TRUE` in `weight_table`, as it was not mentioned anywhere in the old business logic

@harshg 
1

```
select 
	"TOKEN_ID" ,
	"TOKEN_NAME" as "COIN",
	"TOKEN_NAME" ,
	"TOKEN_SYMBOL" ,
	"CG_ID" ,
	"MARKET_CAP" ,
	"CURRENT_PRICE" ,
	"PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_24H_IN_CURRENCY" as "CURRENT_ROI",
	"WEIGHT",
	"TM_TRADER_GRADE" as "TRADER_GRADE",
	"TM_TRADER_GRADE_24H_PCT_CHANGE" as "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H",
	mrp."IMAGES_THUMB" as "ICON",
	weight_table."DATE" 
from analytics.mv_rating_page mrp 
inner join lateral (
	SELECT "WEIGHT", "DATE" 
	FROM investor_index.all_data ad 
	where mrp."TOKEN_ID" = ad."TOKEN_ID" 
	ORDER BY "DATE" desc
	limit 1
) as weight_table on true --remove true with weight_table."WEIGHT" > 0 based on the business
limit 50;
```

2

```

select 
	"TOKEN_ID" ,
	"TOKEN_NAME" as "COIN",
	"TOKEN_NAME" ,
	"TOKEN_SYMBOL" ,
	"CG_ID" ,
	"MARKET_CAP" ,
	"CURRENT_PRICE" ,
	"PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_24H_IN_CURRENCY" as "CURRENT_ROI",
	"WEIGHT",
	"TM_TRADER_GRADE" as "TRADER_GRADE",
	"TM_TRADER_GRADE_24H_PCT_CHANGE" as "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H",
	mrp."IMAGES_THUMB" as "ICON",
	weight_table."DATE" 
from analytics.mv_rating_page mrp 
inner join lateral (
	SELECT "WEIGHT", "DATE" 
	FROM trader_index.all_data ad 
	where mrp."TOKEN_ID" = ad."TOKEN_ID" 
	ORDER BY "DATE" desc
	limit 1
) as weight_table on true --remove true with weight_table."WEIGHT" > 0 based on the business
limit 50;
```

data.title: [AI Indices] Refactor Indices holdings view
data.description:
We need to optimize this query

```
SELECT 
    a."COIN", 
    a."TOKEN_NAME", 
    a."TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
    CAST(a."CG_ID" AS TEXT) AS "CG_ID", 
    CAST(a."MARKET_CAP" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "MARKET_CAP", 
    CAST(a."PRICE" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "PRICE", 
    CAST(a."CURRENT_ROI" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "CURRENT_ROI", 
    CAST(a."WEIGHT" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "WEIGHT", 
    a."ICON", 
    CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "TRADER_GRADE", 
    CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H", 
    CAST(b."TOTAL_ROWS" AS INTEGER) AS "TOTAL_COUNT" 
FROM INDICES_SECTORS.HOLDINGS_VIEW a 
CROSS JOIN (
    SELECT 
        CAST(COUNT(*) AS INTEGER) AS "TOTAL_ROWS" 
    FROM INDICES_SECTORS.HOLDINGS_VIEW 
    WHERE LOWER("SECTOR") = 'meme'
) b 
WHERE LOWER(a."SECTOR") = 'meme'
LIMIT 10
OFFSET 1;
```

***Note ! meme, limit and offset values are dynamic parameters***

parent.title: [Parent] Supabase Integration

comments.body: @harshg please check new query here

@ankit The original query returns data based on the sector, as you can see in this part of the Snowflake query. However, the migrated query is not filtering based on sectors. Can you please look into this?

```
SELECT 
    a."COIN", 
    a."TOKEN_NAME", 
    a."TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
    CAST(a."CG_ID" AS TEXT) AS "CG_ID", 
    CAST(a."MARKET_CAP" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "MARKET_CAP", 
    CAST(a."PRICE" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "PRICE", 
    CAST(a."CURRENT_ROI" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "CURRENT_ROI", 
    CAST(a."WEIGHT" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "WEIGHT", 
    a."ICON", 
    CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "TRADER_GRADE", 
    CAST(a."TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H" AS DOUBLE PRECISION) AS "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H", 
    CAST(b."TOTAL_ROWS" AS INTEGER) AS "TOTAL_COUNT" 
FROM INDICES_SECTORS.HOLDINGS_VIEW a 
CROSS JOIN (
    SELECT 
        CAST(COUNT(*) AS INTEGER) AS "TOTAL_ROWS" 
    FROM INDICES_SECTORS.HOLDINGS_VIEW 
    WHERE LOWER("SECTOR") = 'meme' <----- sector name
) b 
WHERE LOWER(a."SECTOR") = 'meme' <----- sector name
LIMIT 10
OFFSET 1;
```

@harshg please try this 

```
select 
	"TOKEN_ID" ,
	"TOKEN_NAME" as "COIN",
	"TOKEN_NAME" ,
	"TOKEN_SYMBOL" ,
	"CG_ID" ,
	"MARKET_CAP" ,
	"CURRENT_PRICE" ,
	"PRICE_CHANGE_PERCENTAGE_24H_IN_CURRENCY" as "CURRENT_ROI",
	"WEIGHT",
	"TM_TRADER_GRADE" as "TRADER_GRADE",
	"TM_TRADER_GRADE_24H_PCT_CHANGE" as "TRADER_GRADE_CHANGE_24H",
	mrp."IMAGES_THUMB" as "ICON",
	weight_table."DATE" 
from analytics.mv_rating_page mrp 
inner join lateral (
	SELECT "WEIGHT", "DATE" 
	FROM indices_sectors.all_data ad 
	where mrp."TOKEN_ID" = ad."TOKEN_ID" and "SECTOR" ilike '%text_search%'
	ORDER BY "DATE" desc
	limit 1
) as weight_table on true --remove true with weight_table."WEIGHT" > 0 based on the business
limit 50;
```

for TOTAL_COUNT, please use 

```
select 
	count(*) as "TOTAL_COUNT"
from analytics.mv_rating_page mrp 
inner join lateral (
	SELECT "WEIGHT", "DATE" 
	FROM indices_sectors.all_data ad 
	where mrp."TOKEN_ID" = ad."TOKEN_ID" and "SECTOR" ilike '%text_search%'
	ORDER BY "DATE" desc
	limit 1
) as weight_table on true --remove true with weight_table."WEIGHT" > 0 based on the business
```
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6794). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Prepare `development` Branch of data api endpoints for Supabase Migration Deployment
data.description:
### **Description:**

We need to make the `development` branch ready for Supabase migration deployment. Currently, the `master` branch (pointed to `dev`) contains all the latest **Data API Beta** code, while the `development` branch was behind.

#### **Tasks:**

* Sync all logic changes from `master` into `development`.
* Update references from `master` to `development`.
* Fix type conversion issues in Supabase (e.g., **date and number types**).
* Test each endpoint to ensure proper data handling and conversions.
* Make necessary adjustments to resolve any migration-related issues.

parent.title: Application Code Updates (Next.js + Prisma)

comments.body: Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/53907cfc-06b0-4a7a-847c-554cedbb6397](https://jam.dev/c/53907cfc-06b0-4a7a-847c-554cedbb6397)

**Action Items Taken:**

* Referenced the master branch to extract the Data API beta logic and converted all the added code to Supabase.
* Resolved all endpoint issues, including table-related errors, incorrect data, and inaccessible tables, by coordinating with the data team.
* Tested all 32 endpoints individually to ensure they work with Supabase.
* Verified all endpoints with the dashboard, confirming they function correctly with the staging dashboard already deployed to Supabase.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6782). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Refactor app.all_trading_bots_view
data.description:
This table is used to trade agent list but performance is poor

old:

![image (3).png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/be3417ce-c956-479b-a629-a51cc1db4f18/646d6260-cce9-4fda-b67d-d7a9fbbd8251)

new:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/df45d7b1-13b8-4390-a83b-07767274a0fb/fc88d74b-5ea8-4bca-a33b-f680e202f0d3)

file: 

```sql

-- bots_data.performance_statistics
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS unique_idx_performance_statistics_token_id
	ON bots_data.performance_statistics ("TOKEN_ID");

-- bots_data.bots 
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_bots_data_bots_token_id
	ON bots_data.bots ("TOKEN_ID")
WHERE "TOKEN_ID" IS NOT NULL;

CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_bots_data_bots_base_index_id
	ON bots_data.bots ("BASE_INDEX_ID")
WHERE "BASE_INDEX_ID" IS NOT NULL;

-- analytics.trading_signals
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_analytics_trading_signals_timestamp_desc
  ON analytics.trading_signals ("TIMESTAMP" DESC);


-- coingecko.coingecko_token_exchanges 
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_coingecko_token_exchanges_token_id_exchange_type
	ON coingecko.coingecko_token_exchanges ("TOKEN_ID", "EXCHANGE_TYPE")
WHERE "TOKEN_ID" IS NOT NULL;

-- coingecko.coingecko_token_exchanges 
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_coingecko_token_exchanges_token_id_exchange_type
	ON coingecko.coingecko_token_exchanges ("TOKEN_ID", "EXCHANGE_TYPE")
WHERE "TOKEN_ID" IS NOT NULL;

-- reference.index
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_reference_index_token_id
	ON reference.index ("TOKEN_ID");
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_reference_index_token_id_index_id
	ON reference.index ("TOKEN_ID", "INDEX_ID");
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_reference_index_chainid_token_id
	ON reference.index ("CHAINID", "TOKEN_ID");


-- lifi_db.chains
CREATE INDEX IF NOT exists idx_lifi_db_chains_id
	ON lifi_db.chains ("ID");
	
-- coingecko.coingecko_tokens
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX IF NOT exists unique_idx_coingecko_coingecko_tokens_cg_id
	ON coingecko.coingecko_tokens ("CG_ID", "IMAGES");

-- app.all_trading_bots_view
-- EXPLAIN ANALYZE 
ALTER TABLE reference.index
  DROP COLUMN if exists "ID";
ALTER TABLE reference.index
  ADD COLUMN if not exists "ID" BIGINT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY;

CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW app.all_trading_bots_view as 
EXPLAIN ANALYZE 
with bots_summary_view as (
 SELECT bots."TOKEN_ID",
    count(*) AS "NUM_BOTS",
    sum(bots."INITIAL_VALUES") AS "AUM"
   FROM bots_data.bots
   where "TOKEN_ID" is not null
  GROUP BY bots."TOKEN_ID"
),
volume_data AS (
 SELECT "TOKEN_ID",
    sum("CONVERTED_VOLUME"['usd'::text]::double precision) AS "TOTAL_VOLUME_IN_USD"
   FROM coingecko.coingecko_token_exchanges
  GROUP BY "TOKEN_ID"
), agent_volume_data AS (
 SELECT "BASE_INDEX_ID" AS "INDEX_ID",
    sum("INITIAL_VALUES") AS "AGENT_AUM_IN_USD"
   FROM bots_data.bots
  GROUP BY "BASE_INDEX_ID"
), available_volumn as (
	SELECT  
		i."INDEX_ID", 
		COALESCE(vd."TOTAL_VOLUME_IN_USD", 0::double precision) as "TOTAL_VOLUME_IN_USD",
		COALESCE(avd."AGENT_AUM_IN_USD", 0::double precision) AS "AGENT_AUM_IN_USD"
	FROM reference.index i
	inner join volume_data vd ON i."TOKEN_ID" = vd."TOKEN_ID"
	inner join agent_volume_data avd ON i."INDEX_ID" = avd."INDEX_ID"
)
select 
	i."ID",
	i."TOKEN_ID",
    i."TOKEN_NAME",
    i."TOKEN_SYMBOL",
    i."CHAINID",
    i."INDEX_ID" AS "BASE_INDEX_ID",
            
    c."CHAINTYPE",
    c."NAME" AS "CHAIN",
    c."LOGOURI" AS "CHAIN_LOGOURL",
    
    i."CG_ID",
    
    p."LAST_MONTH_RETURNS" * 100::double precision AS "RETURN_1MONTH",
    p."LAST6_MONTH_RETURNS" * 100::double precision AS "RETURN_6MONTH",
    p."NET_RETURNS" * 100::double precision AS "OVERALL_RETURN",
    p."SCORE" AS "TRADING_AGENT_GRADE",
    p."PREVIOUS_SCORE" / p."SCORE" - 1::double precision AS "TRADING_AGENT_GRADE_CHANGE",
    p."BENCHMARK_RETURNS" * 100::double precision AS "HOLDING_RETURN",
    p."PROFIT_FACTOR",
    p."CAGR" * 100::double precision AS "CAGR",
    p."MAX_DRAWDOWN" * 100::double precision AS "MAX_DRAWDOWN",
    p."SHARPE_RATIO_ANNUALIZED" AS "SHARPE_RATIO",
    p."WIN_RATIO" * 100::double precision AS "WIN_RATIO",
    p."RISK_REWARD_RATIO", 
    p."OVERALL_PERIOD",
    0 as "LAST_TRADING_SIGNAL",
    0::numeric as "TRADING_SIGNAL",
    null as "TRADING_SIGNAL_TEXT",
    
    ct."IMAGES" as "CG_IMAGES",
    i."LOGOURI" AS "LIFI_IMAGES",
    mrp."TM_TRADER_GRADE"::double precision AS "TRADER_GRADE",

    COALESCE(bs."AUM", 0::double precision) AS "AUM",
    COALESCE(bs."NUM_BOTS", 0::bigint) AS "NUMBER_OF_INVESTORS",
	(av."TOTAL_VOLUME_IN_USD" - av."AGENT_AUM_IN_USD") AS "AVAILABLE_VOLUME"
from reference.index i
inner join lifi_db.chains c on i."CHAINID" = c."ID" 
left join bots_data.performance_statistics p on i."TOKEN_ID" = p."TOKEN_ID" 
left join coingecko.coingecko_tokens ct on i."CG_ID" = ct."CG_ID" 
left join analytics.mv_rating_page mrp on i."TOKEN_ID" = mrp."TOKEN_ID"
left join bots_summary_view bs ON i."TOKEN_ID" = bs."TOKEN_ID"
left join available_volumn av ON i."INDEX_ID" = av."INDEX_ID"
where i."TOKEN_ID" is not null and i."INDEX_ID" is not null
```

comments.body: Sure.

hi @chao 
"LAST_TRADING_SIGNAL", "TRADING_SIGNAL", "TRADING_SIGNAL_TEXT" are stored on the `analytics.trading_signals` so I removed the logic temporarily. We need to find a performant solution.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Update Buy Index Modal to New Design

**Description:**
Revamp the Buy Index modal to align with the latest design specifications provided in the Figma document.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the Buy Index modal ensures a consistent and improved user experience, which can lead to higher user engagement and satisfaction. Adhering to updated design standards also reinforces the brand's professionalism and attention to detail.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The Buy Index modal reflects the updated design as per [Figma Design](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=11969-28078&m=dev).
* All existing functionalities within the modal remain fully operational after the update.
* The modal is fully responsive and displays correctly across all supported devices and browsers.
* Design revisions have been reviewed and approved by the design team.
* No critical bugs are present post-implementation.

data.title: Automation Cypress: Verify Manage Plan and Plan Page Validation
data.description:
**Description:**
The purpose of this test is to verify that the "Manage Plan" button on the My Subscription page functions correctly and redirects to the plan page as expected. Additionally, we will verify that the package information and next invoice details are displayed correctly on the plan page.

**Steps:**

1. **Access the My Subscription Page:**
   * The user should visit the "My Subscription" page.
   * The page should load correctly, and the URL should contain '/my-subscription'.
2. **Click on the Manage Plan Button:**
   * The user should click the "Manage Plan" button.
   * The button should be clickable and properly identified.
3. **Redirect to the Plan Page:**
   * Upon clicking the "Manage Plan" button, the user should be redirected to the plan page.
   * The URL of the page should contain '/plan'.
4. **Verify Package Information and Next Invoice:**
   * The plan page should display package information and next invoice details.
   * It should be verified that these details are correctly shown.

comments.body:
@ashutosh great work! My only questions is why the veTMAI balance doesn't change after the NFT is burned?

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/6f51de42-00c7-46b6-8901-5b6d600f8aef/233a6784-86d4-49fe-a2ea-b1f19da2e971)

Implementation Actions  Taken :
🛠️ Changes Implemented

### 🎨 UI Alignment with Figma Designs

* Added missing "Connect Wallet" button in the "Your Astrobot NFTs" section
* Updated the "What Are Benefits" text to "Staking Benefits" as per design specs
* Added search field for Astrobot NFTs to allow users to find specific NFTs

### ✨ User Experience Improvements

* Fixed transaction status issue: "Failed to Approve NFT for Bridging" no longer gets stuck in "Transaction Complete" status
* Implemented empty state handling for users who:
  * Have not yet connected their wallet
  * Don't have an Astrobot NFT after connecting their wallet
* Updated card design in the NFT listing section for better visual clarity
* Enhanced confirmation popup design for improved user interaction
* Improved transaction processing popup for clearer status indication
* Fixed responsiveness issues and footer alignment on the burn-to-stake pages

## 💻 Technical Details

* Aligned all implementations with Figma specifications:
  * Colors, fonts, and styling match the provided Figma designs
  * Fixed padding, gradients, and sizing as specified
* Ensured proper error handling across all transaction flows
* Made sure all UI states properly reflect the backend transaction status

## 🧪 Testing Performed

* Verified all UI elements match Figma designs
* Tested all user flows for both successful and error scenarios
* Ensured responsive behavior across different screen sizes
* Confirmed proper transaction status handling in all edge cases

## 🛠️ Figma Dev Usage

* Extensively used Figma Dev throughout the implementation process to ensure pixel-perfect UI
* Leveraged Figma Dev to extract exact colors, spacing, and component dimensions
* Utilized Figma Dev inspection tools to verify proper padding, gradients, and font styles
* Implemented responsive design following Figma Dev specifications for various breakpoints
* Referenced Figma Dev for all component states (hover, active, disabled) to ensure consistency

All changes follow the Figma Dev guidelines with careful attention to details in the implementation, resulting in a high-fidelity match to the design specifications.



Reference JAM : [https://jam.dev/c/bdfade53-dbf7-45b8-8f3d-9124b0a9c120](https://jam.dev/c/bdfade53-dbf7-45b8-8f3d-9124b0a9c120)

data.title: [Group] - Sentient Indices Platform Testing 12
data.description:
## **Title1:** "No Result" Message on Second Page of Pagination in All Indices

**Description:**
In the **All Indices** table, **pagination** shows **6 pages**, but when navigating to the **second page**, a **"No Result"** message appears. This issue prevents users from viewing the expected data on the second page and causes confusion as to why there are no results.

[https://jam.dev/c/d893a2c2-1a42-4606-bb68-f0b9bd6f9798](https://jam.dev/c/d893a2c2-1a42-4606-bb68-f0b9bd6f9798)

## **Title2:** Arrow in Sell Graph in Investor Index is Positioned Incorrectly – Does Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
In the **Investor Index**, the **arrow** in the **Sell graph** is positioned incorrectly and is **below the page**, which causes it to be partially or completely out of view. This misalignment does not match the **Figma design** and affects the layout of the graph.

[https://jam.dev/c/c293798f-5b64-4fdf-ab0c-35e3d26c101f](https://jam.dev/c/c293798f-5b64-4fdf-ab0c-35e3d26c101f)

## **Title3:** Tooltip in Indices Page on Mobile View Opens and Closes Automatically

**Description:**
On the **mobile view** of the **Indices page**, when clicking on the **tooltips**, they open and close automatically, which is unintended behavior. This issue affects the usability of the tooltips, making it difficult for users to view the information provided in the tooltip.

[https://jam.dev/c/98ddb545-9c85-4ac0-8024-d4187681758f](https://jam.dev/c/98ddb545-9c85-4ac0-8024-d4187681758f)

data.title: Review PRs
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Review Pull Requests

**Description:**  
Assign Suleman Tariq to review all pending pull requests to ensure code quality and compliance with project standards before merging.

**Business Rationale:**  
Timely and thorough PR reviews are crucial for maintaining high code quality, minimizing bugs, and ensuring the project stays on schedule. Effective reviews facilitate collaboration and uphold project standards, leading to a more reliable and maintainable codebase.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All pending pull requests are reviewed by Suleman Tariq within 24 hours of submission.
* Each PR receives clear feedback or approval.
* Approved PRs are merged promptly.
* Any required changes are communicated clearly to the submitters.
* Documentation of all review actions is maintained for accountability.

Implement the integration of the Zapper API to fetch and display asset information for embedded wallets within the platform.

Providing real-time asset data enhances user experience and engagement by allowing users to monitor their holdings seamlessly, thereby increasing platform value and user retention.

* Successful connection to the Zapper API without errors.
* Accurate retrieval of asset information for all embedded wallets.
* Asset data is correctly displayed in the user interface.
* Proper error handling for API failures and data inconsistencies.
* All related unit and integration tests are passed.

data.title: Extract emails of customers using FREEUSER coupon in last 3 years
data.description:
@ben said:

> @suleman Following up from our call.
> Could you pls spool out the emails of all customers who used `FREEUSER` coupon code within the last 3 years.
> We need to cancel their plans or charge their cards immediately.
>
> @sam @ian Is 3 years fine, or everyone post-2019 (5 years)

comments.body:
these are the users who are using `FREEUSERS` coupon with their subscriptions and were created in last 3 years (as these are not much @zaiying can go through and update their plans appropriately on stripe instead of canceling all the plans or charging them):

[free_subscriptions.csv](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/23db0bea-0a5b-414d-9dc0-044427673106/9a9b333d-d4ac-4524-a78b-1e5d05068273)

I have found one more issue though, we have free tier prices for subscriptions as well which we use to give internal staff access to `ADVANCED`, `PREMIUM` or `VIP` plan for free without using any kind of coupon. Even though these prices are hidden from users and are not shown to them but maybe in the past we did and I see many external users also using these prices so basically they're getting paid subscriptions for free without using any coupons as these prices are already free. I am listing the prices below so @zaiying can take a look and we decide what to do with these external users using these prices:

Free Advanced: [https://dashboard.stripe.com/subscriptions?price=price_1NvNHhH2HittHxxTbJP0OtyN](https://dashboard.stripe.com/subscriptions?price=price_1NvNHhH2HittHxxTbJP0OtyN)

data.title: Update Queries to Filter out USDC
data.description:
The queries in the section `Last Index Transactions (Data Table)` for all indices (Trader, Investor and Sector) need to be updated.

Essentially, this one line has been added :

```
AND t.TOKEN_ID != 3396
```

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Exclude USDC from Last Index Transactions Queries

**Description:**

**Description:**  
Modify the queries in the `Last Index Transactions (Data Table)` section for all indices (Trader, Investor, and Sector) by adding the condition `AND t.TOKEN_ID != 3396` to exclude USDC transactions.

**Business Rationale:**  
Removing USDC transactions ensures that the data presented in the index transaction tables reflects only the relevant tokens, improving data clarity and accuracy for users analyzing Trader, Investor, and Sector indices.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All relevant queries in the `Last Index Transactions (Data Table)` for Trader, Investor, and Sector indices include the condition `AND t.TOKEN_ID != 3396`.
* USDC transactions are no longer displayed in any of the updated data tables.
* Successful verification through testing that the exclusion logic is correctly applied across all specified indices.
