data.title: [Group] - AI Indices Platform Testing 11
data.description:
## **Title1:** Incorrect Wallet Address Displayed in Buy Index Popup and Cannot Signout 

**Description:**
In the **Buy Index** popup, the **wallet address** is displayed even when the wallet is not actually connected. Additionally, there **sign out not working** from the displayed wallet address, causing confusion for users and preventing them from disconnecting or switching their wallets.

[https://jam.dev/c/7eaeafc9-1768-4859-81af-fc7c2aad7941](https://jam.dev/c/7eaeafc9-1768-4859-81af-fc7c2aad7941)

## **Title2:** Wallet Information Displayed in Wrong Location – Should Be Next to Profile Name

**Description:**
The **wallet information** is currently displayed in the wrong location on the page. According to the **Figma design**, the wallet information should appear next to the **profile name**. However, it is currently displayed in a different position, which causes a misalignment with the design and disrupts the user experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/e60a2cc8-812e-4632-856d-166a5ab0ffaa](https://jam.dev/c/e60a2cc8-812e-4632-856d-166a5ab0ffaa)

## **Title3:** Missing Percentage Sign in "Tokens in This Index" List

**Description:**
In the **"Tokens in This Index"** list, The percentage sign should be included to ensure clarity and consistency in data representation.

[https://jam.dev/c/91de3fb7-3b6f-490a-beb1-7e3e149b99d4](https://jam.dev/c/91de3fb7-3b6f-490a-beb1-7e3e149b99d4)

## **Title4:** Mismatch Between Tokens Listed in "Tokens in This Index" and "Invest" Sections

**Description:**
The tokens listed in the **"Tokens in This Index"** section do not match the tokens listed in the **"Invest"** section. This discrepancy causes confusion and affects the accuracy of the data being displayed to users, leading to an inconsistent user experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/70f346ba-b0dc-4c1a-bd7d-d1b135fcef4d](https://jam.dev/c/70f346ba-b0dc-4c1a-bd7d-d1b135fcef4d)

## **Title5:** "Create Embedded Wallet" Option Missing from the Page

**Description:**
The **"Create Embedded Wallet"** option is currently missing from the page. This feature should be available for users to create and manage embedded wallets, but it is not visible or accessible on the page as expected.

[https://jam.dev/c/4e40a7a2-c5ef-4bdc-ae19-7ce242a949f4](https://jam.dev/c/4e40a7a2-c5ef-4bdc-ae19-7ce242a949f4)

## **Title6:** Error After "Processing" in Buy Index

**Description:**
When attempting to use the **Buy Index** feature, the process shows **"Processing"** but ends up displaying an error for Metamask. This issue prevents users from completing the buying process and negatively impacts the overall functionality.

[https://jam.dev/c/4c8ec501-de2d-418c-93af-ea51f180bbaf](https://jam.dev/c/4c8ec501-de2d-418c-93af-ea51f180bbaf)

## **Title7:** "Enter Amount" Text Not Fully Displayed on Mobile Version

**Description:**
In the **mobile version** of the application, the **"Enter Amount"** text is not fully displayed. This issue causes the label to be truncated or cut off, negatively affecting the user interface and potentially causing confusion for users.

[https://jam.dev/c/9c60af10-6598-4136-b5f4-e41257ba39cf](https://jam.dev/c/9c60af10-6598-4136-b5f4-e41257ba39cf)

## **Title8:** Incorrect Values Displayed in Both Embedded Wallets

**Description:**
The values displayed in both **embedded wallets** are incorrect. Currently, both wallets show **$150** and **1,173**, which does not reflect the actual balance or the correct data for each wallet. This issue leads to confusion and inaccurate information being presented to users.

[https://jam.dev/c/0bbabf9f-73d7-48f9-be8b-0db60b28976c](https://jam.dev/c/0bbabf9f-73d7-48f9-be8b-0db60b28976c)

## **Title9:** Wallet Address Not Fully Displayed in "Failed to Buy Index" Error Message

**Description:**
In the **"Failed to Buy Index"** error message, the **wallet address** is not fully displayed. This causes confusion, as users are unable to see the complete wallet address in case of an error, making it difficult to troubleshoot or understand where the issue occurred.

[https://jam.dev/c/c61e5be4-a295-4795-a523-f0aafca83017](https://jam.dev/c/c61e5be4-a295-4795-a523-f0aafca83017)

## **Title10:** "NoneType Object" Error When Attempting to Buy Index with Solana

**Description:**
When attempting to **Buy Index** using **Solana**, a **"NoneType object"** error is encountered. This error prevents the transaction from being processed and affects the functionality for users trying to make purchases with Solana.

[https://jam.dev/c/11910bde-f7da-4b52-9c5a-70600ba4a6f4](https://jam.dev/c/11910bde-f7da-4b52-9c5a-70600ba4a6f4)

## **Title11:** Font Issue in "Generate Token Metrics Wallet" Text – Font Should Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The font used for the **"Generate Token Metrics Wallet"** text is different from what is specified in the **Figma design**. Additionally, the text should not bold as required. 

[https://jam.dev/c/62a09f4d-62f6-4fb3-84f6-a3ae17f83511](https://jam.dev/c/62a09f4d-62f6-4fb3-84f6-a3ae17f83511)

## **Title12:** Missing QR Code in Token Metrics Wallet Details Popup

**Description:**
The **QR code** for the **wallet** is missing in the **Token Metrics wallet details popup**.

[https://jam.dev/c/8bf09303-3912-4133-a510-2f89a93a71eb](https://jam.dev/c/8bf09303-3912-4133-a510-2f89a93a71eb)

## **Title13:** Page Refreshes When "Cancel Fund Wallet" in Wallet Details Popup

**Description:**
When the **"Fund Wallet"** action is canceled in the **Wallet Details popup**, the page unexpectedly refreshes. This behavior is unintended and disrupts the user experience, causing the user to lose their current context or data. [https://jam.dev/c/1ad7b97d-623d-4f2a-b04a-d5e7d237163f](https://jam.dev/c/1ad7b97d-623d-4f2a-b04a-d5e7d237163f)

## **Title14:** Text in Popups Displayed as Bold Instead of Figma Design Specifications

**Description:**
In the **"Enable Delegated Actions"** popup, and across all other popups, the text is displayed in **bold**. However, according to the **Figma design**, the text should not be bold. This misalignment between the design and implementation needs to be corrected to match the intended visual style.

[https://jam.dev/c/9e396ed6-a63c-4170-86ae-8e1516365008](https://jam.dev/c/9e396ed6-a63c-4170-86ae-8e1516365008)

## **Title15:** Incorrect Error Message "Error Enabling Action, Please Try Again Later" in "Enable Delegated Actions" Popup

**Description:**
When clicking **"Not Now"** in the **"Enable Delegated Actions"** popup, an error message appears saying **"Error enabling action, Please try again later"**. This error message may not be appropriate in this case, as the action is intentionally being postponed by the user, and it may confuse the user into thinking an error has occurred. [https://jam.dev/c/99cae20b-8c69-487a-8304-e70ffdf4532a](https://jam.dev/c/99cae20b-8c69-487a-8304-e70ffdf4532a) . Please verify @ben 

## **Title16:** "You Successfully Delegated Action" Popup Design and Text Do Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The **"You Successfully Delegated Action"** popup's design and text do not match the **Figma design**. The current implementation has discrepancies in both layout and content, causing a mismatch with the intended visual style and message.

Actual: [https://jam.dev/c/b8581a93-663a-4f68-a029-ef44082785ba](https://jam.dev/c/b8581a93-663a-4f68-a029-ef44082785ba)

Expected: [https://jam.dev/c/d03c756c-1b9d-4075-80f6-f1596d702729](https://jam.dev/c/d03c756c-1b9d-4075-80f6-f1596d702729)

## **Title17:** "Invest" Section Wallet and Token Selection Causes Flickering

**Description:**
In the **"Invest"** section, when selecting a **wallet** or **token**, the interface **flickers** or **shakes** instead of remaining stable. This movement disrupts the user experience and affects the usability of the section, causing confusion for users.

[https://jam.dev/c/1ee9b770-aa58-4d66-b945-3a98431328cf](https://jam.dev/c/1ee9b770-aa58-4d66-b945-3a98431328cf)

## **Title18:** "Unexpected DOCTYPE" Error When Attempting to Buy Index with USDC

**Description:**
When attempting to **Buy Index** with **USDC**, an **"Unexpected DOCTYPE"** error is encountered. This prevents the transaction from being completed, and users are unable to proceed with purchasing the index using **USDC**.

[https://jam.dev/c/37f29e52-92cb-46ac-81ab-ac2ad715c9d2](https://jam.dev/c/37f29e52-92cb-46ac-81ab-ac2ad715c9d2)

data.title: Burn To Stake Migration to Staging Environment (Opensea API Fix on Staging Migration)
data.description:
* OpenSea API FIX on staging to mimic real astrobot NFT from opensea on frontend
* Made sure the OpenSea URL fetches from ETH Mainnet no matter the env application is in , to mimic astrobot nft from opensea on staging as well

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Fix OpenSea API Integration for Burn to Stake Migration in Staging Environment

**Description:**  
Update the OpenSea API on the staging environment to fetch NFT data from the Ethereum Mainnet consistently, ensuring that the frontend mirrors real Astrobot NFTs from OpenSea as it does in production.

**Business Rationale:**  
Aligning the staging environment with production by using the Ethereum Mainnet for OpenSea API calls ensures accurate testing and validation of the Burn to Stake migration. This consistency helps identify and resolve issues early, improving the reliability and quality of the deployment.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The OpenSea API on staging consistently fetches NFT data from the Ethereum Mainnet, regardless of the application’s environment setting.
* The frontend displays Astrobot NFTs on staging exactly as they appear in the production environment.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Fix OpenSea API Integration for Burn to Stake Migration in Staging Environment

**Description:**  
Update the OpenSea API on the staging environment to fetch NFT data from the Ethereum Mainnet consistently, ensuring that the frontend mirrors real Astrobot NFTs from OpenSea as it does in production.

**Business Rationale:**  
Aligning the staging environment with production by using the Ethereum Mainnet for OpenSea API calls ensures accurate testing and validation of the Burn to Stake migration. This consistency helps identify and resolve issues early, improving the reliability and quality of the deployment.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The OpenSea API on staging consistently fetches NFT data from the Ethereum Mainnet, regardless of the application’s environment setting.
* The frontend displays Astrobot NFTs on staging exactly as they appear in the production environment.
* Successful completion of Burn to Stake migration without errors related to NFT data fetching.
* All relevant tests pass, confirming correct integration and data retrieval from the Ethereum Mainnet.

data.title: Generate a Bypass Key for Chantal’s Data API Access
data.description:
**Description:**
As per the discussion with Sam , we need to generate a bypass key for Chantal to allow up to **1 million requests per month**. While this is not the best practice, Chantal is a premium customer with a significant YouTube following and has provided substantial value through reviews and customer interviews.

![Screenshot 2025-03-17 at 9.40.40 PM.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a29a6ee1-d4f3-4a08-aac5-20c43e8e05ec/acaab292-bdb8-4bff-943b-72a11269a026)

This is a temporary solution, and we should **disable the bypass once the new Data API flow with staking and TMAI payments is implemented**.

**Action Items:**

* Generate a bypass key for Chantal with a 1M monthly request limit.
* Share the key with Sam once implemented.
* Track and plan for disabling this once the new payment model is live.

comments.body:
### **Action Item Taken:**

* Generated a bypass key for Chantal 
* Implemented the necessary changes to allow access.
* Shared the key with Sam as requested.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/efce97c7-338a-41cc-a623-e9294bfa5810](https://jam.dev/c/efce97c7-338a-41cc-a623-e9294bfa5810)

@sam **, note!** This is a temporary exception and will be disabled once the Data API integrates with staking and TMAI payments. Also, the dashboard statistics **will not work as expected** with this key since we are bypassing the auth limit logic, so please update her on that as well.

Sent you the key in DM
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6715). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: [Group] - Sentient Indices Platform Testing 10
data.description:
## **Title1:** "Artificial Intelligence" Text in Top Trending Indices Page Should Be Responsive

**Description:**
On the **Top Trending Indices** page, the text **"Artificial Intelligence"** is currently displayed as two lines and centered. This should be made **responsive**, so that when the screen size becomes too small, the text should change to simply **"AI"** to maintain layout consistency and improve the user experience on smaller screens.

[https://jam.dev/c/2167e1c3-7ed0-46f3-88d7-8269ca12d128](https://jam.dev/c/2167e1c3-7ed0-46f3-88d7-8269ca12d128)

## **Title2:** Missing Dollar Sign in Top Trending Indices 

**Description:**
In the **Top Trending Indices** section, the values displayed for the indices are missing the  **$** 

[https://jam.dev/c/a80762d6-96ef-40c8-8600-2d6e8034dcab](https://jam.dev/c/a80762d6-96ef-40c8-8600-2d6e8034dcab)

## **Title3:** Set 1Y as Default Timeframe for Indices Price History Chart

**Description:**
The **1W timeframe** in the **Indices Price History** chart appears too flat and does not provide a clear visual representation of price changes. To improve the chart's functionality, it should default to **1Y** as the standard timeframe.

[https://jam.dev/c/f41c3901-ce96-4ef2-815f-2165b7e16f15](https://jam.dev/c/f41c3901-ce96-4ef2-815f-2165b7e16f15)

## **Title4:** Treemap View Sizes Should Reflect Percentages 

**Description:**
In the **Treemap View**, the size of the elements should correspond to their **percentage values**, but currently, the size does not change according to the percentages. This leads to incorrect visual representation, where the relative size of the items does not reflect their proportionate value.

[https://jam.dev/c/14556030-7c69-49f3-9a26-54a440c7dcbf](https://jam.dev/c/14556030-7c69-49f3-9a26-54a440c7dcbf)

## **Title5:** Incorrect Text Display – Should Be "1 Token" Instead of "1 Tokens"

**Description:**
In the relevant section, where the number of tokens is displayed, the text reads **"1 Tokens"** instead of the correct form, **"1 Token"**. This causes a grammatical error and should be corrected to improve clarity and consistency.

[https://jam.dev/c/f7c2ba03-eb29-44ae-a1c0-686966fbd531](https://jam.dev/c/f7c2ba03-eb29-44ae-a1c0-686966fbd531)

## **Title6:** "Buy" Button in Treemap View Should Match the Design in Ratings Page

**Description:**
The **"Buy" button** in the **Treemap View** does not match the design of the **"Buy" button** in the **Ratings Page and Figma**. To ensure visual consistency across the platform, the design and styling of the **"Buy" button** in the Treemap View should be updated to match the one in the Ratings Page.

## **Title7:** Pagination in Table View Should Use Rounded Selection Instead of Square

**Description:**
In the **Table View**, the pagination is currently displayed with **square** selection for page numbers,

[https://jam.dev/c/8e7e2ab5-f25f-4f6e-bc70-e12f0d98ba83](https://jam.dev/c/8e7e2ab5-f25f-4f6e-bc70-e12f0d98ba83)

## **Title8:** Table Headings (e.g. Index Holdings, Last Index Transactions) Should Be White, Not Gray

**Description:**
In all tables, the headings for sections like **Index Holdings**, **Last Index Transactions**, and others are currently displayed in **gray**, whereas they should be displayed in **white** to match the design specifications and improve visual clarity.

[https://jam.dev/c/1c2d0465-084b-4283-b132-4a82c1446001](https://jam.dev/c/1c2d0465-084b-4283-b132-4a82c1446001)

## **Title9:** "1H" Should Be Replaced with "30D" in All Indices Table

**Description:**
In the **All Indices** table, the **"1H"** label should be replaced with **"30D"**,

![Screenshot 2025-03-17 at 16.07.44.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/7941913c-1bda-4a77-b1a6-58f852b7e1c6/5bfb7ea3-74db-4ff5-ad6e-a9bd8f5dc7ae)

## **Title10:** Clicking on "Index Transaction" Tab Redirects to "Trader Index Holdings"

**Description:**
When clicking on the **"Index Transaction"** tab, users are being redirected to the **"Trader Index Holdings"** page. This navigation issue causes confusion and prevents users from accessing the intended content.

[https://jam.dev/c/4d1db7c1-a157-4879-bf97-b001c8f2188a](https://jam.dev/c/4d1db7c1-a157-4879-bf97-b001c8f2188a)

**Title11:** Implementation of Trader Grade in Table View of Index Holdings

**Description:**
The **Trader Grade** in the **Table View** of **Index Holdings** is implemented incorrectly. It does not match the design or functionality as it is implemented on the **Ratings page**. Specifically, the **24H percentage change** is not displayed beside the **grade value**, which causes inconsistency between the pages.

data.title: Create Helm Chart For Deployment
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Create Helm Chart for Deploying Research Agent to Digital Ocean

**Description:**
Develop a Helm chart to automate and standardize the deployment of the Research Agent application on Digital Ocean. This will streamline the deployment process, ensure consistency across environments, and facilitate easier updates and scaling.

**Business Rationale:**
Implementing a Helm chart for deployment reduces manual efforts, minimizes deployment errors, and accelerates the release cycle. By standardizing deployments to Digital Ocean, we enhance operational efficiency and support the scalability needs of the Research Agent, ultimately leading to improved reliability and faster time-to-market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A Helm chart is created and organized in the project's repository.
* The Helm chart successfully deploys the Research Agent to a Digital Ocean environment without errors.
* Configuration parameters are customizable and well-documented.
* Comprehensive documentation is provided, detailing usage instructions and deployment steps.
* Deployment via the Helm chart is tested and validated in both staging and production environments.

**Description:**
Develop a Helm chart to automate and standardize the deployment of the Research Agent application on Digital Ocean. This will streamline the deployment process, ensure consistency across environments, and facilitate easier updates and scaling.

**Business Rationale:**
Implementing a Helm chart for deployment reduces manual efforts, minimizes deployment errors, and accelerates the release cycle. By standardizing deployments to Digital Ocean, we enhance operational efficiency and support the scalability needs of the Research Agent, ultimately leading to improved reliability and faster time-to-market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A Helm chart is created and organized in the project's repository.
* The Helm chart successfully deploys the Research Agent to a Digital Ocean environment without errors.
* Configuration parameters are customizable and well-documented.
* Comprehensive documentation is provided, detailing usage instructions and deployment steps.
* Deployment via the Helm chart is tested and validated in both staging and production environments.

data.title: Validate Data platform service
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Validate Data Cluster Migration for Data Platform Service

**Description:**
Confirm the successful migration of the data cluster, including real-time processing, real-time WebSocket functionalities, and the overall data platform service. This involves testing system performance, ensuring data integrity, and verifying uninterrupted service operations post-migration.

**Business Rationale:**
Migrating the data cluster is essential to enhance system scalability, performance, and reliability. Validating the migration ensures that real-time data processing and WebSocket communications remain uninterrupted, thereby maintaining high service quality and user satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Migration is completed without data loss or corruption.
* Real-time processing and WebSocket services function correctly after migration.
* System performance meets or exceeds pre-migration benchmarks.
* No critical downtime or service disruptions occur during the migration process.
* All validation tests are passed and documented.
* Stakeholder approval is obtained upon successful validation.

data.title: Expand the k6 test coverage to include additional API endpoints and user scenarios
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Expand k6 Test Coverage to Include Additional API Endpoints and User Scenarios

**Description:**
Enhance the existing k6 test suite by incorporating additional API endpoints and diverse user scenarios to ensure comprehensive performance and reliability testing.

**Business Rationale:**
Increasing test coverage will help identify potential performance bottlenecks and ensure the system can handle various user interactions. This will improve overall user experience, reduce the risk of service disruptions, and maintain the platform’s reliability as it scales.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All prioritized additional API endpoints are identified and included in the k6 test suite.
* At least five new user scenarios, including both typical and edge-case interactions, are developed and integrated.
* Achieve a minimum of 90% test coverage for the updated API endpoints.
* All new tests execute successfully without errors in the CI/CD pipeline.
* Updated documentation reflects the expanded test coverage and new scenarios.

data.title: Enhance the Grafana dashboards to include security metrics from Trivy scans
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enhance Grafana Dashboards with Security Metrics from Trivy Scans

**Description:**  
Integrate security metrics from Trivy scans into existing Grafana dashboards to provide real-time visibility into application vulnerabilities. This enhancement will allow teams to monitor security alongside performance metrics, facilitating timely identification and mitigation of potential threats.

**Business Rationale:**  
Incorporating Trivy scan results into Grafana enables proactive vulnerability management, improving the overall security posture of our applications. Enhanced visibility into security data helps reduce risks, ensures compliance, and supports the organization’s commitment to maintaining robust and secure systems.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Trivy scan data is successfully imported and visualized in Grafana dashboards.
2. Key security metrics displayed include total vulnerabilities, severity levels, and affected components.
3. Dashboards update automatically based on the Trivy scan schedule.
4. Visualizations are clear, intuitive, and accessible to relevant team members.
5. Appropriate access controls are in place to secure sensitive security data.
6. Documentation is provided detailing the integration process and dashboard usage.

comments.body: I'll setup a webhook so it notifies via slack 👌
@divine this is great. How does it notify the team of issues? Via Github PR or Slack?

**Grafana dashboard** displaying security vulnerability metrics from **Trivy** across all repositories [here](http://34.42.253.145/d/trivy-security-multi/trivy-security-dashboard-multiple-repositories?orgId=1&from=2025-03-16T21:56:30.019Z&to=2025-03-24T21:56:30.019Z&timezone=browser&var-prometheusDS=eeghnmytvkiyob&var-repository=$\__all&refresh=5m)

comments.body:
Step 2: Real-time Ingestion Pod in CrashLoopBackOff

Application was trying to connect to Kafka in a non-existent kafka-dev namespace

* Created kafka-dev namespace and DNS services to redirect to the actual Kafka in the 'kafka' namespace

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/bcaf073d-0c87-41c8-8cc9-9178fe5afdf4/97a3aded-a9a5-4d49-9608-0f7352579edf)

All three services are running successfully with 1/1 readiness

* Added the following files to the Git repository: 
  * `kafka-dev.yaml`: Creates the kafka-dev namespace and services for DNS redirection
  * `kafka-config.yaml`: ConfigMap with Kafka connection properties


* Committed changes and synced with ArgoCD

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/2dabc69f-3a9c-480e-8497-b4c8020fd84f/23b6018a-450e-4371-95ef-cd467f7e8f56)

Application in Healthy state and Sync status is Synced

Step1: Identified and fixed the root cause
Kafka Controller Pod in CrashLoopBackOff due to Disk space exhaustion

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/b5d7b7d3-a07a-465c-b708-cc8175b5998a/f75d3051-763a-4d33-a90b-d3d13ba6a6b7)

data.title: Burn To Stake Auto Reconnect to Base Sepolia / ETH Mainnet on "/astrobot-burn-nft" url fix
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Auto Reconnect to Sepolia/ETH Mainnet for "Burn to Stake" on "/astrobot-burn-nft" URL

**Description:**
Implement an automatic reconnection feature for the "Burn to Stake" functionality when accessed via the "/astrobot-burn-nft" URL. This ensures that the application seamlessly reconnects to the appropriate blockchain network (Sepolia testnet or Ethereum Mainnet) without requiring user intervention, enhancing the overall user experience.

**Business Rationale:**
Streamlining the connection process for users interacting with the "Burn to Stake" feature reduces friction and potential errors, leading to increased user satisfaction and engagement. Reliable automatic reconnections support the platform’s reputation for stability and user-friendly operations, ultimately contributing to higher retention and trust.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Automatic Connection:** Upon accessing the "/astrobot-burn-nft" URL, the "Burn to Stake" feature automatically connects to the designated blockchain network (Sepolia or ETH Mainnet) based on configuration.
2. **Network Detection:** The system correctly identifies and connects to the appropriate network without manual selection by the user.
3. **Error Handling:** If the auto-reconnection fails, a clear and informative error message is displayed to the user.
4. **Testing:** Automated tests are in place to verify that the auto-reconnect functionality operates correctly for both Sepolia and ETH Mainnet environments.
5. **Logging:** Connection attempts and their outcomes are logged for monitoring and troubleshooting purposes.

comments.body:
Implementation Actions Taken :

* The code adapts to the network when switched to "/astrobot-burn-to-stake". (Done it was , rechecked the file for alertComponent , tested it on both local env and staging env)
  
  Reference JAM : [https://jam.dev/c/70c2eb09-b58f-46c8-84c2-6ba7c52027a1](https://jam.dev/c/70c2eb09-b58f-46c8-84c2-6ba7c52027a1)
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6697). All replies are displayed in both locations.

issues.full_context: Title: Review PRs

data.title: Create cron job workflow to Close/delete stale - open PRS on all Repos (stale PRs more than 14 days)
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Automate Closure of Stale Pull Requests via Cron Job

**Description:** Implement a scheduled cron job that automatically closes or deletes pull requests (PRs) across all repositories if they remain open and inactive for more than 14 days.

**Business Rationale:** Regularly cleaning up stale PRs helps maintain repository organization, reduces clutter for developers, and ensures focus on active and relevant contributions, thereby enhancing overall team productivity and project quality.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A cron job is configured to run daily across all repositories.
* PRs inactive for over 14 days are identified accurately.
* Identified stale PRs are automatically closed or deleted based on predefined settings.
* Notifications are sent to PR authors before any automated action is taken.
* Action logs are maintained for auditing and review purposes.
* The workflow is tested and validated in a staging environment prior to deployment.

comments.body:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/731f1ba8-e192-4fdc-9176-76ed61aec9dd/8f2dfcb3-9b90-4a4f-9916-247949bf7993)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/28eb5039-1090-4a0f-afca-47fbe75efa52/3327e736-0311-43a7-84df-e3b46a422c36)

**For each PR**, the workflow: 

* Checked the last update date
* Confirmed none had the stale label yet
* Verified they were all inactive beyond your 14-day threshold
* Applied the "stale" label to all three PRs
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Create a large node pool for vertical scaling of applications
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Create a Large Node Pool for Vertical Scaling of Applications

**Description:**
Establish a comprehensive node pool to support the vertical scaling of our applications, ensuring the infrastructure can efficiently handle increased resource demands.

**Business Rationale:**
As application usage grows, the ability to vertically scale is essential for maintaining performance and reliability. A larger node pool will enable seamless scaling, improve user experience, and support future growth without infrastructure constraints.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A node pool is created with \[specific number\] nodes, each configured with \[specific CPU and memory specifications\].
* The new node pool integrates seamlessly with the current infrastructure and orchestration tools.
* Applications can scale vertically using the new node pool without downtime or performance issues.
* Performance tests demonstrate that the scaled applications meet or exceed predefined benchmarks.
* Documentation is updated to include the configuration and usage guidelines of the new node pool.

Node Pool Name: node-pool-mem-intensive-large, tm-airflow-nodepool-large

total number of nodes in the cluster is **8**

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Cron Jobs Migration (Remaining)

**Description:**  
Complete the remaining tasks for migrating cron jobs that are currently blocked by pending migrations. This involves updating the application codebase built with Next.js and Prisma to ensure all cron jobs function correctly post-migration.

**Business Rationale:**  
Addressing this technical debt will enhance system reliability, improve maintainability, and ensure that scheduled tasks operate seamlessly within the updated infrastructure. Completing the migration supports overall application performance and reduces future technical complexities.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All pending cron jobs are successfully migrated to the new system.
* Application code updates in Next.js and Prisma are fully implemented and tested.
* No blocking issues remain related to cron job functionality.
* Successful execution of all migrated cron jobs in the production environment.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the new cron job configurations.

data.title: [Group] - Burn-to-Stake Platform Testing
data.description:
## **Title1:** "Your Astrobot NFTs" Section Not Aligned with Figma Design – Missing Connect Wallet Button

**Description:**
The **"Your Astrobot NFTs"** section does not match the **Figma design**. Specifically, the **"Connect Wallet"** button is missing in this section, which should be present according to the design. This causes a discrepancy between the actual implementation and the design specifications.

Actual Result: [https://jam.dev/c/09d6fd0d-50bf-4e05-9839-f12cd0826d49](https://jam.dev/c/09d6fd0d-50bf-4e05-9839-f12cd0826d49)

Expected Result: [https://jam.dev/c/46ac2954-9bb9-4310-9e9f-595c9632871b](https://jam.dev/c/46ac2954-9bb9-4310-9e9f-595c9632871b)

## **Title2:** "What Are Benefits" Text Should Be "Staking Benefits" as per Figma Design

**Description:**
The text **"What Are Benefits"** in the relevant section should be updated to **"Staking Benefits"**, as per the **Figma design**. [https://jam.dev/c/e2e99bf2-ea49-4be9-9227-b7b4a9cc76a0](https://jam.dev/c/e2e99bf2-ea49-4be9-9227-b7b4a9cc76a0)

## **Title3:** "Failed to Approve NFT for Bridging" Stuck in "Transaction Complete" Status

**Description:**
When the **"Failed to Approve NFT for Bridging"** transaction is not approved, it remains stuck in the **"Transaction Complete"** status. This causes confusion for users, as the transaction is marked as complete despite not being successfully processed.

[https://jam.dev/c/59afc819-32c0-401b-951f-a280f8059fe9](https://jam.dev/c/59afc819-32c0-401b-951f-a280f8059fe9)

## **Title4:** Missing Search Field for Astrobot NFTs as per Figma Design

**Description:**
The **search field** for **Astrobot NFTs** is missing from the page. According to the **Figma design**, there should be a **search field** that allows users to search for specific NFTs. The absence of this feature causes a discrepancy between the actual implementation and the design.

[https://jam.dev/c/84eff263-04d6-4720-9410-0dcf4ce48379](https://jam.dev/c/84eff263-04d6-4720-9410-0dcf4ce48379)

## **Title5:** "Burn & Stake" Button Placement Does Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The **"Burn & Stake"** button is not placed in the correct position as specified in the **Figma design**. The current placement of the button causes a mismatch with the intended layout, affecting the consistency of the user interface.

[https://jam.dev/c/16c52def-c521-447f-a628-2694ac164911](https://jam.dev/c/16c52def-c521-447f-a628-2694ac164911)

## **Title6:** Misalignment of "Base," "Execution," and "Total Fee" Values

**Description:**
The **"Base"**, **"Execution"**, and **"Total Fee"** values are not aligned properly on the page, causing visual inconsistency and affecting the overall layout.

data.title: [Staging-Automation] 500 Error on "My Portfolio" and "Trading History" Pages in Trading Agent
data.description:
**Description:**
The **"My Portfolio"** and **"Trading History"** pages in the **Trading Agent** section are returning a **500 error**. This prevents users from accessing these pages and viewing their portfolio or trading history, ts.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the **Trading Agent** section.
2. Try to access the **"My Portfolio"** page.
3. Observe that the page returns a **500 error**.
4. Try accessing the **"Trading History"** page and observe the same **500 error**.

[https://jam.dev/c/3abd9b35-6bb5-441e-9e3f-a4c2c2a07f33](https://jam.dev/c/3abd9b35-6bb5-441e-9e3f-a4c2c2a07f33)

data.title: Validate Data Cluster Migration (Real time processing, Real time websocket, Data platform service)
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue: Validate Data Cluster Migration (Real-Time Processing, Real-Time WebSocket, Data Platform Service)**

**Description:**  
Verify the successful migration of the data cluster supporting real-time processing, real-time WebSocket communications, and the data platform service. This includes ensuring data integrity, system performance, and uninterrupted functionality after the migration.

**Business Rationale:**  
Migrating the data cluster is crucial to enhance scalability, improve system performance, and ensure the reliability of real-time services. This will support business growth, improve user experience, and maintain competitive advantage.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All data is accurately migrated with no loss or corruption.
* Real-time processing performance meets or exceeds current benchmarks.
* Real-time WebSocket connections remain stable and responsive under load.
* Data platform services operate seamlessly without downtime.
* Comprehensive testing (regression and performance) is completed successfully with no critical issues.

**Owner:** Peterson Nwoko

* All data is accurately migrated with no loss or corruption.
* Real-time processing performance meets or exceeds current benchmarks.
* Real-time WebSocket connections remain stable and responsive under load.
* Data platform services operate seamlessly without downtime.
* Comprehensive testing (regression and performance) is completed successfully with no critical issues.

**Owner:** Peterson Nwoko

data.title: Annotation and Feedback Routine for Chatbot Responses - Cycle 40
data.description:
**Description:** To improve the chatbot's accuracy and usefulness, allocate an hour each week for reviewing and annotating its responses. This involves providing constructive feedback on chatbot answers, identifying areas for improvement, and submitting annotated examples via **LangSmith**

for an overview on giving feedback to the chatbot answers to make them more useful (annotating). It will really help with our fine tuning

### **Steps to Implement:**

1. **Weekly Feedback Routine:**
   * Schedule a dedicated hour each week for annotation and feedback.l).

* Evaluate the answers for:
  * Accuracy
  * Clarity
  * Relevance
  * Completeness
* Annotate suggestions or corrections for improvements directly in LangSmith.

1. **Annotating Responses:**
   * Highlight areas where the response is incorrect, vague, or incomplete.
   * Mark high-quality responses as examples of best practices.
   * Example: [https://jam.dev/c/a410f1f8-42fd-46c0-a7c8-5a0420eba9a6](https://jam.dev/c/a410f1f8-42fd-46c0-a7c8-5a0420eba9a6)

data.title: AI Indices Pages
data.description:
Migrate all the queries from snowflake to postgres across all services in ai indices.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Migrate AI Indices Queries from Snowflake to PostgreSQL

**Description:** Transition all database queries within the AI Indices services from Snowflake to PostgreSQL to streamline data management and reduce system dependencies.

**Business Rationale:** Moving to PostgreSQL will enhance application performance, lower operational costs, and simplify the technology stack, resulting in improved scalability and easier maintenance for AI Indices.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All Snowflake queries are successfully migrated to PostgreSQL across all AI Indices services.
* Application code is updated using Next.js and Prisma without introducing functional regressions.
* Comprehensive testing verifies data integrity and meets performance benchmarks post-migration.
* Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the new PostgreSQL implementation.

parent.title: Application Code Updates (Next.js + Prisma)

comments.body:
### Action Items Taken

* Migrated all the endpoints related to AI Indices.
* Migrated all queries for Index Specific, Trader, and Investor tabs.
* Encountered various data-related issues and unmigrated PostgreSQL tables, so I synced with Andrew and Jake to resolve them on time. Created appropriate tickets for the data team to address these issues.
* Tested every endpoint thoroughly.
* Tested all front-end components post-deployment.
* Identified some views that took a long time to load and created a ticket for Anki to optimize them.
* Ensured type compatibility and maintained the original business logic from Snowflake queries while migrating.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/5bdd1ce6-7a62-4aee-bc32-751779c3b8e3](https://jam.dev/c/5bdd1ce6-7a62-4aee-bc32-751779c3b8e3)

### Note:

Since AI Indices consists of three pages—Investor, Trader, and Index Specific—this migration required significant effort. Additionally, resolving data-related issues with the AI team added complexity, increasing the overall effort required.

Anki is currently optimizing the views, which I still need to integrate once ready. However, since 98% of the migration is complete, I merged the rest of the code to avoid blocking progress unnecessarily while waiting for the remaining view optimizations.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6631). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Engineering Team - Buy Index Feature
data.description:
### **Engineer Tasks**

1. **Implement “Buy Index” Transaction Flow**

* Develop backend logic to process sales and update user balances accordingly.

1. **Enforce Minimum Gas Fee Check**
   * Ensure users retain at least **$5 in native chain tokens** to cover transaction fees.
2. **Display List of Tokens in Index Before sales**
   * Fetch and display the breakdown of tokens in the index dynamically.
3. **Handle Transaction Processing and UI States**
   * Implement animations and UI states for transaction initiation, success, and failure.
4. **Implement Rebalancing Logic & Conflict Resolution**
   * Detect manual sales interference and notify users with structured error messages.
5. **Ensure Proper Error Handling for Failed Transactions**
   * Implement robust error handling to provide user-friendly feedback.

data.title: Title: Integrate Withdrawals and Deposits in Embedded Wallets for Portfolio Listing
data.description:
**Description**:
We need to enhance the embedded wallet feature to handle both withdrawals and deposits. The goal is to ensure that all transactions (in and out) are reflected in the user’s portfolio.

**Tasks**:

1. Define the data model for capturing withdrawal and deposit transactions.
2. Implement the backend logic to process and record these transactions.
3. Update the portfolio view to display new transactions in real-time or near real-time.
4. Ensure proper error handling and security best practices.
5. Conduct thorough testing to validate accurate portfolio updates.

data.title: Add Chain Symbol Next to Contract Address on Token Details Page
data.description:
#### **Description:**

To improve **clarity and user experience**, we need to display the **chain symbol** next to the contract address on the **Token Details Page**. This will help users quickly identify which blockchain the token is on, especially for multi-chain assets.

#### **Scope of Work:**

**Display chain symbol** (e.g., Ethereum, Solana, BSC, etc.) next to the **contract address**.
Support **multiple chains** if a token exists on more than one network.
Ensure consistency with **existing UI elements** (e.g., similar to how Coingecko displays it).
**Test across different screen sizes** to ensure proper alignment and visibility.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

Chain symbol is **displayed next to the contract address** for all supported tokens.
If a token exists on **multiple chains**, all chains are shown correctly.
 UI remains **clean and intuitive**, without cluttering the contract section.
No impact on **page performance or responsiveness**.

![image (5).png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/02f7a886-0a39-46d7-b2f2-109a39bda9d3/0ccbffeb-0578-4ab4-9e15-325cfe6ff17e)

![image (4).png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/66183eed-8de3-49a8-b695-80d727862345/4d880d8b-aa4e-4c7c-8502-2f28d21a32ab)

data.title: Review data api performance (Suleman)
data.description:
Review the data api performance under heavy traffic and make recommendations on how we can improve the response times and reduce failure rate.

Groomed Issue:

**Improve Data API Performance Under Heavy Traffic**

**Description:**
Assess the performance of the TMAI Trading Engine API during high traffic conditions. Identify factors affecting response times and failure rates, and provide recommendations to enhance API efficiency and reliability.

**Business Rationale:**
Optimizing API performance under heavy usage is essential to ensure a seamless trading experience for users, maintain system reliability, and support scalability. Improved response times and reduced failure rates will lead to higher user satisfaction and prevent potential revenue loss due to downtime or slow performance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Conduct performance testing of the Data API under simulated heavy traffic.
* Identify and document the primary causes of latency and failures.
* Deliver a report with actionable recommendations to improve response times and reduce failure rates.
* Recommendations are feasible and prioritized based on impact and effort.
* Stakeholders approve the proposed recommendations for implementation.

data.title: Free Trial System Allowing Continued Access After Subscription Removal
data.description:
Users who have removed their subscription are still able to access premium features beyond the free trial period. This issue may lead to unintended free usage and revenue loss.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Sign up for a free trial of any premium plan.
2. Remove the subscription before the trial ends.
3. Attempt to access premium features after the trial expiration date.

**Expected Outcome:**
Access to premium features should be revoked once the free trial is removed or expires.

**Actual Outcome:**
Users retain access to premium features even after removing their subscription.

**Severity:** High – Potential revenue impact and abuse of free trials.

**Assigned Team:** Engineering

**Investigation Areas:**

* Verify the trial expiration logic and whether access checks are correctly enforced.
* Check subscription cancellation workflows to ensure access revocation is triggered.
* Analyze user roles/permissions updates post-trial removal.
* Review API calls and database updates related to trial status.

**Next Steps:**

* Identify and fix the root cause of access persistence.
* Implement and test a fix to ensure proper enforcement of trial expiration.
* Deploy a patch and monitor for any continued issues.

comments.body: @raldrich Okay, thanks for the feedback. I will close this. Sam mentioned that I create a ticket for this from the previous Customer interviews we had but it is all good now.

Hi @suleman, yes we did test this and basically it corrected itself after an hour.

cc: @val

@val not reproducible. @raldrich didn't we already test this and concluded it takes some time to update the status after trial ends and then it auto moves back to basic? If everything is fine then we can remove this.
It could not be reproduced, but it is worth trying.

data.title: Automation Cypress: Default Chart Filter on Token Details and Market Pages
data.description:
### **Description:**

The default timeframe for charts on the **Token Details Page** and **Market Page** has been updated to **1-year (1Y)** to improve user experience. This task involves automating the verification of this change using Cypress.

### **Scope of Work:**

1. **Verify Default Chart Settings:**
   * Ensure that on both **Token Details Page** and **Market Page**, the default chart timeframe loads as **1Y** when a user visits the page for the first time.
2. **Validate User Preferences Persistence:**
   * Verify that refreshing the page does **not** reset the chart to **1Y**, unless the user hasn’t interacted with the timeframe selector.

### **Test Cases to Automate:**

✅ **TC1:** On first visit, charts on **Token Details Page** and **Market Page** load with **1Y** as the default timeframe.

Related Ticket: [ENG-4422](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-4422/set-1-year-as-default-view-for-charts-on-token-details-and-market-page)

###

data.title: Implement PostHog Event Tracking for Trading Engine API Usage
data.description:
#### **Description:**

To enhance **visibility into API usage, user behavior, and performance analytics**, we need to **integrate PostHog tracking** for the **Trading API**. This will allow us to monitor **API request trends, response times, user engagement, and error rates**, helping to optimize API performance and improve user experience.

**Scope of Work:**

**API Usage & Engagement Tracking**

* Capture `API Key Created` when a user generates an API key.
* Track `API Request Made` with:
  * `endpoint_accessed` (e.g., `/market-data`, `/trader-grades`)
  * `request_volume` (number of calls per session)
  * `user_id` (to track unique usage)
  * `timestamp`
* Log `High-Usage API Users` (users exceeding 500 calls defined request limits).

**Performance & Latency Monitoring**

* Capture `API Response Time` for each request to measure speed.
* Track `Slow API Requests` (response time above threshold).
* Log `Peak Usage Hours` to identify when the API is most active.

**Error Handling & Debugging**

* Log `API Request Failed` with:
  * `error_code` (e.g., 400, 403, 500)
  * `reason` (e.g., invalid request, rate limit exceeded)

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

API usage events are **logged in PostHog** for analytics.

parent.title: Implement PostHog Custom Events Across All Products

data.title: Implement PostHog Event Tracking for Trading on Token Metrics
data.description:
**Description:**

To optimize **trading fee revenue and user behavior analysis**, we need to integrate **PostHog event tracking** for key trading actions. This includes capturing **trade execution, order lifecycle, fee tracking, and user retention** to provide actionable insights via dashboards.

#### **Scope of Work:**

**User Actions & Trade Behavior Tracking**

* Capture `Trade Executed` events with properties:
  * `trade_volume`
* Track `Trade Failed` events with `error_type` (insufficient funds, no liquidity, etc.).
* Log `execution_time_ms` for each trade to measure **latency from order to execution**.

 **Fee Revenue Tracking**

* Include `fee_amount` property in `Trade Executed` events.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

 All trading-related events are successfully created and sent to PostHog.

data.title: Update the Index Icon to be of dynamic length
data.description:
The current index icons rely on a 3-token structure, whereas an index may only have 1 token. We need to update the logic to be dynamic, and up to 3 tokens instead.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Update Index Icon to Support Dynamic Token Length

**Description:** Modify the index icon functionality to handle a variable number of tokens, accommodating indexes with 1 to 3 tokens. Currently, the system is restricted to a fixed 3-token structure, which fails to accurately represent indexes with fewer tokens.

**Business Rationale:** Enhancing the flexibility of index icons ensures accurate visual representation of various index configurations, improves user experience, and allows the system to scale effectively with diverse indexing needs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The index icon logic dynamically adjusts to display 1, 2, or 3 tokens based on the index’s actual token count.
* Icons accurately reflect the number of tokens without visual discrepancies.
* Existing 3-token index icons continue to function correctly without any regression issues.
* Comprehensive tests are implemented to validate the dynamic behavior for all supported token lengths.

data.title: Engineering Team - Buy Index Feature
data.description:
### **Engineer Tasks**

1. **Integrate Privy Embedded Wallets (EVM & Solana)**
   * Implement Privy wallet support for users to transact using their embedded wallet.
2. **Implement “Buy Index” Transaction Flow**
   * Develop backend logic to process purchases and update user balances accordingly.
3. **Enforce Minimum Gas Fee Check**
   * Ensure users retain at least **$5 in native chain tokens** to cover transaction fees.
4. **Display List of Tokens in Index Before Purchase**
   * Fetch and display the breakdown of tokens in the index dynamically.
5. **Handle Transaction Processing and UI States**
   * Implement animations and UI states for transaction initiation, success, and failure.
6. **Implement Rebalancing Logic & Conflict Resolution**
   * Detect manual sales interference and notify users with structured error messages.
7. **Ensure Proper Error Handling for Failed Transactions**
   * Implement robust error handling to provide user-friendly feedback.

data.title: Buy Index - Build
data.description:
## **Feature: Buy Index on Index Details Page**

### **Overview**

The "Buy Index" feature enables users to purchase an Index directly from the Index Details page using an **embedded wallet** (Token Metrics delegated wallet via Privy). The feature must ensure:

1. Users buy the Index using their **embedded wallet, not their browser wallet**.
2. Users retain at least **$5 in their native chain token** (EVM/Solana) for gas fees.
3. Users see a **breakdown of the tokens in the Index** before purchase.
4. The **platform supports only EVM and Solana-based Indexes** due to Privy’s limitations.
5. Rebalancing logic detects if a token has been manually sold by the user and **provides nested error messages**.

[docs.google.com](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AY47Pg1BRPlFqN16AMSMYgbW2PqRRDuHud9FqBDmhS0/edit?usp=sharing)

data.title: Project Details Page
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Project Details Page

**Description:**
Develop a Project Details Page that displays comprehensive information about a specific project, including the project name, description, status, team members, milestones, and associated documents.

**Business Rationale:**
A centralized Project Details Page enhances transparency and accessibility, allowing team members and stakeholders to easily access vital project information. This facilitates better collaboration, tracking of progress, and informed decision-making, ultimately improving project efficiency and outcomes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Project Information:** Displays the project name, detailed description, and current status.
2. **Team Members:** Lists all assigned team members with their roles and contact information.
3. **Milestones:** Shows key project milestones with due dates and completion statuses.
4. **Documents:** Provides access to related documents and resources, organized logically.
5. **Responsive Design:** Ensures the page is fully responsive and functions correctly on desktop and mobile devices.
6. **Edit Functionality:** Allows authorized users to edit project details with proper validation.
7. **Error Handling:** Displays appropriate error messages for data retrieval or submission issues.
8. **Accessibility:** Complies with accessibility standards to support all users.

data.title: Implement the Index buy functionality on AI-Indices page.
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Index Buy Functionality on AI-Indices Page

**Description:** Develop the capability for users to purchase indices directly from the AI-Indices page. This includes adding intuitive UI elements for selecting indices, processing transactions securely, and updating user portfolios accordingly.

**Business Rationale:** Facilitating direct index purchases on the AI-Indices page will enhance user experience, increase engagement, and drive higher sales by providing a seamless and efficient investment process.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Users can view and select available indices on the AI-Indices page.
2. A secure transaction process is in place for purchasing selected indices.
3. Upon successful purchase, the user's portfolio is updated to reflect the new index holdings.
4. Users receive a confirmation notification after completing a purchase.
5. Proper error messages are displayed if a transaction fails.

data.title: Signoz Fine tuning ( Add Logs, Alerts, Metrics)
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Signoz Fine Tuning – Add Logs, Alerts, and Metrics

**Description:**  
Enhance the Signoz monitoring setup by integrating comprehensive logging, configuring alerting mechanisms, and defining key metrics. This improvement aims to boost system observability, enable proactive issue detection, and facilitate performance tracking.

**Business Rationale:**  
Implementing detailed logs, alerts, and metrics within Signoz will improve our ability to monitor system health effectively, reduce downtime through early issue detection, and provide actionable insights for system optimization. These enhancements support our objectives of maintaining high reliability and delivering an exceptional user experience.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* **Logs:** Comprehensive logging is configured for all critical system components with appropriate log levels.
* **Alerts:** Alerts are set up for key metrics and threshold breaches, including properly configured notification channels.
* **Metrics:** Relevant metrics are defined, collected, and visualized in Signoz dashboards.
* **Documentation:** All logging, alerting, and metrics configurations are thoroughly documented.
* **Testing:** Logging, alerting, and metrics functionalities are tested and verified to operate as expected.

Title: Deploy Research Agent to Digital Ocean

Description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Deploy Research Agent to Digital Ocean

**Description:**
Deploy the Research Agent application to the Digital Ocean platform to leverage its scalable infrastructure and ensure high availability.

**Business Rationale:**
Migrating to Digital Ocean will enhance the application's performance and reliability, support growing user demand, and reduce operational costs. This deployment will also improve the deployment workflow and provide better monitoring capabilities.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The Research Agent is successfully deployed on Digital Ocean.
* All environment variables and configuration settings are correctly configured.
* The application passes all functional and performance tests in the new environment.
* Documentation is updated to include deployment procedures and environment details.
* Monitoring and logging are set up to track application performance and uptime.

data.title: Portfolio Feature - Front End - Trading Agent Tab
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Portfolio Feature - Front End - Trading Agent Tab

**Description:** Develop the Trading Agent tab within the portfolio front-end to allow users to manage and monitor their trading activities directly from their portfolio dashboard.

**Business Rationale:** Adding a Trading Agent tab enhances the user experience by providing seamless access to trading functionalities within the portfolio interface. This integration aims to increase user engagement, streamline trading operations, and improve overall satisfaction, ultimately driving higher platform usage and retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Accessibility:** The Trading Agent tab is visible and accessible from the main portfolio dashboard.
2. **Functionality:** Users can view real-time trading data, execute trades, and access trade history within the tab.
3. **UI/UX:** The tab layout is intuitive and aligns with the overall design guidelines of the portfolio feature.
4. **Performance:** Trading actions perform efficiently with minimal latency.
5. **Error Handling:** Appropriate error messages are displayed for failed actions or invalid inputs.
6. **Testing:** All functionalities within the Trading Agent tab pass unit and integration tests.

data.title: Automation Cypress: Profile Settings/Security/Notification Settings Validation
data.description:
#### **Objective:**

Automate the validation of the Profile Settings section to ensure that all fields can be updated correctly and that security and notification settings function as expected.

#### **Test Scope:**

1. **Profile Settings Update Validation:**
   * Verify if the following fields can be updated successfully:
     * First Name
     * Last Name
     * Phone
     * Job Title
     * Company
     * TradingView Details
   * Ensure that the updated values are saved and displayed correctly after refreshing the page.
2. **Security Section Validation:**
   * Check if the password change functionality works correctly.
   * Ensure that the "New Password" and "Confirm New Password" fields must match for a successful update.
   * Validate error messages when passwords do not match or do not meet security criteria.
3. **Notification Section Validation:**
   * Verify that clicking on the configuration buttons for the following channels redirects to the correct setup pages:
     * Slack Channel
     * Discord Channel
     * Telegram Channel
   * Test enabling and disabling email notifications and verify that changes are saved correctly.

#### **Expected Outcome:**

* All fields in the **Profile Settings** section should be updatable and persist after saving.
* **Security settings** should allow password changes only when valid inputs are provided.
* **Notification settings** should correctly redirect to external configurations and allow toggling email notifications.

data.title: Urgent Bug: Token Page Elements Do Not Adapt to Mobile
data.description:
**Feature:** Token Page
**Category:** UI/Graphic
**Device:** Huawei Honor
**OS:** Android 10 (10.0)
**Priority:** Medium

Reported by multiple testers on Unguess.

[Jam | Console logs, network requests, and more](https://jam.dev/c/f555d124-59f9-4272-85fd-189fa3443a8d)

#### **Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open [staging.tokenmetrics.com/en](staging.tokenmetrics.com/en) on a mobile device.
2. Tap on any token to open its details page.
3. Ensure the **"Exchanges"** section is open or open the **"Trading Signals PnL"** section.

#### **Expected Result:**

* All elements on the token page (including the exchange popup and chart) should properly adapt to mobile view, similar to the header.

#### **Actual Result:**

* Only the header is properly adapted to mobile view.
* Other elements (such as the exchange popup and chart) are too large, requiring users to zoom out.
* Collapsing the **"Exchanges"** section fixes the issue, indicating that this section may be causing the layout problem.

#### **Additional Notes:**

* Issue detected on **03/03/2025 at 09:41 AM GMT+1**.
* Bug occurs consistently across different tokens.

[2851e21d0221eb2a0f6adfe6c13f9756c4d0ed390d05c26c00819966cf9fe75e.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/9f78097d-2df9-4c6e-8a22-4141c13cf20d/0951e797-6d28-4539-9276-3a85604ff970)

![Screenshot 2025-03-03 at 14.46.08.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/804b2c99-043a-4c42-80af-1e7fe5562bea/c666fd61-254a-45a0-89a5-b14f9cb54004)

[38adfffe03630f0b65406d6f9853f91d67b9cb3f00d1449dd866e11a4e347804.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/fa7f7f5f-2b72-4108-84a5-da8d6a3d9db9/e9e1516d-d61b-4a74-b086-958171cb857f)

(**Motorola Edge 50 Pro Android 15(Beta) (15(Beta)))**

[1e63fd0b6b92d95b46b884e4e7d3a6607319707b1aa55be1d44d8f3224bb2d72.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/96dc121b-810b-4c85-ac4e-dd5ae4f07ac2/7bfd1dec-da18-4c1a-9600-3abd03a0a5b5)

data.title: Update Token Hover Behavior on Ratings Page
data.description:
**Description:**
Currently, when users hover over tokens on the Ratings page, they see a list of all the CEXs & DEXs where that token is traded (e.g., *"Fasttoken listed on - Fastex, BingX, Bybit."*).

We want to change this behavior so that hovering over a token displays the blockchain networks (chains) the token belongs to instead.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Update the hover tooltip to display the chains associated with the token instead of exchange listings.
* Ensure the new format is clear, concise, and user-friendly.
* Maintain consistent styling with existing tooltips.

**New Copy Format:**
*"Fasttoken is available on - Ethereum, Polygon, BNB Chain."*

![image (4).png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/0cab4c2a-82a6-41c9-aa15-00c329cb22c9/2aa744fd-56ac-456d-bd04-1dccd4bb3ed9)

data.title: [Group] - Data API bugs
data.description:
## **Title1:** Status & Actions Dropdowns Not Opening on Hover and Not Closing After Click (API Keys Tab)

**Description:**
In the **API Keys** tab, the **Status** and **Actions** dropdowns do not open when hovering over them. Instead, they require a click to open, but once opened, they do not close when clicking outside or interacting elsewhere.

[https://jam.dev/c/6e0fe40c-a707-45ad-ba2f-617d4b0eff4a](https://jam.dev/c/6e0fe40c-a707-45ad-ba2f-617d4b0eff4a)

## **Title2:** Missing "Apply" Button in Date Picker on Data API

**Description:**
In the **Data API** section, after selecting dates from the **date picker**, there is no **"Apply" button** to confirm the selection. This creates confusion for users, as it is unclear how to apply the selected date range.

[https://jam.dev/c/12c994ac-c336-42fc-b57c-9f52ceea2666](https://jam.dev/c/12c994ac-c336-42fc-b57c-9f52ceea2666)

## **Title3:** Created API Keys Are Not Visible in API Keys Tab

**Description:**
After creating a new API key, it does not appear in the **API Keys** tab. Users expect to see newly generated keys in the list immediately, but they are either missing or require additional actions (e.g., refresh) to appear.

[https://jam.dev/c/8b6f9e00-55fa-4f52-adb3-d7cb07ddd652](https://jam.dev/c/8b6f9e00-55fa-4f52-adb3-d7cb07ddd652)

## **Title5:** Deactivate API Key Popup Text Cut Off on Mobile Viewport

**Description:**
In the **Deactivate API Key** popup, the text is **cut off** or not fully visible on mobile viewports. This issue affects the readability and user experience, as users are unable to see the complete text in the popup.

[https://jam.dev/c/bd608519-0ac8-40a8-91e2-30afeb6cc30b](https://jam.dev/c/bd608519-0ac8-40a8-91e2-30afeb6cc30b)

## **Title6:** API Keys Are Clickable but Do Not Open on Click

**Description:**
The API keys listed in the **API Keys** section appear **clickable** , but when clicked, **nothing happens**. This is expected to open a detailed view or trigger an action, but the click does not result in any interaction.

[https://jam.dev/c/f59e6330-3f0f-4cab-b445-ee704fc25a5b](https://jam.dev/c/f59e6330-3f0f-4cab-b445-ee704fc25a5b)

## **Title7:** Clicking on API Call Chart Selects the First Day Automatically

**Description:**
When clicking **API Call chart**, it **automatically selects the first day** in the chart, even though the user is trying to interact with other parts of the graph. This leads to unintended behavior, as the user cannot select or view the desired data point directly by clicking.

[https://jam.dev/c/4e636f73-ae2a-401b-9fe2-2318f3b9b919](https://jam.dev/c/4e636f73-ae2a-401b-9fe2-2318f3b9b919)

## **Title8:** Missing Reset Feature in Date Picker

**Description:**
The **Date Picker** component does not have a **reset** functionality, preventing users from easily clearing the selected dates. This leads to an inefficient user experience, especially when they want to quickly clear the date filter without manually adjusting the dates. @ben fy.

[https://jam.dev/c/b873f868-1eca-4e04-b968-1322eb0cc0a7](https://jam.dev/c/b873f868-1eca-4e04-b968-1322eb0cc0a7)

## **Title9:** API Calls Chart Not Displaying When "Max" Filter is Selected

**Description:**
When selecting the **"Max"** filter in the **API Calls chart**, the chart fails to display any data. This results in a blank or missing chart, preventing users from viewing API call data for the "Max" filter option.

[https://jam.dev/c/7c9afdf5-54ff-4c82-bb4a-a919f39e48d0](https://jam.dev/c/7c9afdf5-54ff-4c82-bb4a-a919f39e48d0)

## **Title10:** Dashboard Not Updating After API Call Without Page Refresh

**Description:**
After making an API call, the data on the **Dashboard** does not update unless the page is manually refreshed. Additionally, when switching between tabs (e.g., from **Dashboard** to **API Keys**), the Dashboard does not update automatically. This causes users to see outdated data without refreshing the page. @ben fy.

## **Title11:** Price Prediction Endpoint Returning 400 Instead of 200 When No Data is Available

**Description:**
The **Price Prediction** endpoint currently returns a **400 Bad Request** error when no data is available. Ideally, if there is no data for the request, the endpoint should return a **200 OK** status with an empty or null response body, rather than a 400 error. ?  (Not Sure about expected result in here)

[https://jam.dev/c/85befdb7-dcfd-4572-a162-3aaf76558f2a](https://jam.dev/c/85befdb7-dcfd-4572-a162-3aaf76558f2a)

## **Title12:** Update Labels for API Calls to Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The labels on the dashboard for **Total API Calls** and **Remaining API Calls** should be updated to match the design in Figma. The correct labels are:

* **Total API Calls** should be changed to **Total Monthly API Calls**.
* **Remaining API Calls** should be changed to **Remaining Monthly API Calls**.

parent.title: DATA API Beta Release - Parent Ticket

comments.body: @ozcan It wiill be fixed with primsa update, will let you know as soon as it's done

InformalTest: Retested and fixed all items. If we encounter a new issue, we are already creating a new ticket. However, if there are still unresolved items from the ones reported, we only reopen those in that case. For item11, But this endpoint is not working, and is this the expected behavior? Who do we need to get approval from for this?

### **Action Items Taken**

* **Fixed all reported issues**
*  **Tested after post-deployment to staging**
*  **Added comments for irrelevant or non-actionable issues**

---

### **Issue Breakdown**

**Fixed Issues**

✅ **Status & Actions Dropdowns Not Opening on Hover and Not Closing After Click (API Keys Tab)**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/3fad7374-df41-4a51-ac8c-d069814a83e6)

✅ **Created API Keys Are Not Visible in API Keys Tab**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/502d7f37-1ed6-47d7-b637-5fa76b956b73)

✅ **Deactivate API Key Popup Text Cut Off on Mobile Viewport**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/9ecbb0a0-728e-4405-85cd-d1b762a85c0c)

✅ **API Keys Are Clickable but Do Not Open on Click**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/1ebc0ff4-4469-491c-a251-d9302a0f548e)
➡️ API keys should now be clickable on the **status toggle icon** and **action view/delete icon**.

✅ **Clicking on API Call Chart Selects the First Day Automatically**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/842c26ee-c0ea-4095-b356-a5a00df0c010)

✅ **API Calls Chart Not Displaying When "Max" Filter is Selected**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/e77a9f7c-9b25-4d2a-a941-810d96c0e51b)

✅ **Update Labels for API Calls to Match Figma Design**
[Jam Link](https://jam.dev/c/ae4c7adf-c1f2-43b0-bc72-a8a0e55c4ea1)

---

### **🟡 Non-Actionable / Not Relevant Issues**

⚠️ **Missing "Apply" Button in Date Picker on Data API**

* This functionality is **not part of the current design**.
* If needed in the future, we can create a new ticket when the design is updated.

⚠️ **Missing Reset Feature in Date Picker**

* Similar to the "Apply" button, this is **not included in the design**.
* Can be added as a future improvement when needed.

⚠️ **Dashboard Not Updating After API Call Without Page Refresh**

* Real-time updates **are not supported** as the dashboard works with REST API calls.
* Users need to manually refresh the page to see updated data.

⚠️ **Price Prediction Endpoint Returning 400 Instead of 200 When No Data is Available**

* This was **intentionally set based on the recommendation of ex-Data Team Head (Paul)**.
* Changing this behavior is **not feasible** as there are multiple dependencies on this expected response.

***Note: @ozcan , if you encounter new issues, please create a separate ticket instead of adding them here.I recommend reviewing all the Jam links if you have any questions about issues***

@ozcan , if these need to be implemented, please create a separate ticket as an improvement, as they are not bugs since they are not listed in the designs. If we get designs for them later, we can implement them accordingly.
For item2 and item8, These two items are not in the design, but their absence is causing difficulties. If they are not necessary, could you please provide your comments? @ben @ayo
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6312). All replies are displayed in both locations.

issues.full_context:
Title: [Group] - Data API bugs

Description:
## **Title1:** Status & Actions Dropdowns Not Opening on Hover and Not Closing After Click (API Keys Tab)

**Description:**
In the **API Keys** tab, the **Status** and **Actions** dropdowns do not open when hovering over them. Instead, they require a click to open, but once opened, they do not close when clicking outside or interacting elsewhere.

[https://jam.dev/c/6e0fe40c-a707-45ad-ba2f-617d4b0eff4a](https://jam.dev/c/6e0fe40c-a707-45ad-ba2f-617d4b0eff4a)

## **Title2:** Missing "Apply" Button in Date Picker on Data API

**Description:**
In the **Data API** section, after selecting dates from the **date picker**, there is no **"Apply" button** to confirm the selection. This creates confusion for users, as it is unclear how to apply the selected date range.

[https://jam.dev/c/12c994ac-c336-42fc-b57c-9f52ceea2666](https://jam.dev/c/12c994ac-c336-42fc-b57c-9f52ceea2666)

## **Title3:** Created API Keys Are Not Visible in API Keys Tab

**Description:**
After creating a new API key, it does not appear in the **API Keys** tab. Users expect to see newly generated keys in the list immediately, but they are either missing or require additional actions (e.g., refresh) to appear.

[https://jam.dev/c/8b6f9e00-55fa-4f52-adb3-d7cb07ddd652](https://jam.dev/c/8b6f9e00-55fa-4f52-adb3-d7cb07ddd652)

## **Title5:** Deactivate API Key Popup Text Cut Off on Mobile Viewport

**Description:**
In the **Deactivate API Key** popup, the text is **cut off** or not fully visible on mobile viewports. This issue affects the readability and user experience, as users are unable to see the complete text in the popup.

[https://jam.dev/c/bd608519-0ac8-40a8-91e2-30afeb6cc30b](https://jam.dev/c/bd608519-0ac8-40a8-91e2-30afeb6cc30b)

## **Title6:** API Keys Are Clickable but Do Not Open on Click

**Description:**
The API keys listed in the **API Keys** section appear **clickable** , but when clicked, **nothing happens**. This is expected to open a detailed view or trigger an action, but the click does not result in any interaction.

[https://jam.dev/c/f59e6330-3f0f-4cab-b445-ee704fc25a5b](https://jam.dev/c/f59e6330-3f0f-4cab-b445-ee704fc25a5b)

## **Title7:** Clicking on API Call Chart Selects the First Day Automatically

**Description:**
When clicking **API Call chart**, it **automatically selects the first day** in the chart, even though the user is trying to interact with other parts of the graph. This leads to unintended behavior, as the user cannot select or view the desired data point directly by clicking.

[https://jam.dev/c/4e636f73-ae2a-401b-9fe2-2318f3b9b919](https://jam.dev/c/4e636f73-ae2a-401b-9fe2-2318f3b9b919)

## **Title8:** Missing Reset Feature in Date Picker

**Description:**
The **Date Picker** component does not have a **reset** functionality, preventing users from easily clearing the selected dates. This leads to an inefficient user experience, especially when they want to quickly clear the date filter without manually adjusting the dates. @ben fy.

[https://jam.dev/c/b873f868-1eca-4e04-b968-1322eb0cc0a7](https://jam.dev/c/b873f868-1eca-4e04-b968-1322eb0cc0a7)

## **Title9:** API Calls Chart Not Displaying When "Max" Filter is Selected

**Description:**
When selecting the **"Max"** filter in the **API Calls chart**, the chart fails to display any data. This results in a blank or missing chart, preventing users from viewing API call data for the "Max" filter option.

[https://jam.dev/c/7c9afdf5-54ff-4c82-bb4a-a919f39e48d0](https://jam.dev/c/7c9afdf5-54ff-4c82-bb4a-a919f39e48d0)

## **Title10:** Dashboard Not Updating After API Call Without Page Refresh

**Description:**
After making an API call, the data on the **Dashboard** does not update unless the page is manually refreshed. Additionally, when switching between tabs (e.g., from **Dashboard** to **API Keys**), the Dashboard does not update automatically. This causes users to see outdated data without refreshing the page. @ben fy.

## **Title11:** Price Prediction Endpoint Returning 400 Instead of 200 When No Data is Available

**Description:**
The **Price Prediction** endpoint currently returns a **400 Bad Request** error when no data is available. Ideally, if there is no data for the request, the endpoint should return a **200 OK** status with an empty or null response body, rather than a 400 error. ?  (Not Sure about expected result in here)

[https://jam.dev/c/85befdb7-dcfd-4572-a162-3aaf76558f2a](https://jam.dev/c/85befdb7-dcfd-4572-a162-3aaf76558f2a)

## **Title12:** Update Labels for API Calls to Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The labels on the dashboard for **Total API Calls** and **Remaining API Calls** should be updated to match the design in Figma. The correct labels are:

* **Total API Calls** should be changed to **Total Monthly API Calls**.
* **Remaining API Calls** should be changed to **Remaining Monthly API Calls**.

data.title: API integration
data.description:
Integrating backend APIs for the following functionalities:

* Fetching, filtering, and sorting agent data
* Favorites
* Wallet
* Launch Agent

Groomed Issue:

**Issue: API Integration for Core Functionalities**

**Description:**  
Integrate backend APIs to support essential application features, including fetching, filtering, and sorting agent data; managing user favorites; handling wallet operations; and launching agents. Additionally, implement APIs for V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways and Trading Agent V2 design elements such as the agent listing page (list view) and files separation. This integration will ensure seamless communication between the frontend and backend, enabling robust and scalable functionality.

**Business Rationale:**  
Comprehensive API integration is vital for delivering a smooth and efficient user experience. By enabling these core functionalities, the platform can offer personalized agent management, secure financial transactions, and advanced trading capabilities. This will enhance user engagement, streamline operations, and support the platform's growth and reliability.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Agent Data Management:**
   * APIs for fetching, filtering, and sorting agent data are fully implemented and tested.
   * Frontend successfully displays agent data based on API responses.
2. **Favorites Functionality:**
   * Users can add, remove, and view favorite agents through the integrated APIs.
   * Changes in favorites are accurately reflected in the user interface.
3. **Wallet Operations:**
   * APIs for viewing wallet balance and transaction history are operational.
   * Users can perform wallet-related actions without errors.
4. **Launch Agent:**
   * The Launch Agent feature is fully functional via the integrated API.
   * Agents can be launched successfully from the frontend interface.
5. **Trading AI Agents Integration:**
   * V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways are properly integrated and operational.
   * Trading Agent V2 design elements, including the agent listing page and file separation, are implemented and functioning as intended.
6. **Performance and Reliability:**
   * All APIs meet predefined performance benchmarks and handle expected load.
   * Comprehensive documentation is provided for all integrated APIs.
7. **Quality Assurance:**
   * All integrated features pass QA testing with no critical bugs.
   * User acceptance testing confirms that functionalities meet business requirements.
