data.title: Account Management (4 Issues)
data.description:
1. Upgrades to Advanced or Premium often leave accounts stuck on Basic, blocking paid features. Users report errors (blurred screens, broken links) and difficulty managing payment or subscriptions. Plans appear identically priced, causing confusion. Payment processing fails without clear reasons. Overall, these technical and usability problems prevent users from accessing the features they’ve paid for and highlight an urgent need for platform and interface improvements.

[https://insights.reforge.com/w/clzajz1q900psoxafl5skkrcl/feedback/structured/clzh9x6ej02j056ljbelgu879/theme/cm2360a9b05ur1ql840wr91tp?from=2025-02-21](https://insights.reforge.com/w/clzajz1q900psoxafl5skkrcl/feedback/structured/clzh9x6ej02j056ljbelgu879/theme/cm2360a9b05ur1ql840wr91tp?from=2025-02-21)

data.title: Subscription Management (8 Issues)
data.description:
1. Users are frustrated by errors and obstacles when canceling subscriptions (e.g., “something went wrong” messages, hidden account settings, unexpected charges after trials). Some can’t find the correct email account but still get billed. Delays in refunds and difficulty in contacting support compound the issue. Users want a more reliable cancellation/refund process, immediate confirmations, clearer instructions, and faster resolution of billing disputes to restore trust.

[https://insights.reforge.com/w/clzajz1q900psoxafl5skkrcl/feedback/structured/clzh9x6ej02j056ljbelgu879/theme/cm7nk6b5h00lzzdynp8ilh45q?from=2025-02-21](https://insights.reforge.com/w/clzajz1q900psoxafl5skkrcl/feedback/structured/clzh9x6ej02j056ljbelgu879/theme/cm7nk6b5h00lzzdynp8ilh45q?from=2025-02-21)

data.title: (Parent) March 1st Top 3 Monteray Issues
data.description:
Monterey has identified multiple user issues related to **subscription management, account access, and chatbot functionality**. These issues need to be investigated and resolved to improve user experience and reduce churn.

---

### **Scope of Work:**

1. **Subscription Management Issues**
   * Investigate reports of **unexpected charge emails**
   * Ensure the **billing system processes cancellations correctly** and refunds are issued within the expected timeframe.
   * Improve **error messaging and user guidance** for subscription management.
2. **Account Management**
   * Fix cases where users experience **delayed access** to premium features after upgrading.
   * Debug authentication issues preventing upgraded users from accessing their accounts.
   * Verify that account status updates **reflect immediately after payment confirmation**.
3. **Difficulty claiming Airdrop**

---

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Users can **cancel subscriptions and receive refunds without issues**.
* Premium and Advanced users gain **immediate access** after upgrading.
* The chatbot responds **accurately and consistently** without delays.
* Error handling is **improved** across all flagged issues.

data.title: API integration
data.description:
* Modify response of Get Wallet Balance API
* Integrate with the Create New User API (@chao) to sync data from Prive Create Address to our database

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** API Enhancements and Implementation of V1 Trading AI Agents

**Description:**
Enhance existing APIs by modifying the Get Wallet Balance response and integrating the Create New User API to sync data from Prive Create Address to our database. Additionally, implement V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy and Fiat gateways, addressing the current technical debt of the AI team.

**Business Rationale:**
Updating the Get Wallet Balance API ensures more accurate and relevant financial data for users, improving user experience and trust. Integrating the Create New User API with Prive Create Address synchronization streamlines user onboarding and data management. Implementing Trading AI Agents with robust gateways will enhance our trading capabilities, providing advanced features to maintain competitiveness and reduce technical liabilities within the AI team.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Get Wallet Balance API:**
   * Response structure is modified as per requirements.
   * All existing functionalities remain intact.
   * Successfully passes all relevant tests.
2. **Create New User API Integration:**
   * Data from Prive Create Address is accurately synced to the database.
   * Integration is verified through testing without data inconsistencies.
   * Documentation is updated to reflect changes.
3. **V1 Trading AI Agents Implementation:**
   * Trading AI Agents are operational with Privy and Fiat gateways integrated.
   * Identified technical debt is resolved.
   * Comprehensive testing confirms agent functionality and performance.
   * Deployment documentation and support materials are completed.

data.title: Remove Paywall for Price Prediction Chart on Token Details Page
data.description:
Allow users on the Basic plan and those not logged in to access and view the price prediction chart on the token details page without encountering a paywall restriction.

**Business Rationale:**  
Removing the paywall for the price prediction chart will enhance user engagement and provide value to a broader audience. By allowing more users to access key features, we can increase user retention, attract potential subscribers, and improve overall platform accessibility.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Users with a Basic plan can view the price prediction chart on any token details page without restrictions.
2. Users who are not logged in can access and view the price prediction chart without being prompted to upgrade or log in.
3. No paywall prompts or restrictions are displayed when accessing the price prediction chart for eligible users.
4. Ensure that other premium features remain restricted to appropriate subscription tiers.
5. Verify that the change does not adversely affect page load times or performance.

data.title: Implement Lazy Loading for the Favorites Section (Ratings Page)
data.description:
#### **Objective**

Optimize the Favourites section of the Ratings page by implementing lazy loading to enhance performance, reduce initial page load time, and improve user experience.

#### **Background**

Currently, the Favourites section loads all items at once, which can cause performance bottlenecks, especially for users with a large number of favorite items. Implementing lazy loading will ensure that only a subset of favorite items loads initially, with additional items loading as the user scrolls.

---

### **Technical Requirements**

#### **1. Data Fetching & Pagination**

* Implement **backend pagination** to fetch items in batches.
* Define an API endpoint (if not already available) to support paginated requests.
* Default page size: **10 items per request**.

#### **2. Frontend Implementation**

* Modify the **Favourites section component** to support lazy loading.
* Ensure previously loaded items persist when fetching new ones.
* Display the logo animation if lazy loading fails 

#### **3. UI/UX Enhancements**

* Smooth transitions for newly loaded items.

#### **4. Performance Optimizations**

* Implement **debouncing** (e.g., 300ms) to prevent excessive API calls when scrolling.
* Use **caching mechanisms** (local state or IndexedDB) to avoid refetching previously loaded data.
* Optimize API queries to fetch only **necessary fields** for rendering.

#### **5. Error Handling & Edge Cases**

* Handle API failures gracefully:
  * Show an error message when data fails to load and retry loading automatically.
  * If there is an error with lazy loading, then load favourites from the backend and show the logo animation while the user waits
* Handle cases where users have **zero favorites**.
* Ensure responsiveness on **mobile devices**.

data.title: DATA API Beta Release - Parent Ticket
data.description:
**DATA API Beta Release (Parent Ticket)**

**Description:**  
Manage the beta release of the DATA API by coordinating all associated backend and frontend tasks within this parent ticket to ensure seamless tracking and execution.

**Business Rationale:**  
Launching the DATA API in beta enables early user engagement and feedback, facilitating the identification and resolution of issues before the full release. This approach enhances product quality, meets user needs effectively, and supports strategic business objectives.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All backend and frontend tasks related to the DATA API beta are linked to this parent ticket.
* The DATA API beta is deployed to the staging environment without critical issues.
* Comprehensive documentation for the DATA API beta is completed and reviewed.
* Successful completion of internal testing with no major defects.
* Feedback collection mechanisms are implemented and operational for beta users.

**Title:** Implement Indices Details Page with API Integration

**Description:**
Develop the Indices Details page following the [Figma design](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=7925-63280&t=6r9JRT6xzKqTBgCp-4). Integrate the necessary APIs to fetch and display index data dynamically, ensuring seamless user interaction and data accuracy.

Providing a comprehensive Indices Details page enhances user experience by offering in-depth information on indices. This supports informed decision-making, increases user engagement, and adds value to the platform's offerings.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The Indices Details page matches the provided Figma design in layout and styling.
2. All relevant index data is accurately fetched and displayed through integrated APIs.
3. The page is fully responsive and functions correctly across all supported devices and browsers.
4. Proper error handling is implemented for API failures, displaying user-friendly messages.
5. The implementation includes necessary unit and integration tests, all of which pass successfully.

comments.body:
For the trading agent, we can't use API of Privy since it's only supports the server wallets. but the wallets which are created on trading agent frontend is not the server wallets but it's just embedded client wallet.
So I think we might to need another third party endpoint or our trading Agent api should be updated by adding new endpoint to fetch the token balance for the any chains (evm, svm) - we can fetch some popular chains first for the performance and can make the query for user to fetch rest chain's token balance.

Note: we should fetch token balance by chain type - EVM, SVM

yeah, Here are two solutions:

1. ENG team provides a [API](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/37313638/2sAYQZGrV6) of fetching the balance given wallet id. (supported by Privy)
2. [Trading Agent API](https://tm-tradingbot-api.data-service.tokenmetrics.com/docs) provides another solution from BitQuery, where it can also check the wallet balance over any wallet and any chain.

Depends on which you want. @bartosz @ian

@manav @romes @chao have you guys dealt with this?

data.title: Integrate Coinbase Onramp with Privy for Fee-Free USDC Purchases and Custom Fee Implementation
data.description:
Implement Coinbase Onramp integration with our Privy-based application, focusing on USDC as the base currency for fee-free fiat-to-crypto purchases. 

Additionally, explore and implement a `custom fee structure of 1%` on top of these transactions.

@williams Coinbase Developer Portal account access sent to your email.

[Coinbase](https://portal.cdp.coinbase.com/projects/overview?projectId=9f9e897a-9d6d-4a3f-8b2c-ce8c48eaaa10)

## Tasks:

1. Update project dependencies
   * Add @coinbase/cbpay-js to package.json
   * Run npm install to install the new dependency
2. Modify frontend code (pages/home.tsx)
   * Update the fundWallet method to use Coinbase Onramp
   * Set USDC as the default destination asset
   * Implement user data collection (wallet address, email, etc.)
   * Add API call to backend for generating onramp URL
3. Update backend code (pages/api/onramp.ts)
   * Implement POST handler for onramp configuration
   * Generate JWT token for Coinbase Onramp authentication
   * Construct and return the onramp URL
   * Implement custom fee calculation logic
4. Update environment variables
   * Add NEXT_PUBLIC_COINBASE_APP_ID
   * Add COINBASE_API_SECRET
   * Add COINBASE_ONRAMP_BASE_URL
5. Modify Onramp component (components/Onramp.tsx)
   * Update UI to reflect Coinbase Onramp specifics and USDC focus
   * Implement redirection to Coinbase Onramp URL
   * Display custom fee information to users
6. Implement custom fee structure
   * Create a new API endpoint for fee calculation
   * Integrate fee calculation into the onramp process
   * Ensure compliance with Coinbase's guidelines on custom fees
7. Test integration
   * Verify successful user flow from wallet funding to USDC purchase
   * Test custom fee implementation
   * Confirm fee-free transactions for USDC purchases
8. Documentation
   * Update internal docs with integration details, USDC focus, and custom fee implementation

## Resources:

* Privy Fiat On-Ramp Demo: [https://github.com/privy-io/fiat-onramp-demo](https://github.com/privy-io/fiat-onramp-demo)
* Coinbase Onramp SDK Docs: [https://help.coinbase.com/en/developer-platform/coinbase-onramp-sdk](https://help.coinbase.com/en/developer-platform/coinbase-onramp-sdk)
* Privy Docs on Funding Wallets: [https://docs.privy.io/guide/react/wallets/usage/funding/](https://docs.privy.io/guide/react/wallets/usage/funding/)
* Coinbase Onramp API Overview: [https://docs.cdp.coinbase.com/onramp/docs/api-overview](https://docs.cdp.coinbase.com/onramp/docs/api-overview)
* Coinbase Custom Fees Documentation: [https://docs.cloud.coinbase.com/exchange/docs/fees](https://docs.cloud.coinbase.com/exchange/docs/fees)

## Notes:

* Emphasize USDC as the primary purchase option due to zero fees on Coinbase Onramp
* Custom fee implementation:
  1. Coinbase allows partners to add their own fees on top of transactions.
  2. Custom fees can be implemented by adjusting the purchase amount or through a separate transaction.
  3. Clearly disclose any additional fees to users in the UI.
  4. Consider implementing a tiered fee structure based on transaction volume.
  5. Ensure compliance with local regulations regarding fee disclosure and cryptocurrency purchases.
* Coinbase Onramp supports 100+ cryptocurrencies and 60+ fiat currencies, but focus on USDC for fee-free transactions
* Implement error handling and user feedback mechanisms for both standard and custom fee scenarios
* Consider offering educational content about the benefits of USDC purchases through the platform

issues.full_context:
Title: Integrate Coinbase Onramp with Privy for Fee-Free USDC Purchases and Custom Fee Implementation

Description:
Implement Coinbase Onramp integration with our Privy-based application, focusing on USDC as the base currency for fee-free fiat-to-crypto purchases. 

Additionally, explore and implement a `custom fee structure of 1%` on top of these transactions.

@williams Coinbase Developer Portal account access sent to your email.

[Coinbase](https://portal.cdp.coinbase.com/projects/overview?projectId=9f9e897a-9d6d-4a3f-8b2c-ce8c48eaaa10)

## Tasks:

1. Update project dependencies
   * Add @coinbase/cbpay-js to package.json
   * Run npm install to install the new dependency
2. Modify frontend code (pages/home.tsx)
   * Update the fundWallet method to use Coinbase Onramp
   * Set USDC as the default destination asset
   * Implement user data collection (wallet address, email, etc.)
   * Add API call to backend for generating onramp URL
3. Update backend code (pages/api/onramp.ts)
   * Implement POST handler for onramp configuration
   * Generate JWT token for Coinbase Onramp authentication
   * Construct and return the onramp URL
   * Implement custom fee calculation logic
4. Update environment variables
   * Add NEXT_PUBLIC_COINBASE_APP_ID
   * Add COINBASE_API_SECRET
   * Add COINBASE_ONRAMP_BASE_URL
5. Modify Onramp component (components/Onramp.tsx)
   * Update UI to reflect Coinbase Onramp specifics and USDC focus
   * Implement redirection to Coinbase Onramp URL
   * Display custom fee information to users
6. Implement custom fee structure
   * Create a new API endpoint for fee calculation
   * Integrate fee calculation into the onramp process
   * Ensure compliance with Coinbase's guidelines on custom fees
7. Test integration
   * Verify successful user flow from wallet funding to USDC purchase
   * Test custom fee implementation
   * Confirm fee-free transactions for USDC purchases
8. Documentation
   * Update internal docs with integration details, USDC focus, and custom fee implementation

* Coinbase Custom Fees Documentation: [https://docs.cloud.coinbase.com/exchange/docs/fees](https://docs.cloud.coinbase.com/exchange/docs/fees)

## Notes:

* Emphasize USDC as the primary purchase option due to zero fees on Coinbase Onramp
* Custom fee implementation:
  1. Coinbase allows partners to add their own fees on top of transactions.
  2. Custom fees can be implemented by adjusting the purchase amount or through a separate transaction.
  3. Clearly disclose any additional fees to users in the UI.
  4. Consider implementing a tiered fee structure based on transaction volume.
  5. Ensure compliance with local regulations regarding fee disclosure and cryptocurrency purchases.
* Coinbase Onramp supports 100+ cryptocurrencies and 60+ fiat currencies, but focus on USDC for fee-free transactions

data.title: Portfolio Tracking Backend Integration
data.description:
* **User Story:**
  *As a user, I want to track my portfolio, including token holdings, trade history, and performance metrics, so that I can monitor my investments effectively.*
* **Details:**
  * Use TMAI agent to aggregate portfolio data (e.g., token holdings, trade history).
  * Implement calculations for portfolio performance metrics, such as total returns and percentage changes.
  * Include pagination and filtering for trade history.
  * Ensure efficient performance for large datasets.
* **Acceptance Criteria:**
  * Eliza provides aggregated portfolio data dynamically.
  * Performance metrics like returns and changes are calculated accurately.
  * Trade history filtering and pagination work seamlessly.

data.title: Trading Bot Page indexing
data.description:
### **Detailed Description:**

Conduct an in-depth investigation of all queries used for the assigned page to identify potential performance bottlenecks. Determine which columns in which tables should be indexed to enhance query efficiency and provide these recommendations to the data team for implementation.

---

### **Steps:**

1. **Query Analysis:**
   * Collect all queries executed on the assigned page, including those used for data fetching, filtering, and sorting.
   * Identify frequently executed queries and queries with noticeable performance delays.
2. **Identify Columns for Indexing:**
   * Break down each query into its components (e.g., SELECT, WHERE, GROUP BY, ORDER BY).
   * Analyze the columns involved in:
     * **Search/Filter Operations**: Columns used in WHERE clauses.
     * **Sorting**: Columns in ORDER BY clauses.
     * **Joins**: Columns used in JOIN operations.
   * Determine if these columns are already indexed or if additional indexes are required.
3. **Performance Testing:**
   * Simulate query execution to measure current performance metrics (e.g., execution time, rows scanned).
   * Compare performance with and without hypothetical indexing to estimate potential improvements.
4. **Recommendations:**
   * Compile a list of recommended columns and tables for indexing.
   * Include:
     * Table names
     * Column names
     * Justification for indexing (e.g., high usage frequency, reducing scan time)
   * Highlight any trade-offs, such as increased storage or index maintenance overhead.
5. **Collaboration with Data Team:**
   * Share the indexing recommendations with the data team.
   * Work with them to prioritize indexing based on performance impact and database constraints.
6. **Documentation:**
   * Create a report detailing the analysis process, testing results, and recommended indexes.
   * Include examples of queries optimized by the suggested indexes.

---

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* A comprehensive analysis of all queries on the assigned page is completed.
* Key columns and tables requiring indexing are identified and documented.
* Recommendations are provided to the data team, with justifications for each index.
* Performance improvements are validated through testing.

parent.title: Investigate all the queries for indexing

data.title: Mobile App Quality Assurance and Testing
data.description:
As the QA lead for the Token Metrics mobile app revamp, your role is crucial in ensuring the quality and reliability of the app before its release. You will be responsible for comprehensive testing across various devices and scenarios.**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Develop a thorough testing plan covering all aspects of the app.
2. Conduct functional testing on both iOS and Android devices.
3. Perform usability testing to ensure a smooth user experience.
4. Identify, report, and track bugs using our project management tools.
5. Verify bug fixes and conduct regression testing.
6. Collaborate with the development team to ensure all issues are addressed.
7. Provide final QA sign-off before app store submission.

**Testing Areas:**

* Functionality of crypto-related question-asking feature
* AI response accuracy and relevance
* UI/UX elements and design consistency
* App performance and load times
* Cross-device compatibility
* Edge cases and error handling

**Deliverables:**

* Comprehensive test plan document
* Regular testing progress reports
* Detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce
* Final QA report and sign-off document

Please maintain open communication with both the design and development teams throughout the testing process to ensure efficient issue resolution.

**Found bug lists:**

[ENG-5051](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-5051/[group]-mobile-app-testing)
